original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa ni bzhi bcur gcig gis ma tshang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa ni bzhi bcur gcig gis ma tshang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The aspects of the path to omniscience would be forty-nine.

original: de dag bsdus na rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bsdus na rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are combined, there are 172 aspects.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di dag gang la bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di dag gang la bya zhe na /
translated: What are these dharmas called aspects?

original: dang po rtsom pa nyid kyi tshe //
analyzed: dang po rtsom pa nyid kyi tshe //
translated: At the very beginning of the composition,

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa la //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa la //
translated: in the apprehension of the distinctive objective supports,

original: rnam pa zhes ni bya bar brjod //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes ni bya bar brjod //
translated: they are called aspects.

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa la ma yin nam //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa la ma yin nam //
translated: But isn't the characteristic of that taught?

original: dmigs par bzhag pas yang dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs par bzhag pas yang dmigs pa ste /
translated: The objective support is established as the objective support.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad dang / dge ba la sogs pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir dngos po med par rnam par thar pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad dang / dge ba la sogs pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir dngos po med par rnam par thar pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to teach all mundane virtuous dharmas and the virtuous, etc., here the non-existent does not become the antidote of the liberation.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dbye bas zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dbye bas zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of all the aspects are uncontaminated and contaminated, because of the distinction between the disciples and bodhisattvas.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis nyon mongs pa shin tu ma spangs pa'i phyir rnam grangs kyi zag pa dang bcas pa de kho na yin no //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis nyon mongs pa shin tu ma spangs pa'i phyir rnam grangs kyi zag pa dang bcas pa de kho na yin no //
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of paths are only contaminated, because the bodhisattvas have not abandoned the afflictions.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thugs su chud pas sangs rgyas pa'i phyir zag pa med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thugs su chud pas sangs rgyas pa'i phyir zag pa med pa kho na yin no //
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of all aspects are only uncontaminated, because they are the realization of all aspects of all phenomena by the Buddha.

original: gang dri ma med pa'i rnam pa bcu drug las gzhan med do zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang dri ma med pa'i rnam pa bcu drug las gzhan med do zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that there are no other aspects than the sixteen stainless aspects.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam gyi gnyen po'i phyogs la dgongs pa yin gyi de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam gyi gnyen po'i phyogs la dgongs pa yin gyi de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
translated: This is intended as an antidote to the obscuration of afflictions alone, and there is no contradiction with the other.

original: rnam pa'i rnam par @94b 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rnam pa'i rnam par @94b 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary to the chapter on the aspects.

original: // / rnam pa rnams bstan nas ;
analyzed: // / rnam pa rnams bstan nas ;
translated: Having explained the aspects,

original: da ni sbyor ba'i rnam pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sbyor ba'i rnam pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: now the application should be stated.

original: de la re zhig sbyor ba'i rten sbyor ba po yin pas de brjod par bya ba yin pas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig sbyor ba'i rten sbyor ba po yin pas de brjod par bya ba yin pas brjod par bya'o //
translated: There, the basis of application is the one who applies, so that should be stated.

original: de la sbyor ba po rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba po rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There, the one who applies is of four kinds.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas //
translated: One who has served the buddhas,

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun //
translated: planted roots of virtue with them,

original: dge ba'i bshes kyis mgon bcas pa //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes kyis mgon bcas pa //
translated: been taken under the care of spiritual friends,

original: 'di nyan pa yi snod yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyan pa yi snod yin no //
translated: is a vessel for listening to this.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught.

original: de ltar yang rnam pa thams cad mngon par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'i rten gyi dbang du byas nas sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la lhag par bya ba byas pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang rnam pa thams cad mngon par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'i rten gyi dbang du byas nas sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la lhag par bya ba byas pa //
translated: Thus, taking as the basis the one who applies to manifest complete enlightenment in all aspects, it is said that one who has served the victors of the past,

original: 'das pas bstan pa'i gsung rab dang / de bzhin gshegs pa las sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa'i snod yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das pas bstan pa'i gsung rab dang / de bzhin gshegs pa las sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa'i snod yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The vessel for listening to the perfection of wisdom is indicated as follows: the scriptures taught by the past buddhas, the roots of virtue generated in the presence of the tathƒÅgatas, and being sustained by a spiritual friend.

original: 'di nyan pa'i sbyor pa'i rten ni rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyan pa'i sbyor pa'i rten ni rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: The basis for the application of listening is threefold.

original: yang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / de la rjes su mi skrag pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i rten gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: yang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / de la rjes su mi skrag pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i rten gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Moreover, the basis for the application of listening is indicated in terms of the basis for the application of listening, which is to hold, carry, read, master, properly bring to mind, and not be frightened by it, and so on.üîΩThe holy ones assert that the vesselüîΩis relying on the Buddha, asking questions,

original: sangs rgyas bsten dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsten dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod pa //
translated: practicing generosity, ethics, and so on,

original: len dang 'dzin la sogs pa yi //üîΩsnod du dam pa rnams bzhed do //üîΩzhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: len dang 'dzin la sogs pa yi //üîΩsnod du dam pa rnams bzhed do //üîΩzhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: receiving, holding, and so on.

original: gang sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / yongs su zhu ba byas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pa dang ldan pa 'di 'dzin par byed pa'i snod yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / yongs su zhu ba byas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pa dang ldan pa 'di 'dzin par byed pa'i snod yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that one who has served many Buddhas, who has asked questions, who is endowed with the practice of the six perfections, is a vessel for this.

original: gang gi phyir ji skad du bstan pa'i rgyu med pa ni de la mi mos pa dang / mchog tu spong bar byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji skad du bstan pa'i rgyu med pa ni de la mi mos pa dang / mchog tu spong bar byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because of the absence of the causes as they have been taught, one has no interest in it and rejects it utterly, as has been taught.

original: ji skad du bstan pa las bzlog pa ni mi mos pa dang / spong bar byed pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa las bzlog pa ni mi mos pa dang / spong bar byed pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The causes for having no interest and for rejecting it are the opposite of the way it has been taught.

original: mos pa med pa'i rgyus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de spong ba'i rgyu ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: mos pa med pa'i rgyus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de spong ba'i rgyu ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The cause for rejecting the profound perfection of wisdom is not anything else than the cause for having no interest in it.

original: sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: It is the nature of beings.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni shin tu zab pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni shin tu zab pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, it is because this perfection of wisdom is very profound.

original: de zab pa ni mos pa med pa tsam gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de spong ba'i sems can gyi nyes pa'i rgyu @95a * //
analyzed: de zab pa ni mos pa med pa tsam gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de spong ba'i sems can gyi nyes pa'i rgyu @95a * //
translated: That is the cause for mere lack of interest, and therefore it is the cause for the fault of sentient beings who abandon it.üîΩ

original: nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That profundity is the cause of mere lack of interest, so it should be understood as the cause of the fault of sentient beings who reject it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bskyed par 'dod pas rnam pa thams cad du de la brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa na sbyor ba bstan pa'i nye bar 'god pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bskyed par 'dod pas rnam pa thams cad du de la brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa na sbyor ba bstan pa'i nye bar 'god pa'i don yin no //
translated: When it is taught that ‚Äúone who wishes to stand in the knowledge of path aspects and who wishes to generate the knowledge of all aspects should make effort in that in all ways,‚Äù it is the meaning of the application taught.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phan tshun de las 'khrungs pa dang / de'i mthus gsal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phan tshun de las 'khrungs pa dang / de'i mthus gsal ba nyid yin no //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects and the perfection of wisdom are mutually born from that and are clarified by the power of that.

original: ji lta bu'i don gyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i don gyis yin zhe na /
translated: In what sense is that so?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'khrungs pa ni mngon par bskrun pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'khrungs pa ni mngon par bskrun pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is born from the perfection of wisdom, is produced.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang gsal bar rtogs pa la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir de bas na rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang las 'khrungs pa dang / mthus gsal bar smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang gsal bar rtogs pa la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir de bas na rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang las 'khrungs pa dang / mthus gsal bar smos pa yin no //
translated: And because the perfection of wisdom is illuminated by the power of the knowledge of all modes, etc.

original: bstan pa'i snod kyi nyes pa spang pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa'i snod kyi nyes pa spang pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the faults of a vessel for the teaching,

original: legs par nyon la yid la legs par zung shig ces gsungs te /
analyzed: legs par nyon la yid la legs par zung shig ces gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúListen well and thoroughly take it to mind!‚Äù

original: snod kha spub dang / mi gtsang pa dang / rdol ba rnams nyan pa'i snod ngan pa spangs pa bstan pa'i snod yin par bstan to //
analyzed: snod kha spub dang / mi gtsang pa dang / rdol ba rnams nyan pa'i snod ngan pa spangs pa bstan pa'i snod yin par bstan to //
translated: The faults of a vessel for listening are shown to be the faults of an inverted vessel, a dirty vessel, and a leaky vessel.

original: des ni bstan pa'i snod kyi nyes pa gsum spangs pa yin no //üîΩshes rab 'chal pa ni legs par zhes gsungs pas so //üîΩrnam par g-yeng ba'i nyes pa ni nyon cig ces gsungs pas so //
analyzed: des ni bstan pa'i snod kyi nyes pa gsum spangs pa yin no // shes rab 'chal pa ni legs par zhes gsungs pas so // rnam par g-yeng ba'i nyes pa ni nyon cig ces gsungs pas so //
translated: By this, the three faults of a vessel for the teaching are eliminated.üîΩThe fault of a bad vessel is eliminated by ‚Äúlisten well!‚ÄùüîΩThe fault of distraction is eliminated by ‚Äúlisten well!‚Äù

original: 'dun pa dman pa'i nyes pa ni yid la legs par zung shig ces gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'dun pa dman pa'i nyes pa ni yid la legs par zung shig ces gsungs pas so //
translated: The fault of low aspiration is eliminated by ‚Äúthoroughly take it to mind!‚Äù

original: sbyor ba'i rten bstan nas sbyor ba rnams brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i rten bstan nas sbyor ba rnams brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having explained the basis of the application, the applications themselves should be explained.

original: de ni rnam pa nyi shur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa nyi shur blta bar bya ste /
translated: They should be regarded as twenty kinds.

original: gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
translated: Because they do not dwell on form, etc.

original: de la gnas pa bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la gnas pa bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they stop dwelling on them.

original: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
analyzed: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
translated: Because the reality of those is profound.

original: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: Because those are difficult to fathom.üîΩBecause they are immeasurable.

original: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun ring rtog phyir dang // lung bstan phyir mi ldog phyir dang // nges 'byung bar chad med nyid dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med dang // chos dang chos min sogs ming mthong //
analyzed: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun ring rtog phyir dang // lung bstan phyir mi ldog phyir dang // nges 'byung bar chad med nyid dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med dang // chos dang chos min sogs ming mthong //
translated: Because they are conceived with great difficulty and for a long time, because of prediction, because of irreversibility, because of definite deliverance, because of the absence of obstacles, because of the nearness of enlightenment, because of swiftness, because of the increase and decrease of the benefit of others, and because of the vision of the names of things and nonthings, etc.

original: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
translated: They do not see the inconceivability of form, etc.

original: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi @95b rtog ;
analyzed: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi @95b rtog ;
translated: They do not conceive the signs of form, etc.

original: /'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //
analyzed: /'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //
translated: They give the jewel of the fruit, and they are the purification with its boundary.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs zhes bya ba nas de gzugs la brtson par mi byed do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs zhes bya ba nas de gzugs la brtson par mi byed do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The practice of not apprehending form, etc. is taught in the passage beginning with ‚Äúform‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe does not strive in form.üîΩ‚Äù The prohibition of dwelling in the unmixed perfections is taught in the passage beginning with ‚Äúhe does not strive in form‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe does not strive in the knowledge of all modes.

original: ma 'dres pa'i bar la gnas pa bkag pa de la brtson par byed pa rjes su gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i bar la gnas pa bkag pa de la brtson par byed pa rjes su gnang ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äù The permission to strive in the practice of not apprehending form, etc. is taught in the passage beginning with ‚Äúhe does not strive in form‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe does not strive in the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äù Why is that?üîΩBecause he does not apprehend form, etc.

original: sbyor ba dang rab tu sbyor ba ni gang gzugs la mi sbyor //üîΩgzugs la sbyor bar mi byed do //üîΩde bzhin du gzugs la brtson par mi byed do zhes bya ba nas /üîΩrnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang rab tu sbyor ba ni gang gzugs la mi sbyor // gzugs la sbyor bar mi byed do // de bzhin du gzugs la brtson par mi byed do zhes bya ba nas / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du sbyor ba yin te /
translated: The practice and the application are taught in the passage beginning with ‚Äúhe does not apply himself to form‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe does not apply himself to the knowledge of all modes.üîΩ‚Äù The application is taught in the passage beginning with ‚Äúhe does not apply himself to form‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe does not apply himself to the knowledge of all modes.

original: rjes su gnang ba yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su gnang ba yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äù The permission to strive in the practice of not apprehending form, etc. is taught in the passage beginning with ‚Äúhe does not apply himself to form‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe does not apply himself to the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù Why is that?

original: gang gzugs la sogs pa sngon dang / phyi ma dang / dbus su mi dmigs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang gzugs la sogs pa sngon dang / phyi ma dang / dbus su mi dmigs so zhes bstan to //
translated: Because he does not apprehend form, etc. in the past, future, or present.

original: zab pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir rab tu gnas pa mi dmigs pa'i don gyis thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: zab pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir rab tu gnas pa mi dmigs pa'i don gyis thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The profound application is the application of the knowledge of all aspects, because the suchness of form and so on is profound.üîΩ

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab par bstan pa yin no //üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i gting dpag dka' ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa gting dpag dka' pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi dri ma med pa'i don gyis lam shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab par bstan pa yin no // gzugs la sogs pa'i gting dpag dka' ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa gting dpag dka' pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi dri ma med pa'i don gyis lam shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The profound application is that, because the suchness of form, etc. is profound, it is taught in the perfection of wisdom from the viewpoint of the knowledge of all aspects, in the sense of the non-apprehension of the establishment of form, etc.üîΩThe profundity of form, etc. is taught in the sense of the natural purity of form, etc.

original: de dag gis gting dpag dka' ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis gting dpag dka' ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The difficulty of fathoming form, etc. is taught in the sense of the difficulty of fathoming form, etc. from the viewpoint of the knowledge of paths.

original: tshad med pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa tshad med pa'i phyir mtha' mi dmigs pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa tshad med pa'i phyir mtha' mi dmigs pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The immeasurable application is that, because form, etc. is immeasurable, it is taught from the viewpoint of the knowledge of all aspects, in the sense of the non-apprehension of a limit.

original: de'i tshad med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshad med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that, because of the immeasurability of form, etc.,

original: sbyor ba rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid kyis bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa ni gang zab mo mngon bar byang chub pa dang / thun mong ma yin par mngon par byang chub pa dang / bla na med par byang chub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid kyis bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan bstan pa ni gang zab mo mngon bar byang chub pa dang / thun mong ma yin par mngon par byang chub pa dang / bla na med par byang chub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The other enumerations of the three kinds of practice are taught in terms of the profound manifest enlightenment, the uncommon manifest enlightenment, and the unexcelled manifest enlightenment.

original: rnam pa gsum du gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that they are stated in three ways.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, they are three kinds:

original: sbyor ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po go rims ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya ste /üîΩgang yang gal te gzugs zab ces bya ba dang / @96a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po go rims ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya ste / gang yang gal te gzugs zab ces bya ba dang / @96a * //
translated: with small, middling, and great practice, respectively.üîΩIt is also said, ‚ÄúIf one does not practice that the form is profound,

original: gzugs gting dpag dka' zhes bya ba dang / gzugs tshad med do zhes bya bar mi sbyor na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gzugs gting dpag dka' zhes bya ba dang / gzugs tshad med do zhes bya bar mi sbyor na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: that the form is difficult to fathom, and that the form is immeasurable, one practices the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: ma 'dres pa'i bar du dbye ba rnam pa gsum la dpyod pa bkag pa'i phyir de ltar spyod pa ni rjes su gnang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i bar du dbye ba rnam pa gsum la dpyod pa bkag pa'i phyir de ltar spyod pa ni rjes su gnang ba ma yin no //
translated: Because the analysis of the three kinds of distinctions is prohibited, it is not permitted to practice in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gzugs zab ces bya ba dang / gting dpag dka' ba dang / tshad med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba nas ma 'dres pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs zab ces bya ba dang / gting dpag dka' ba dang / tshad med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba nas ma 'dres pa'i bar du'o //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúdeep form‚Äù and ‚Äúdifficult to fathom‚Äù and ‚Äúimmeasurable‚Äù is not form, up to not unconditioned.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that it is not the nature of form, etc.

original: las dang po pa spangs nas tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas mngon par byang chub pa la spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: las dang po pa spangs nas tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas mngon par byang chub pa la spyod pa yin te /
translated: Having abandoned the beginner, one practices for a long time with great difficulty for the sake of manifest enlightenment.

original: las dang po pa rnams zab mos skrag ste /
analyzed: las dang po pa rnams zab mos skrag ste /
translated: Because beginners are frightened by the profound,

original: dang po skrag pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po skrag pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: fear arises in the beginning.

original: gting dpag dka' ba nyid kyis na spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gting dpag dka' ba nyid kyis na spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is difficult to fathom, it is abandoned,

original: mi dge ba'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is tainted by the latent tendencies of non-virtue.

original: tshad med pa nyid kyis na kun du skrag pa skye bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod ma yin pa thob pas gsum gyi rgyus las dang po pa'i mdun du ma yin gyi phyir mi ldog pa'i mdun du brjod par rjes su gnang ba yin
analyzed: tshad med pa nyid kyis na kun du skrag pa skye bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod ma yin pa thob pas gsum gyi rgyus las dang po pa'i mdun du ma yin gyi phyir mi ldog pa'i mdun du brjod par rjes su gnang ba yin
translated: They are for those who are irreversible.

original: no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: las dang po pa rnams skrag pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis ngan song du 'gro ba'i las bsags pas tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa
analyzed: las dang po pa rnams skrag pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis ngan song du 'gro ba'i las bsags pas tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa
translated: Because beginners, due to fear and so on, accumulate karma that leads to the lower realms and thus they attain complete enlightenment as a perfect buddha in unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment after a long time and with great difficulty.

original: yin no // lung bstan pa thob pa'i sbyor ba ni gang 'dod cing mi 'jigs pa dang / rmi lam gyi nang du yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yid la byed pa ni lung bstan pa nye ba yin te /
analyzed: yin no // lung bstan pa thob pa'i sbyor ba ni gang 'dod cing mi 'jigs pa dang / rmi lam gyi nang du yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yid la byed pa ni lung bstan pa nye ba yin te /
translated: The application of attaining prophecy is that if one wishes and is fearless, and if one mentally engages in the six perfections even in dreams, then one is close to prophecy.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis las mi 'da' bar lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩphyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba ni gang rmi lam gyi nang du 'thad pa'i rigs pas 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa dag ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bgyi ba dag go zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩnges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba ni gang skyes bu 'brog dgon pa dpag tshad brgya pa zhig nas 'byung ba'i dpes bar chad byed pa'i chos las 'das par don gyis yang dag par bstan to zhes bstan @96b pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis las mi 'da' bar lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur ro // phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba ni gang rmi lam gyi nang du 'thad pa'i rigs pas 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa dag ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bgyi ba dag go zhes bstan pa yin no // nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba ni gang skyes bu 'brog dgon pa dpag tshad brgya pa zhig nas 'byung ba'i dpes bar chad byed pa'i chos las 'das par don gyis yang dag par bstan to zhes bstan @96b pa yin no //
translated: He will receive a prophecy from one or two Tathagatas.üîΩThe application of irreversibility is taught by the example of the man who, in a dream, is told by a reliable person that he will be killed, and who, on being seized, is told that he will not be killed.üîΩThe application of definite deliverance is taught by the example of the man who, having left a wilderness, sees a village.

original: bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba ni gang skyes bu rgya mtsho chen po'i dpes nye bar bstan pa na ldum bu la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mthong bar bstan pa'i don zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba ni gang skyes bu rgya mtsho chen po'i dpes nye bar bstan pa na ldum bu la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mthong bar bstan pa'i don zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The application of uninterruptedness is taught by the example of the man who, having left a great city, sees a great city.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nye bar sbyor ba ni gang shing gi lo ma dang / 'dab ma lhags pa'i dpes zag pa med pa'i chos gsar gyi rten can cig la gnas par don gyis bstan pa yin te zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nye bar sbyor ba ni gang shing gi lo ma dang / 'dab ma lhags pa'i dpes zag pa med pa'i chos gsar gyi rten can cig la gnas par don gyis bstan pa yin te zhes bstan to //
translated: The application to approaching complete enlightenment is taught by the example of the falling leaves and branches, which implicitly teaches that one abides in the support of the new uncontaminated dharmas.

original: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba ni gang bud med sbrum ma btsar nye ba'i dpes rten gyi sgrub pa'i chos ni 'bras bu'i chos kyi sku myur du mngon bar grub par don gyis bstan pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩde bzhin du gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i spobs pas gsal bar dpe bzhis byas te /
analyzed: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba ni gang bud med sbrum ma btsar nye ba'i dpes rten gyi sgrub pa'i chos ni 'bras bu'i chos kyi sku myur du mngon bar grub par don gyis bstan pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no // de bzhin du gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i spobs pas gsal bar dpe bzhis byas te /
translated: The application to quickly attaining complete enlightenment is taught by the example of a pregnant woman about to give birth, which implicitly teaches that the dharmas of the support are quickly accomplished as the resultant dharmakƒÅya.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba nas brtsams te /
translated: In the same way, the elder ≈öƒÅriputra clarified with four examples, beginning with the application to renunciation.

original: myur du mngon par byang chub pa'i bar gyi rnam pa thams cad mngon par byang chub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du mngon par byang chub pa'i bar gyi rnam pa thams cad mngon par byang chub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and up to ‚Äúquickly manifest complete enlightenment,‚Äù in terms of the complete enlightenment of all aspects.

original: bar chad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar chad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will be irreversible.‚Äù

original: nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will be close.‚Äù

original: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba ni gang rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba ni gang rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The application for the benefit of others is taught beginning from ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, thus it is, thus it is, that those bodhisattva great beings benefit many beings, make many beings happy,‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor la /
translated: up to ‚Äúthey themselves turn the wheel of the Dharma,

original: gzhan dag kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la yang dag par bskul lo zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la yang dag par bskul lo zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and they encourage others to turn the wheel of the Dharma.‚Äù

original: de rnams ni gnyi ga'i don byed pa nyid kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsgrub pa la shin tu gtod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de rnams ni gnyi ga'i don byed pa nyid kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsgrub pa la shin tu gtod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Since those are the very things that accomplish the aims of both oneself and others, they are the very things that are dedicated to the accomplishment of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The application of non-increase and non-decrease is the complete perfection of the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa mthong ba bkag pas de bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar rjes su gnang ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa mthong ba bkag pas de bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar rjes su gnang ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: From the beginning, the vision of increase and decrease of form up to the knowledge of all aspects is prohibited, and it is taught that the complete perfection of that cultivation is permitted.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ni gang yang chos dang / @97a * //
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ni gang yang chos dang / @97a * //
translated: The application of the non-apprehension of dharma and non-dharma is the complete perfection of the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos ma yin pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bkag pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bkag pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The non-existence of the past, future, and present, the non-existence of virtue and nonvirtue, the conditioned and the unconditioned, the realms of desire, form, and formlessness, the perfections, and so on up to the non-existence of the knowledge of all modes is refuted in the same way as above.

original: de bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni gnang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni gnang ba ma yin no //
translated: The completion of the meditation is not permitted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni phyir ldog pa med pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni phyir ldog pa med pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of dharmas is not reversible.

original: phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid zlog par byed kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid zlog par byed kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The characteristic of error is reversed, but not the characteristic of the intrinsic nature.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes 'gog pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes pa bkag pas de bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par gnang ba
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes 'gog pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes pa bkag pas de bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par gnang ba
translated: The application of the cessation of the discernment of inconceivable aspects is the permission to complete the cultivation of the meditation that stops the discernment of inconceivable aspects from form up to the culmination of omniscience.

original: yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs dang / de'i mtshan ma dang / rang bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du de'i mtshan ma dang / de'i rang bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pas na rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs dang / de'i mtshan ma dang / rang bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du de'i mtshan ma dang / de'i rang bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pas na rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The application of non-conceptuality is the non-conceptuality from form up to the knowledge of all aspects, by not conceptualizing its signs and its nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes su 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes su 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because form and so forth are inconceivable, it is the non-conceptuality that is suitable. This is what is taught.

original: 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa'i sbyor ba ni gang rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyi rin po che ster ba yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin
analyzed: 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa'i sbyor ba ni gang rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyi rin po che ster ba yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin
translated: The application of the jewel result is the perfection of wisdom, because it bestows the jewel from the result of stream enterer and so on up to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: po che'i phung po ste chos rin po che'i phung po rnams bsgrub pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: po che'i phung po ste chos rin po che'i phung po rnams bsgrub pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is a heap of jewels, because it establishes the heaps of precious Dharma.

original: rnam par dag pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dag pa'i phung po'i zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dag pa'i phung po'i zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The application of purity is the perfection of wisdom, because it purifies form and so on.

original: sa mtshams kyi sbyor ba ni gang rin po che dang 'dra bar bar chad mang ba nyid kyi phyir lo'i bar gyi bri ba la sogs pa la mngon bar brtson pa gtang bar mi bya zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sa mtshams kyi sbyor ba ni gang rin po che dang 'dra bar bar chad mang ba nyid kyi phyir lo'i bar gyi bri ba la sogs pa la mngon bar brtson pa gtang bar mi bya zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The application of the boundary is the perfection of wisdom, because it is taught that one should not give up striving in writing and so on for a year and so forth, because there are many obstacles similar to jewels.

original: lo smos pa de tsam gyi dus tshigs la sogs pas rkyen tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo smos pa de tsam gyi dus tshigs la sogs pas rkyen tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The year is mentioned because the conditions are assembled at that time.

original: spag nya pal ka'i gzhung dang @97b mthun par lo'i bar du spyod do //
analyzed: spag nya pal ka'i gzhung dang @97b mthun par lo'i bar du spyod do //
translated: The practice is for a year, in accordance with the text of the Potala.

original: lo 'das nas 'dod pa med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gang gis lo skor du mthong ba des zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: lo 'das nas 'dod pa med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gang gis lo skor du mthong ba des zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
translated: After a year, there is no desire, and so on, and one sees the year as it is, and so on.

original: sbyor ba nyi shu po de dag gi go rims 'di ni rigs pa'i tshul nyid yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyi shu po de dag gi go rims 'di ni rigs pa'i tshul nyid yin te /
translated: The order of these twenty practices is the very way of reasoning.

original: chos thams cad la mngon bar zhen pa med par gnas pa dang / de la mi sbyor ba de dag ni zab pa dang / gting dpag dka' ba dang / tshad med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon bar zhen pa med par gnas pa dang / de la mi sbyor ba de dag ni zab pa dang / gting dpag dka' ba dang / tshad med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who abides without attachment to any dharma, and who does not practice, will understand the profound, the difficult to fathom, and the immeasurable.

original: sbyor ba ma yin pa byed pa nyid kyis ni las dang po pa ni tshegs chen pos 'thob bo //
analyzed: sbyor ba ma yin pa byed pa nyid kyis ni las dang po pa ni tshegs chen pos 'thob bo //
translated: By the very non-practice, the beginner attains with great difficulty.

original: de las gzhan pa ni bde blag tu lung bstan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob nas nges par 'byung ba dang / bar chad med par 'gyur ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nye bar 'gyur ba dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni bde blag tu lung bstan pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob nas nges par 'byung ba dang / bar chad med par 'gyur ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nye bar 'gyur ba dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is certain to emerge from the stage of non-returning, he will have uninterrupted progress, he will be close to full enlightenment, and he will quickly reach full enlightenment.

original: des ni gzhan gyi don byed cing 'phel ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa dang / chos sam chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'bras bur rin po che 'byin pas mchog tu rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: des ni gzhan gyi don byed cing 'phel ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa dang / chos sam chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'bras bur rin po che 'byin pas mchog tu rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa thob pa ste /
translated: He performs benefit for others, he is free from increase and decrease, he is free from all discriminations of Dharma and non-Dharma, and he is non-conceptual. He attains the ultimate perfection of supreme purity, and he produces the jewel of the result.

original: snga ma bzhin du lo'i par du brtson pas sems can gyi rgyud yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du lo'i par du brtson pas sems can gyi rgyud yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
translated: As before, he purifies the stream of beings by striving for a year.

original: de dag de ltar byas nas sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de dag de ltar byas nas sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Having done that, the root of virtue planted in the Tathagatas, having served the former victors, and so on up to, if they are not liberated, may I not be fully enlightened.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'i bar du lo skor gyis bris pa zhes bya ba'i gzhung gang yin pa des ni sbyor ba'i rten rnam pa bzhi dang / sbyor ba gang yin pa rnam pa nyi shur 'gyur ro zhes des bshad do //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'i bar du lo skor gyis bris pa zhes bya ba'i gzhung gang yin pa des ni sbyor ba'i rten rnam pa bzhi dang / sbyor ba gang yin pa rnam pa nyi shur 'gyur ro zhes des bshad do //
translated: This passage, from the beginning up to, if they are not liberated, may I not be fully enlightened, explains the four kinds of basis for the application and the twenty kinds of application.

original: sbyor ba'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: The explanation of the application is finished.

original: // / sbyor ba brtan nas de'i phan yon brjod par bya ste /üîΩbdud kyi mthu bcom pa la sogs //
analyzed: // / sbyor ba brtan nas de'i phan yon brjod par bya ste / bdud kyi mthu bcom pa la sogs //
translated: Having stabilized the application, its benefits should be stated.

original: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o //
translated: The benefits are the fourteen qualities,üîΩthe destruction of the power of Mara, and so on.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught.

original: de la bdud bcom pa'i yon tan ni gang bdud bar chad byed pa brtson par zhugs su zin yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing yongs su bzung ba'i mthus bcom pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la bdud bcom pa'i yon tan ni gang bdud bar chad byed pa brtson par zhugs su zin yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing yongs su bzung ba'i mthus bcom pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The quality of having conquered Mara is the cause of being thought of and protected by the Buddhas of the ten directions, even when one is engaged in striving to conquer the Mara of the afflictions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu chos nyid kyis dgongs par mdzad pa de ni rig pa yin no //üîΩzhes bstan @98a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu chos nyid kyis dgongs par mdzad pa de ni rig pa yin no // zhes bstan @98a * //
translated: ‚Äú Shariputra, it is because it is the nature of things that one is thought of by the Buddhas.‚ÄùüîΩThe quality of being thought of and known by the Buddhas is taught as the cause of being known by the Dharma teachers.

original: to ; sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing mkhyen pa'i yon tan ni gang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba nas chos smra ba de la sangs rgyas kyi dgongs par shes pas lhag par mos pa brtan po skye zhing spro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: to ; sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing mkhyen pa'i yon tan ni gang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba nas chos smra ba de la sangs rgyas kyi dgongs par shes pas lhag par mos pa brtan po skye zhing spro bar 'gyur te /
translated: ‚Äú That Dharma teacher will have firm faith and enthusiasm, knowing that he is thought of by the Buddhas.‚Äù

original: che ge mo la bdud kyis bar bcad pa'i go skabs kyis glags rnyed bar mi 'gyur bar shes par byed pa'i ched du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: che ge mo la bdud kyis bar bcad pa'i go skabs kyis glags rnyed bar mi 'gyur bar shes par byed pa'i ched du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught for the purpose of knowing that Mara will not find an opportunity to create an obstacle for someone.

original: sangs rgyas kyis mngon sum du mdzad pa'i yon tan ni gang ye shes kyis mkhyen cing de la spyan gyis gzigs par mdzad do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis mngon sum du mdzad pa'i yon tan ni gang ye shes kyis mkhyen cing de la spyan gyis gzigs par mdzad do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The qualities that the Buddha has realized are taught as those that are known by wisdom and seen with the eye of wisdom.

original: don rjes su dpag pa dang / log pa'i shes pa bsal ba'i ched du gnyis ka smos par mdzad do //
analyzed: don rjes su dpag pa dang / log pa'i shes pa bsal ba'i ched du gnyis ka smos par mdzad do //
translated: Both are mentioned in order to eliminate inference about the meaning and wrong understanding.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'i yon tan ni gang de dag theg pa chen po dang ldan pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'i yon tan ni gang de dag theg pa chen po dang ldan pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The qualities that are close to perfect complete enlightenment are taught as those that, through possessing the Great Vehicle, become close to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: don chen po nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan ni gang yi ger bris nas glegs bam bcangs pa tsam gyi don chen po dang / phan yon chen po dang / 'bras bu chen po dang / rnam par smin pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don chen po nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan ni gang yi ger bris nas glegs bam bcangs pa tsam gyi don chen po dang / phan yon chen po dang / 'bras bu chen po dang / rnam par smin pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The qualities of great meaning and so on are taught as those that, by merely writing them down and keeping them in a book, become of great meaning, of great benefit, of great fruit, and of great maturation.

original: de la sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral ba nyid dang / bde 'gror gzhol ba nyid dang / yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes la yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du tshig bzhi bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral ba nyid dang / bde 'gror gzhol ba nyid dang / yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes la yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du tshig bzhi bshad pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, the four phrases are explained in order to show that the bodhisattva is never separated from the Buddha, is directed toward good destinies, is enlightened in perfect enlightenment, and even after nirvana, engages in the welfare of others.

original: yun ring po nas smin pas rnam par smin pa yin par blta bar bya'o //üîΩyul dpyad pa'i yon tan ni gang lho phyogs kyi rgyud nas bar ta ni dang / byang phyogs kyi rgyud du spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩyul la sogs pa dpyad pas chos smra ba la sangs rgyas rnams dgongs par 'gyur ba la so mi nya za ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring po nas smin pas rnam par smin pa yin par blta bar bya'o // yul dpyad pa'i yon tan ni gang lho phyogs kyi rgyud nas bar ta ni dang / byang phyogs kyi rgyud du spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / yul la sogs pa dpyad pas chos smra ba la sangs rgyas rnams dgongs par 'gyur ba la so mi nya za ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should see that the bodhisattva is fully matured through a long period of time.

original: phyi ma'i dus zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa ste ;
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa ste ;
translated: The qualities of examining the place are stated as: ‚ÄúIn the southern region, in the western region, in the northern region, in the eastern region, in the intermediate directions, in the zenith and nadir, in the ten directions, in the world systems of the ten directions, in the world systems of the trichiliocosm, in the world systems of the great trichiliocosm, in the world systems of
