world systems of the great trichiliocosm of the ten directions in the three times, in the world systems of the great trichiliocosm

original: phyi ma'i dus na rkyen tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus na rkyen tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the future, the conditions will be assembled.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i yon tan ni gang skrag pa la sogs par mi 'gyur ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa dkar po'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i yon tan ni gang skrag pa la sogs par mi 'gyur ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa dkar po'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The quality of perfecting all the uncontaminated dharmas is shown by the fact that there is no fear, etc., and by the fact that all the wholesome dharmas, such as the six perfections, are perfected.

original: smra ba'i @98b skyes bu'i yon tan ni gang yang ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de rnams la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: smra ba'i @98b skyes bu'i yon tan ni gang yang ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de rnams la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The quality of being a speaker is shown by the fact that they are light, and by the fact that all the Buddhas speak to those sons and daughters of good family about the knowledge of all modes.

original: mi phyed pa'i yon tan ni yang brtan par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i yon tan ni yang brtan par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The quality of being unbreakable is shown by the fact that they become more and more firm.

original: bdud dang bdud kyi rigs kyi lha rnams kyis kyang byang chub las bzlog par mi nus par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud dang bdud kyi rigs kyi lha rnams kyis kyang byang chub las bzlog par mi nus par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The quality of being unassailable by demons and gods of the demon class is shown by the fact that they cannot be turned away from enlightenment.

original: dge ba thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan skye ba'i yon tan ni gang yang dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / mgu ba rgya chen po skye bar 'gyur zhing skye bo mang po yang dge ba'i chos la 'god par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan skye ba'i yon tan ni gang yang dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / mgu ba rgya chen po skye bar 'gyur zhing skye bo mang po yang dge ba'i chos la 'god par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The quality of generating the uncommon good qualities of virtue is taught by the statement: ‚ÄúOne generates great joy, clarity, and satisfaction, and one establishes many beings in virtue.‚Äù

original: de yang dga' ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos tshol ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dga' ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos tshol ba'o //
translated: Joy is the pursuit of supramundane qualities.

original: dang ba ni sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ba ni sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la brten pa yin no //
translated: Clarity is based on the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha.

original: mgu ba ni dge ba la sems rangs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mgu ba ni dge ba la sems rangs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Satisfaction is the delight of the mind in virtue.

original: dam bcas pa'i yon tan ni ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub pa'i yon tan ni gang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyan sngar bdag gis srog chags brgya stong phrag mang po byang chub la rab tu dgod par bgyi'o zhes sangs rgyas rnams rjes su dgyes pa'i tshig smras
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i yon tan ni ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub pa'i yon tan ni gang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyan sngar bdag gis srog chags brgya stong phrag mang po byang chub la rab tu dgod par bgyi'o zhes sangs rgyas rnams rjes su dgyes pa'i tshig smras
translated: The quality of accomplishing what one has promised is the statement of the words that please the buddhas: ‚ÄúIn the presence of all the buddhas, I will establish many hundreds of thousands of living beings in enlightenment.‚Äù

original: pa gang yin pa de ni dam bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs par byed pa'i shes par byed pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa gang yin pa de ni dam bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs par byed pa'i shes par byed pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the knowledge that fulfills the promise.

original: 'bras bu rgya chen po 'dzin pa'i yon tan ni gang de dag mos pa rgya che ba nyid kyi las dang / rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba bstan pa yin no //üîΩsems can gyi don bsgrub pa'i yon tan ni gang des 'bras bu phyi dang / nang gi sems can de dag nyid la yongs su gtong ba dang / sangs rgyas mngon sum du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgya chen po 'dzin pa'i yon tan ni gang de dag mos pa rgya che ba nyid kyi las dang / rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba bstan pa yin no // sems can gyi don bsgrub pa'i yon tan ni gang des 'bras bu phyi dang / nang gi sems can de dag nyid la yongs su gtong ba dang / sangs rgyas mngon sum du 'gyur zhing /
translated: The quality of embracing the vast result shows the function of that vast aspiration and the embracing of the evolutionary development.

original: gzhan dang gzhan du brten par 'gyur bas sems can gyi don gong nas gong du bsgrub cing nyams su len par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du brten par 'gyur bas sems can gyi don gong nas gong du bsgrub cing nyams su len par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The quality of accomplishing the welfare of living beings shows the dedication of that result to the very beings who are the objects of the evolutionary development, and the practice of accomplishing the welfare of living beings more and more by the presence of the Buddha and by the support of one another.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma rnyed pa dang / ma tshang ba rnyed pa las go bzlog pas tshang ba rnyed pa'i yon tan ni gang 'di dag tshol ba dang / yongs su tshol ba'i tshe la las ni thob par 'gyur ba dang /üîΩthob par mi 'gyur ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i ma tshang ba thob pas brtson 'grus mi gtong ba de dag ni skye ba rjes su zin kyang sh'a ri'i bu de @99a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma rnyed pa dang / ma tshang ba rnyed pa las go bzlog pas tshang ba rnyed pa'i yon tan ni gang 'di dag tshol ba dang / yongs su tshol ba'i tshe la las ni thob par 'gyur ba dang / thob par mi 'gyur ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i ma tshang ba thob pas brtson 'grus mi gtong ba de dag ni skye ba rjes su zin kyang sh'a ri'i bu de @99a * //
translated: The opposite of not finding the perfection of wisdom and finding what is incomplete is finding what is complete. The qualities of that are: when they are seeking and thoroughly seeking, some will obtain it and some will not.

original: dag 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dag 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Those who do not give up effort because of obtaining what is incomplete for definite emergence, they will accomplish it, ≈öƒÅriputra, even if they are born in the intermediate state.üîΩThis is the teaching.

original: de chos nyid kyi rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de chos nyid kyi rigs pa yin te /
translated: This is the reasoning of reality.

original: nges par thob par 'gyur bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par thob par 'gyur bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because of definitely obtaining it, they will obtain up to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment. This is the teaching.

original: phan yon gyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: phan yon gyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the benefits.

original: // / phan yon bshad nas de'i bar chad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / phan yon bshad nas de'i bar chad brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having explained the benefits, the obstacles to that should be stated.

original: skyon ni bcu tshan bzhir bcas pa //
analyzed: skyon ni bcu tshan bzhir bcas pa //
translated: The faults are stated in four groups of ten.

original: drug tu nges par rtogs par bya //
analyzed: drug tu nges par rtogs par bya //
translated: One should understand them to be definitely six.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: bzhi bcu rtsa drug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzhi bcu rtsa drug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: forty-six.

original: de dag kyang tshegs chen pos thob pa ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni des shin tu phyis te spobs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshegs chen pos thob pa ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa dka' bar yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni des shin tu phyis te spobs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is taught that when one attains them with great difficulty, and when one perfects the difficult perfections, then one's eloquence arises after a long time.

original: spobs pa myur zhes pa ni gang dang po pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i gnas su ha cang myur bar spobs pa skye ba na'ang bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: spobs pa myur zhes pa ni gang dang po pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i gnas su ha cang myur bar spobs pa skye ba na'ang bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that when one's eloquence arises too quickly, even in the stage of first practicing the perfections, one should recognize that as the work of Mara.

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len du 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum ni gang yang glal ba dang / dgod pa dang / phan tshun ste ga cing 'dri na lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i bar chad yin par bstan pa nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len du 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum ni gang yang glal ba dang / dgod pa dang / phan tshun ste ga cing 'dri na lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i bar chad yin par bstan pa nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: The three kinds of physical indisposition are yawning, laughing, and mutual questioning, which are taught to be obstacles to the transformation of the body.

original: steg pa ni rang gi yo byad kyis gzhan gyi yan lag bzhi bkod pa'o //
analyzed: steg pa ni rang gi yo byad kyis gzhan gyi yan lag bzhi bkod pa'o //
translated: The pride is the arrangement of the four limbs of one's own equipment.

original: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni gsum ste /
analyzed: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni gsum ste /
translated: The mental depravities are three:

original: sems g-yeng ba dang / phan tshun yi ge gzhan la chags shing 'dri zhing nyan pa dang / bdag gis 'di'i gting mi rnyed do zhes bya ba zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: sems g-yeng ba dang / phan tshun yi ge gzhan la chags shing 'dri zhing nyan pa dang / bdag gis 'di'i gting mi rnyed do zhes bya ba zhes smra zhing /
translated: the distraction of the mind, the attachment to and the writing and listening to the other's syllables, and the saying I do not find the depth of this.

original: sems bskyed nas langs te 'gro ba ni sems kyi bar chad byed pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems bskyed nas langs te 'gro ba ni sems kyi bar chad byed pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The arising and going is the teaching of the mental obstruction.

original: gzhan la chags pa ni gang log par rtog cing dmigs pas dngos po la chags pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la chags pa ni gang log par rtog cing dmigs pas dngos po la chags pa ste /
translated: The attachment to others is the attachment to things by the wrong conception and observation,

original: phan tshun smra ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun smra ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: the mutual talk.

original: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i kha ton la sogs pa byed pa ni gang yang lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba de nyid kyis mgo bo dang / yang sems kyi rnam par 'gyur ba de nyid kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa ni bar du gcod pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i kha ton la sogs pa byed pa ni gang yang lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba de nyid kyis mgo bo dang / yang sems kyi rnam par 'gyur ba de nyid kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa ni bar du gcod pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The recitation, etc. that is produced by improper means is any bodily transformation, and the retention, etc. that is produced by the transformation of the mind is taught to be an obstacle.

original: phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang yang 'dir ni bdag lung ma bstan te /
analyzed: phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang yang 'dir ni bdag lung ma bstan te /
translated: The reason for turning away is that he has no faith, as is taught:

original: bdag gi ming yang ma brjod do zhes ma dad par gyur nas zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi ming yang ma brjod do zhes ma dad par gyur nas zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHere the self is not declared, and even the name of the self is not mentioned.‚Äù

original: yul la sogs par brtag pa med pa'i @99b rigs pas so //
analyzed: yul la sogs par brtag pa med pa'i @99b rigs pas so //
translated: The reason is that there is no investigation of the object, etc.

original: rgyu la mngon bar zhen pa'i nyams pa ni gang shing gi rtsa ba spangs te 'dab ma dang / yal gal 'ju bar byed pa'i dpes ni rgyu yongs su nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la mngon bar zhen pa'i nyams pa ni gang shing gi rtsa ba spangs te 'dab ma dang / yal gal 'ju bar byed pa'i dpes ni rgyu yongs su nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The degeneration of clinging to the cause is taught by the example of the man who abandons the root of the tree and seeks the juice in the leaves and branches, because he degenerates from the cause.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba ni 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rdzogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩgya nom pa'i ro myang ba las nyams par gsungs pa ni khyi'i dpes gya nom pa ja'i myang ba las nyams ba ni don gyis bstan pa yin no //üîΩtheg pa'i mchog 'dzin pa las nyams pa ni gang glang po 'dod pas glang po rnyed nas glang po'i rjes tshol ba'i dpes theg pa mchog las nyams par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba ni 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rdzogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no // gya nom pa'i ro myang ba las nyams par gsungs pa ni khyi'i dpes gya nom pa ja'i myang ba las nyams ba ni don gyis bstan pa yin no // theg pa'i mchog 'dzin pa las nyams pa ni gang glang po 'dod pas glang po rnyed nas glang po'i rjes tshol ba'i dpes theg pa mchog las nyams par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the perfection of wisdom is the source of all mundane and supramundane qualities.üîΩThe statement about the degeneration of the enjoyment of the sublime is taught by the example of the dog, and the degeneration of the enjoyment of the sublime is taught by implication.üîΩThe degeneration of holding the supreme vehicle is taught by the example of the man who, having found an elephant, searches for its footprints, and the degeneration of holding the supreme vehicle is taught by implication.

original: ched du bya ba las nyams pa ni gang rgya mtsho chen po dang / ba lang gi rjes su 'gran pas dpes ched du bya ba las nyams par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ched du bya ba las nyams pa ni gang rgya mtsho chen po dang / ba lang gi rjes su 'gran pas dpes ched du bya ba las nyams par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The degeneration of the aim is taught by the example of the man who competes with the great ocean in a cow‚Äôs hoofprint, and the degeneration of the aim is taught by implication.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa las nyams pa ni gang phya mkhan gyi rnam par rgyal ba'i gzhal med khang nyi ma dang / zla ba'i tshad kyis gzhal yas khang byed bar 'dod pa'i dpes rgyu dang 'bras bur 'joms pa las go bzlog pa ston pas de dang rjes su mthun par 'brel pa las nyams par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa las nyams pa ni gang phya mkhan gyi rnam par rgyal ba'i gzhal med khang nyi ma dang / zla ba'i tshad kyis gzhal yas khang byed bar 'dod pa'i dpes rgyu dang 'bras bur 'joms pa las go bzlog pa ston pas de dang rjes su mthun par 'brel pa las nyams par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The degeneration of the connection between cause and effect is taught by the example of the sun and moon, which are the cause of the celestial mansion of the victor, and the celestial mansion, which is the effect. The opposite of the connection between cause and effect is taught, and in accordance with that, the degeneration of the connection is implicitly taught.

original: bla na med pa'i gnas las nyams pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang / khams kyi rgyal phran bskrun par byed pa'i dpes chos kyi sku'i go 'phang las nyams par don gyis yang bar du gcod pa'i bdud kyi las nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i gnas las nyams pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang / khams kyi rgyal phran bskrun par byed pa'i dpes chos kyi sku'i go 'phang las nyams par don gyis yang bar du gcod pa'i bdud kyi las nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The degeneration of the unsurpassed state is taught by the example of the universal monarch and the minor kings of the provinces, which implicitly teaches the deeds of Mara that are obstacles to the state of the dharmakaya.

original: yul rnam pa mang po la rnam par rtog pa'i spobs pa 'byung ba ni gang chos de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la med cing mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yul rnam pa mang po la rnam par rtog pa'i spobs pa 'byung ba ni gang chos de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la med cing mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The arising of eloquence in the many aspects of objects is taught as follows: ‚ÄúThose dharmas do not exist in this perfection of wisdom, and they are not apprehended.‚Äù

original: chos kyi yul de la sogs pa mang po 'byung bas yi ge 'dri ba la mngon bar zhen pa dang / dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bris pa'i yi ge la mngon par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi yul de la sogs pa mang po 'byung bas yi ge 'dri ba la mngon bar zhen pa dang / dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bris pa'i yi ge la mngon par zhen pa dang /
translated: Since many such objects of dharmas arise, there is the clinging to the written letters, the clinging to the non-existent, and the clinging to the written letters of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di'i yi ge med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / yul la sogs pa yid la byed pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myang ba dang / lam ma yin pas thabs la mkhas ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i yi ge med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / yul la sogs pa yid la byed pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myang ba dang / lam ma yin pas thabs la mkhas ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: There is the clinging to its lack of letters, the mental activity of objects and so on, the relishing of gain, honor, and praise, and the skill in means that is not the path.

original: @100a * // bar du gcod pa bdun ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pas dngos po med pas dngos po med pa 'dri bar mi nus pa'i phyir dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / bris pa'i yi ge la de yin par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: @100a * // bar du gcod pa bdun ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pas dngos po med pas dngos po med pa 'dri bar mi nus pa'i phyir dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / bris pa'i yi ge la de yin par zhen pa dang /
translated: 1) clinging to non-entity, since one cannot ask about non-entity because all phenomena are non-existent and thus non-entities,üîΩ2) clinging to written letters,

original: bris pa'i yi ge la de yin par zhen pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myong bar byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa por ste /
analyzed: bris pa'i yi ge la de yin par zhen pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myong bar byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa por ste /
translated: 3) savoring gain, honor, and praise,

original: bdud kyis nye bar bsdus pa'i mdo sde rnams las thabs la mkhas pa tshol ba ni bdud kyi las nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud kyis nye bar bsdus pa'i mdo sde rnams las thabs la mkhas pa tshol ba ni bdud kyi las nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: 4) seeking skill in means from s≈´tras subsumed by MƒÅra, which is taught to be the work of MƒÅra itself,üîΩ5) not seeking the profound,üîΩ6) not seeking the vast, andüîΩ7) not seeking the profound and vast.

original: 'dun pa dang / snyom las kyi nyams pa ni gang yang chos smra ba dang / nyan pa dang / phan tshun du mngon par 'brel ba ni gang gcig la gcig 'dun pa dang / snyom las kyi nyams pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / snyom las kyi nyams pa ni gang yang chos smra ba dang / nyan pa dang / phan tshun du mngon par 'brel ba ni gang gcig la gcig 'dun pa dang / snyom las kyi nyams pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The degeneration of aspiration and laziness is shown by the fact that the expounders of the Dharma and the listeners do not mutually aspire to meet.

original: 'dun pa'i yul tha dad pas nyams pa ni gang yang de dag nyid gcig la gcig 'dun pa dang ldan pa yul gzhan du 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i yul tha dad pas nyams pa ni gang yang de dag nyid gcig la gcig 'dun pa dang ldan pa yul gzhan du 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The degeneration of the object of aspiration is shown by the fact that they aspire to go elsewhere.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / 'dod zhen chung ba nyid kyis nyams pa ni gang yang de dag gcig la gcig rnyed pa la sogs pa lhur len pa dang / chos nyan pa 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / 'dod zhen chung ba nyid kyis nyams pa ni gang yang de dag gcig la gcig rnyed pa la sogs pa lhur len pa dang / chos nyan pa 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The degeneration of little desire for gain, honor, and attachment is shown by the fact that they are intent on gain, etc., and have little desire to listen to the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dag dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos nyid dang / gtong ba la ser sna byed pa dang / sbyin pa la kun du 'dzin pa dang / mgo smos pas go ba dang /üîΩrnam par spros pas go ba nyid dang / mdo la sogs pa'i chos mngon par shes pa dang / mngon par mi shes pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dang / thabs dang / thabs ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dag dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos nyid dang / gtong ba la ser sna byed pa dang / sbyin pa la kun du 'dzin pa dang / mgo smos pas go ba dang / rnam par spros pas go ba nyid dang / mdo la sogs pa'i chos mngon par shes pa dang / mngon par mi shes pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dang / thabs dang / thabs ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang /
translated: Similarly, they are endowed or not endowed with the qualities of training, they have the nature of virtue or nonvirtue, they are stingy with giving or they are generous, they understand through brief explanations or they understand through detailed explanations, they understand or do not understand the Dharma of the s≈´tras and so on, they are endowed or not endowed with the six perfections, they are skilled or unskilled in means,

original: gzungs thob pa dang / ma thob pa dang / yi ge 'dri bar 'dod pa dang / 'dri bar mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ba dang ma bral ba nyid ces bya ba go rims bzhin du 'chad pa po dang /
analyzed: gzungs thob pa dang / ma thob pa dang / yi ge 'dri bar 'dod pa dang / 'dri bar mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ba dang ma bral ba nyid ces bya ba go rims bzhin du 'chad pa po dang /
translated: they have or have not obtained dhƒÅra·πáƒ´, they wish or do not wish to write letters, they are free or not free from desire and so on.

original: nyan pa po dang / snga ma dang / phyi ma 'brel ba dang / tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa rnams pa bcu gcig ni bar chad bcu gcig tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan pa po dang / snga ma dang / phyi ma 'brel ba dang / tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa rnams pa bcu gcig ni bar chad bcu gcig tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: the listener, the former, the latter, the connection, the assembly, and the lack of endowment.

original: gang gzhan yang de dag sbyangs pa'i yon @100b tan dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang gzhan yang de dag sbyangs pa'i yon @100b tan dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that those who possess or do not possess the qualities of training,

original: yang de dag nyid phan tshun 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ba nyid kyis tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang de dag nyid phan tshun 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ba nyid kyis tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: up to those who are free from mutual desire and so on, should be recognized as the work of Mara due to the lack of assembly.

original: ngan 'gro las phyir phyogs pa ni gang gzhan yang la la zhig der 'ongs te /
analyzed: ngan 'gro las phyir phyogs pa ni gang gzhan yang la la zhig der 'ongs te /
translated: Turning away from the lower realms means that someone else comes there

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mi bsngags pa brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mi bsngags pa brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: and speaks unfavorably about the hells and so on.

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba la yid bde ba ni gang de bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams legs par brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba la yid bde ba ni gang de bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams legs par brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The mental satisfaction that leads to happy rebirth is taught by the passage beginning, ‚ÄúThe gods of the Catur¬≠maharajika heaven speak well of him.‚Äù

original: 'di ni dang por nyan pa po dang / phyis chos smra ba nges par bya ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa nges par byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni dang por nyan pa po dang / phyis chos smra ba nges par bya ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa nges par byas pa yin la /
translated: This is the first part of the chapter, which deals with the unfitness of the listener and the speaker.

original: da ni dang por 'chad pa po dang / phyis nyan pa po'i nges par byas pa'i tshogs dang mi ldan pa rnam pa bdun du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni dang por 'chad pa po dang / phyis nyan pa po'i nges par byas pa'i tshogs dang mi ldan pa rnam pa bdun du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now the second part of the chapter, which deals with the seven kinds of unfitness of the listener and the speaker, is begun.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'dir 'chad pa dang / nyan pa dag dang / nyan pa po dang / 'chad pa po dang / sngon dang / phyi mar gzhag pas bar chad rnams la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'dir 'chad pa dang / nyan pa dag dang / nyan pa po dang / 'chad pa po dang / sngon dang / phyi mar gzhag pas bar chad rnams la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Why is this?üîΩHere the listener and the speaker are mentioned together, and the obstacles are mentioned in terms of the listener and the speaker, in the past and in the future.

original: nyan pa po dang / 'chad pa po gnyi ga sngon dang / phyi ma gnyi ga la brten pa nyid du shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan pa po dang / 'chad pa po gnyi ga sngon dang / phyi ma gnyi ga la brten pa nyid du shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: The listener and the speaker are to be understood as being based on the past and the future.

original: de la 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po dag gis mngon par 'brel ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa ni 'di yin te /üîΩgang 'di ltar gcig pu nyid dang / 'khor la dga' ba nyid dang / 'dod pa nyid ni rjes su 'brel pa dang / go skabs mi 'byed pa nyid dang / zang zing cung zad 'dod pa dang / de sbyin par mi 'dod pa dang /üîΩsrog gi bar chad du 'gyur ba dang / bar chad du mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba dang / de bzhin du lo legs pa dang / mu ge byung ba la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: de la 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po dag gis mngon par 'brel ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa ni 'di yin te / gang 'di ltar gcig pu nyid dang / 'khor la dga' ba nyid dang / 'dod pa nyid ni rjes su 'brel pa dang / go skabs mi 'byed pa nyid dang / zang zing cung zad 'dod pa dang / de sbyin par mi 'dod pa dang / srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ba dang / bar chad du mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba dang / de bzhin du lo legs pa dang / mu ge byung ba la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba dang /
translated: The assembly of those who are not present, who are not gathered together, consists of those who are not present in person, who are not present in spirit, who are not present in body or mind.üîΩThey are not present in person because they are not present in the place where the Dharma is being taught. They are not present in spirit because they are not interested in the Dharma, they are not interested in listening, they are not interested in the Dharma teacher, and they are not interested in the Dharma itself.

original: chom rkun la sogs pa'i rgyus dkrugs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba dang // khyim la lta bas nyan pa po 'dor bar bde ba ni rab 'byor chos smra ba ni gcig pu ste /
analyzed: chom rkun la sogs pa'i rgyus dkrugs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba dang // khyim la lta bas nyan pa po 'dor bar bde ba ni rab 'byor chos smra ba ni gcig pu ste /
translated: They are not present in body and mind because they are not present in the place where the Dharma is being taught, and they are not interested in the Dharma, etc.üîΩThe assembly of those who are present, who are gathered together, consists of those who are present in person, who are present in spirit, and who are present in body and mind.

original: zla med cing bdag gir byed pa yin la /
analyzed: zla med cing bdag gir byed pa yin la /
translated: It is without a companion and is one's own.

original: chos nyan pa ni 'khor gyi nang nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: chos nyan pa ni 'khor gyi nang nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The listener is one who, from within the assembly, has begun to

original: dge slong chos smra ba ni bsod snyoms ster ba'i grong du 'gro dgos so zhes bya ba @101a * //
analyzed: dge slong chos smra ba ni bsod snyoms ster ba'i grong du 'gro dgos so zhes bya ba @101a * //
translated: The monk who is a Dharma teacher must go to the village to receive alms.

original: nas des nyan pa de dag phyir ldog pas phyir dong nas zhes bya ba'i bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nas des nyan pa de dag phyir ldog pas phyir dong nas zhes bya ba'i bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The listener, having turned back, has gone away.

original: bdud sdig can gyis dbye ba'i sbyor ba ni gang gzhan yang bdud sdig to can 'di skad du /
analyzed: bdud sdig can gyis dbye ba'i sbyor ba ni gang gzhan yang bdud sdig to can 'di skad du /
translated: The application of the evil Mara to divide is as follows:

original: nged kyi khong du ji ltar chud pa 'di yin gyi khyod klog pa de ni shes rab kye pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes dbyen byed kyi /
analyzed: nged kyi khong du ji ltar chud pa 'di yin gyi khyod klog pa de ni shes rab kye pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes dbyen byed kyi /
translated: Moreover, the evil Mara says, This is what we understand, but what you are reading is not the perfection of wisdom. He causes division.

original: yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba gang yin ba de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' sngon du byed par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'i sbyor bas zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba gang yin ba de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' sngon du byed par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'i sbyor bas zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: But the one who applies himself to the perfection of wisdom will make the limit of reality prior. He teaches with the application of non-association.

original: bcos ma nye bar bsgrub pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las te /
analyzed: bcos ma nye bar bsgrub pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud kyi las te /
translated: The counterfeit is the counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom, which is the work of Mara.

original: de yongs su shes nas rnam par spang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yongs su shes nas rnam par spang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Having understood it, one should abandon it.

original: yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa la dga' ba bskyed pa ni gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du 'ongs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa la dga' ba bskyed pa ni gzhan yang bdud sdig can dag sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du 'ongs pa mthong ste /
translated: The production of delight in the unreal is the appearance of Mara, the sinful one, in the guise of a Buddha.

original: 'dod pa bskyed pa dang / bdud kyis sprul pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mthong nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bor ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa bskyed pa dang / bdud kyis sprul pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mthong nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bor ste /
translated: Having seen him, one produces desire, and having seen the magically created Bodhisattva, one abandons omniscience.

original: des de la 'dod pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: des de la 'dod pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: He produces desire for that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chos thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chos thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the perfection of wisdom, all dharmas are not.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because of the own-being of dharmas.

original: skyon bzhi bcu rtsa drug ni bar chad du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: skyon bzhi bcu rtsa drug ni bar chad du gyur pa yin no //
translated: The forty-six faults are obstacles.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi rin po che chen po'i dpes ni de ltar bar chad mang pos yongs su zin yang bar chad kyang rnam grangs bstan pas skyes bu rmongs pa bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa /üîΩblo chung ba /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi rin po che chen po'i dpes ni de ltar bar chad mang pos yongs su zin yang bar chad kyang rnam grangs bstan pas skyes bu rmongs pa bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa / blo chung ba /
translated: The example of the great jewel of Jambudvipa shows that, although one is beset by many obstacles, one should not give up the Great Vehicle.

original: blo dman pa de dag la zhes bya ba ni bar chad byed pa nges pa las bzlog ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: blo dman pa de dag la zhes bya ba ni bar chad byed pa nges pa las bzlog ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase those who are confused, who are under the influence of Mara, who are of little intelligence, who are of inferior intelligence shows that one should avoid the certainty of obstacles.

original: bar chad mang po yod kyang de la yang sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa ni sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rgyus yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bar chad mang po yod kyang de la yang sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa ni sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rgyus yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase although there are many obstacles, Buddhahood is attained shows that it is due to the cause of the Buddha's blessing.

original: bar chad kyi chos skyes pa rnams bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos skyes pa rnams bsal ba yin no //
translated: The phrase the arising of the dharmas of obstacles is removed shows that one should remove the obstacles.

original: dkar pho'i phyogs ma lus pa rdzogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: dkar pho'i phyogs ma lus pa rdzogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: The phrase the completion of all the bright factors is due to the cause of the Buddha's power shows that one should generate the bright factors.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bu mang po yod pa'i dpes de la phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad de la dgongs @101b shing de la brtson pa rnams la de rnams kyis srung ba la sogs
analyzed: bu mang po yod pa'i dpes de la phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad de la dgongs @101b shing de la brtson pa rnams la de rnams kyis srung ba la sogs
translated: The example of many sons shows that all the noble beings, the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the worlds of the ten directions, focus on them and those who strive in that way are protected by them and so forth.üîΩ

original: pa mdzad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa mdzad pa nyid yin no //
translated: By the example of many sons, it is that all the noble persons, the Buddhas of the ten directions, the Buddhas of the world systems, the Bodhisattvas, and so forth, are intent on them, and those who strive for them, they themselves perform the protection and so forth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni sangs rgyas rnams bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni sangs rgyas rnams bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that this perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Buddhas and the revealer of the world.

original: bar chad kyi chos rnams kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos rnams kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: The commentary on the phenomena of obstacles.

original: // / sbyor ba rnams bstan nas de'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: // / sbyor ba rnams bstan nas de'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the practices, their characteristics should be stated, therefore, for that reason:

original: gang gis mtshon te mtshan nyid du //
analyzed: gang gis mtshon te mtshan nyid du //
translated: What is indicated is the characteristic.

original: shes bya de yang shes pa dang // khyad par byed dang rnam gsum ste //
analyzed: shes bya de yang shes pa dang // khyad par byed dang rnam gsum ste //
translated: That object of knowledge is also the knower, the differentiator, and the threefold.

original: mtshon bya'i ngo bo nyid gang yang //
analyzed: mtshon bya'i ngo bo nyid gang yang //
translated: The nature of the object to be known is

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: as follows.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid bzhir 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid bzhir 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the characteristics should be understood as four.

original: de la shes pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas re zhig rnam pa bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la shes pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas re zhig rnam pa bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, all the characteristics of knowledge are made in terms of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gang dag yin zhe na /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas dang // mi bzad pa yi rnam pa dang // chags bcas sogs dang rgya chen dang // chen por gyur dang tshad med dang //üîΩrnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems bltar med dang shes pa de //üîΩg-yo ba la sogs shes bya dang // de la gzhan yang de dag ni //
analyzed: gang dag yin zhe na / de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas dang // mi bzad pa yi rnam pa dang // chags bcas sogs dang rgya chen dang // chen por gyur dang tshad med dang // rnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems bltar med dang shes pa de // g-yo ba la sogs shes bya dang // de la gzhan yang de dag ni //
translated: What are they?üîΩThe appearance of the Tathagata, the nature of the world not perishing, the mental activity of sentient beings, their inclusion, their turning away, the aspect of the unbearable, the aspect of the great, the aspect of the immeasurable,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes //
translated: the aspect of the inconceivable, the aspect of the unmanifest, the aspect of the formless, the aspect of the desireless, the aspect of the signless, the aspect of the undifferentiated, the aspect of the unattached, the aspect of the unfettered, the aspect of the unarisen, the aspect of the unborn, the aspect of the non-existent, the aspect of the non-existent object, the aspect of the non-existent nature, the aspect of the non-existent entity, the aspect of the non-existent self, the aspect of the non-existent being, the aspect of the non-existent soul, the aspect of the non-existent person, the aspect of the non-existent human, the aspect of the non-existent human being, the aspect of the non-existent agent, the aspect of the non-existent experiencer, the aspect of the non-existent knower, the aspect of the non-existent seer, the aspect of the non-existent hearer, the aspect of the non-existent thinker, the aspect of the non-existent cognizer, the aspect of the non-existent object of knowledge, the aspect of the non-existent mind, the aspect of the non-existent consciousness, the aspect of the non-existent form, the aspect of the non-existent feeling, the aspect of the non-existent discrimination, the aspect of the non-existent formative factors, the aspect of the non-existent consciousness, the aspect of the non-existent eye, the aspect of the non-existent ear, the aspect of the non-existent nose, the aspect of the non-existent tongue, the aspect of the non-existent body, the aspect of the non-existent mind, the aspect of the non-existent form, the aspect of the non-existent sound, the aspect of the non-existent smell, the aspect of the non-existent taste, the aspect of the non-existent tangible, the aspect of the non-existent dharma, the aspect

original: thub pa de bzhin nyid rtogs dang // gzhan bstan pa zhes bya ba dag / thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyi //
analyzed: thub pa de bzhin nyid rtogs dang // gzhan bstan pa zhes bya ba dag / thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyi //
translated: The knowledge of the Tathagata's appearance, the knowledge of the teaching of others, and the knowledge of the perfection of all aspects are the summary of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin //üîΩzhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin // zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the Tathagata's appearance, the knowledge of the teaching of others, and the knowledge of the perfection of all aspects are the summary of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i shes pa ni gang rnam pa thams cad mngon bar byang chub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas shes pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i shes pa ni gang rnam pa thams cad mngon bar byang chub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas shes pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The knowledge of the Tathagata's appearance is taught beginning with the statement The knowledge of the perfection of all aspects is taught in terms of the knowledge of the characteristics of the Tathagata's appearance,

original: stobs la sogs pa'i bar du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: stobs la sogs pa'i bar du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: up to the knowledge of the powers and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug ba nas sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos de dag bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug ba nas sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos de dag bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it gives rise to those dharmas that lead to Buddhahood, up to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yum yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yum yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that the perfection of wisdom is the mother of the Tathagatas.

original: 'jig rten 'jig pa med par shes pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni 'jig pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig pa med par shes pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni 'jig pa ma yin /
translated: The knowledge of the non-destruction of the world is the knowledge that emptiness and so on are not destroyed.

original: rab tu 'jig pa ma yin pa'i don gyis na /üîΩphung po @102a * //
analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa ma yin pa'i don gyis na / phung po @102a * //
translated: Because of the meaning of non-destruction,

original: la sogs ba 'jig pa ma yin /
analyzed: la sogs ba 'jig pa ma yin /
translated: the aggregates, etc. are not destroyed.üîΩThey are not utterly destroyed.

original: rab tu 'jig pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid nges par ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten ston par byed pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid nges par ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten ston par byed pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because of the teaching of the reality of non-destruction, etc., it is the teaching of the world.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa shes pa ni gang zhen /üîΩsems can thams cad kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rag las pa'i phyir de yang sems can du btags pa'i rgyu phung po la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dmigs su med pa nyid
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa shes pa ni gang zhen / sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rag las pa'i phyir de yang sems can du btags pa'i rgyu phung po la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dmigs su med pa nyid
translated: What is the knowledge of the mental behavior of all beings?üîΩThe knowledge of the behavior of all beings is dependent on the perfection of wisdom.

original: kyis 'jig rten ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kyis 'jig rten ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is also the teaching of the world because of the non-apprehension of the aggregates, etc. up to the knowledge of all modes, which are the cause of the designation of beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: re zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang dmigs su med pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang dmigs su med pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself is non-apprehensible.

original: yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: And how is that?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yod pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yod pa'am /
translated: up to and including omniscience,üîΩ

original: dmigs par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba nas 'thad pa bstan pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba nas 'thad pa bstan pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: How could there be any existence or apprehension of the knowledge of all aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects?üîΩThis is the teaching of the rationale.

original: sems bsdus pa dang / de rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni chos nyid 'di la chos nyid de mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sems bsdus pa dang / de rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni chos nyid 'di la chos nyid de mi dmigs te /
translated: The mind is concentrated and distracted means that in this reality, that reality is not apprehended.

original: de nyid sems can thams cad kyi sems bsdus pa dang / g-yengs pa yang dag par ci lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid sems can thams cad kyi sems bsdus pa dang / g-yengs pa yang dag par ci lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching: ‚ÄúThat very [mind] knows the concentration and distraction of the minds of all sentient beings exactly as they are.‚Äù

original: sems mi bzad pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gang yang de rnams nyid kyis 'dod pa dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / spong ba'i rnam pa mi bzad pa'i rnam pa rab tu mkhyen par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems mi bzad pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gang yang de rnams nyid kyis 'dod pa dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / spong ba'i rnam pa mi bzad pa'i rnam pa rab tu mkhyen par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The mind is with unbearable consciousness means that they themselves know the unbearable aspects of separation from desire, cessation, and abandonment, and this is the teaching.

original: sems 'dod chags bcas par shes pa ni gang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sems 'dod chags bcas par shes pa ni gang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: The mind is with desire means that any mind with desire is not the mind as it really is.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor sems ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor sems ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med do //
translated: Subh≈´ti, mind is not apprehended as it really is.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang dmigs su med na /
translated: If dharmas that arise from mind are not apprehended,

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa lta ci smos zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩsems rgya chen po shes pa ni gang sems kyi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pas rgya che bar byed pa'i sems rgya che ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa lta ci smos zhes bstan pa yin no // sems rgya chen po shes pa ni gang sems kyi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pas rgya che bar byed pa'i sems rgya che ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: how much less so is the knowledge of a mind with attachment, etc. as it really is.üîΩThe knowledge of a vast mind is the knowledge of a vast mind that makes the nature of mind vast by not apprehending it.

original: sems chen por gyur pa shes pa ni gang de bzhin du sems chen por gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab @102b tu mkhyen to zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems chen por gyur pa shes pa ni gang de bzhin du sems chen por gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab @102b tu mkhyen to zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of a mind that has become great is the knowledge of a mind that has become great as it really is.

original: sems tshad med pa ni sems kyi rgyu ni rten med cing tshad med pa ni sems de dag la gang gnas bar bya ba'i rten med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du 'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems tshad med pa ni sems kyi rgyu ni rten med cing tshad med pa ni sems de dag la gang gnas bar bya ba'i rten med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du 'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The immeasurable mind is the cause of the mind. The immeasurable is because there is no basis for those minds.

original: sems bstan du med pa zhes pa ni gang sems la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems bstan du med pa zhes pa ni gang sems la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The mind that is not visible is the mind that is empty of its own characteristics.

original: sems bltar med pa shes pa ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga la snang bar ma gyur to zhes snga ma bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems bltar med pa shes pa ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga la snang bar ma gyur to zhes snga ma bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The mind that is not seen is the mind that does not appear to the five eyes of the TathƒÅgata.

original: sems g-yo ba la sogs pa shes pa ni gang sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la brten pas skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du snga ma bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems g-yo ba la sogs pa shes pa ni gang sems 'phro ba dang / 'du ba la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la brten pas skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du snga ma bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The mind that moves and so on is the mind that arises and occurs based on the five aggregates such as proliferation and gathering.

original: de yang bdag dang 'jig rten rtag ces bya ba ni bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de yang bdag dang 'jig rten rtag ces bya ba ni bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Moreover, beginning with It is true that the self and the world are permanent, but the others are deluded,

original: srog gang yin pa de ni lus so //
analyzed: srog gang yin pa de ni lus so //
translated: The life force is the body.

original: lus kyang gzhan srog kyang gzhan zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la brten pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩde bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes pa ni gang yang de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni phung po lnga'i de bzhin du mkhyen pas bcum pa la sogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyang gzhan srog kyang gzhan zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la brten pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no // de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes pa ni gang yang de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni phung po lnga'i de bzhin du mkhyen pas bcum pa la sogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The body is one thing, the life force is another is taught to be based on consciousness.üîΩThe consciousness of suchness is whatever. The suchness that is the five aggregates is known as comprehension, and so on.üîΩThe perfect Buddha's comprehension of suchness is taught to be teaching and investigating for others.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa gzhan dag la yang dag par bstan cing brtag par zhes bya bar shes pa ni gang rab 'byor de ltar sems 'phro ba la sogs pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba nas brtsams te
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa gzhan dag la yang dag par bstan cing brtag par zhes bya bar shes pa ni gang rab 'byor de ltar sems 'phro ba la sogs pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba nas brtsams te
translated: The knowledge that Subh≈´ti, in that way, the suchness of the mind that spreads out and so on is the suchness of form, and so on, is taught to be the knowledge of the suchness of the five aggregates.

original: / chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: / chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bshad do //
translated: The TathƒÅgata has fully awakened to the perfection of wisdom through the suchness of all dharmas.

original: de bas na des de bzhin gshegs pa'i yum yin pa'i phyir 'di ltar 'jig rten ston par byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na des de bzhin gshegs pa'i yum yin pa'i phyir 'di ltar 'jig rten ston par byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is because of that [perfection of wisdom] that the TathƒÅgata is the mother of the world, and thus it is taught that he shows the world.

original: 'di skad du thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'i phyir 'jig rten ston to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di skad du thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'i phyir 'jig rten ston to zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught like this: The perfection of wisdom gives birth to the TathƒÅgata through the state of knowing everything, and thus it shows the world.

original: da ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bskyed pas 'jig rten ston par byed pa rnam pa bcu gsum gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: da ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bskyed pas 'jig rten ston par byed pa rnam pa bcu gsum gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Now, in terms of the thirteen aspects of showing the world through giving rise to the knowledge of the aspects of the path,

original: stong nyid mtshan ma med @103a * //
analyzed: stong nyid mtshan ma med @103a * //
translated: emptiness, signlessness,

original: bcas dang / smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // 'khrug pa med pa nyid dag dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog //
analyzed: bcas dang / smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // 'khrug pa med pa nyid dag dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog //
translated: non-disturbance, non-composition, non-conceptuality,

original: rab dbye mtshan nyid med phyir ro //üîΩlam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni //
analyzed: rab dbye mtshan nyid med phyir ro // lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni //
translated: and the absence of differentiation and characteristics.üîΩThe knowledge of the path is explained as follows:üîΩThe knowledge of the path is accepted as having the characteristic of

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bzhed //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bzhed //
translated: the path.

original: ces smos te /
analyzed: ces smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de la stong pa nyid shes pa ni gang de'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩmtshan ma med pa shes pa ni gang de'i mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid shes pa ni gang de'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // mtshan ma med pa shes pa ni gang de'i mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the knowledge of emptiness is taught as having the characteristic of that.üîΩThe knowledge of signlessness is taught as having the characteristic of the signlessness of that.

original: smon pa med pa shes pa ni gang de'i mtshan nyid smon pa med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: smon pa med pa shes pa ni gang de'i mtshan nyid smon pa med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of wishlessness is taught as having the characteristic of wishlessness itself.üîΩNon-arising,

original: skye ba med pa nyid /
analyzed: skye ba med pa nyid /
translated: non-cessation,

original: 'gag pa med pa shes pa ni gang de'i mtshan nyid skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩsogs pa smos pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin shes ba nyid dang / rten med pa'i shes pa dang / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid du shes pa bsdu bar rig pa bya'o zhes gang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa shes pa ni gang de'i mtshan nyid skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // sogs pa smos pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin shes ba nyid dang / rten med pa'i shes pa dang / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid du shes pa bsdu bar rig pa bya'o zhes gang bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of non-cessation is because of the non-arising and non-cessation of its characteristics.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù should be understood to include the knowledge of defilement and purification, the knowledge of the nature of non-entity, the knowledge of the absence of support, and the knowledge of the characteristic of space.

original: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rten med pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rten med pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of defilement and purification is because of the non-existence of the characteristics of defilement and purification. The knowledge of the nature of non-entity is because of the non-existence of the nature of non-entity. The knowledge of the absence of support is because of the non-existence of the characteristics of the absence of support. The knowledge of the characteristic of space is because of the non-existence of the characteristics of space.

original: chos nyid 'khrug pa med pa shes pa ni gang lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten yang mtshan nyid der zad pas mtshan nyid de ni rnam par 'khrug par mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid 'khrug pa med pa shes pa ni gang lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten yang mtshan nyid der zad pas mtshan nyid de ni rnam par 'khrug par mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the non-disturbance of reality is that the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is exhausted in that characteristic, and that characteristic cannot be disturbed.

original: mngon bar 'du byed pa med par shes pa ni gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mtshan nyid de dag mngon bar 'dus ma byas pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon bar 'du byed pa med par shes pa ni gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mtshan nyid de dag mngon bar 'dus ma byas pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the absence of performance is that the characteristics from form up to omniscience are indeed unperformed.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa ni gang de mtshan nyid de dag rnams zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas pa'i dngos po bkag pas nam mkha'i dpes lam shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas yang dag par bstan to zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa ni gang de mtshan nyid de dag rnams zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas pa'i dngos po bkag pas nam mkha'i dpes lam shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas yang dag par bstan to zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The non-conceptual knowledge is that those characteristics, whether with or without outflows, mundane or supramundane, are taught by the example of space, in terms of the knowledge of the path, through the negation of conditioned things.

original: rab tu dbye ba shes pa ni gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba shes pa ni gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung /
translated: Knowledge of classification is that, whether or not a Tathagata has appeared,

original: ma byung @103b yang rung zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ma byung @103b yang rung zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: from the beginningless beginning,üîΩthe Dharma-element exists,

original: de la spyad pas de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de la spyad pas de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: and the Tathagata, having practiced it, has fully realized it,üîΩand has classified all the signs.

original: mtshan ma thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba mdzad pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis lam shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bstan pas 'bras bu sems can gyi don byed ba yin par gsal bar bya ba'i ched du zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba mdzad pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis lam shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bstan pas 'bras bu sems can gyi don byed ba yin par gsal bar bya ba'i ched du zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught in terms of the knowledge of the path, and it is taught in order to clarify the result, which is the benefit of sentient beings.üîΩKnowledge of signlessness is that the characteristics of form, etc.,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa ni gang gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang / yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa ni gang gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang / yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
translated: and the characteristics of giving, etc., are the perfections.

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med ba dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni mi 'khrug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med ba dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni mi 'khrug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions are the characteristics of non-disturbance.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs ni nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs ni nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The factors of enlightenment have the characteristic of definite deliverance.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects has the characteristic of actualization.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mngon sum du mdzad pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba nas de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med bar mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mngon sum du mdzad pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba nas de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med bar mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the TathƒÅgata has fully awakened to the absence of characteristics.

original: de bzhin du lam shes pa nyid kyi sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lam shes pa nyid kyi sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, it is because the knowledge of the path generates the perfection of wisdom of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de las gzhan ji lta ba bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ston pa shes pa'i dbye ba bcu bzhi las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de las gzhan ji lta ba bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ston pa shes pa'i dbye ba bcu bzhi las brtsams nas /
translated: From there, beginning with the fourteen divisions of the knowledge that teaches the knowledge of all aspects as it is,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi chos brten nas //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi chos brten nas //
translated: The Dharma of suchness is supported.

original: gnas dang gus par bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // mchod dang byed pa med nyid dang // kun 'jug mkhyen pa gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid zhes bya dang // brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum dang //
analyzed: gnas dang gus par bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // mchod dang byed pa med nyid dang // kun 'jug mkhyen pa gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid zhes bya dang // brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum dang //
translated: the knowledge, the direct perception,

original: bsam mi khyab dang zhi nyid ston //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab dang zhi nyid ston //
translated: the teaching of the inconceivable and the peace.

original: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa ni //
translated: The cessation of the world‚Äôs perceptions,

original: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //
analyzed: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //
translated: in the method of the knowledge of all,

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
translated: is explained as the characteristic of knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ston te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi chos la brten nas bzhugs pa shes pa ni gang gis bskyed pa dang / ston pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi chos la brten nas bzhugs pa shes pa ni gang gis bskyed pa dang / ston pa nyid yin na /
translated: The knowledge of abiding based on the Dharma of the Tathagata itself is that which is generated and the teaching itself.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rab 'byor rgyu des de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi chos la brten nas bzhugs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor rgyu des de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi chos la brten nas bzhugs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSubhuti, by that cause the Tathagata abides based on the Dharma of the Tathagata itself.‚Äù

original: de la gus par bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / mnyes par bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba shes pa ni gang de ltar chos la rim @104a * //
analyzed: de la gus par bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / mnyes par bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba shes pa ni gang de ltar chos la rim @104a * //
translated: Knowing how to respect, revere, please, and worship the Dharma is the cause of the arising of the Dharma.üîΩ

original: gro mdzad pa dang / bkur sti mdzad pa dang / mchod par mdzad pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub po zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: gro mdzad pa dang / bkur sti mdzad pa dang / mchod par mdzad pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub po zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The knowledge of the one who is to be honored, revered, delighted, and worshipped is the one who, by honoring, revering, and worshipping the Dharma in this way, fully awakens to all-knowing.

original: slar mdzad pa med pa nye bar bzung nas byas pa gzo ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩbyed pa med pa shes pa ni gang byed pa po nye bar bzung nas chos thams cad byed pa med par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: slar mdzad pa med pa nye bar bzung nas byas pa gzo ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // byed pa med pa shes pa ni gang byed pa po nye bar bzung nas chos thams cad byed pa med par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the one who is grateful is taught by taking the absence of action as the basis.üîΩThe knowledge of the absence of action is taught by taking the agent as the basis, that all phenomena are fully awakened without action.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba shes pa ni gang yang chos thams cad byed pa med pa la ye shes 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba shes pa ni gang yang chos thams cad byed pa med pa la ye shes 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the all-pervading is taught by the statement, Because the wisdom enters all phenomena without action.

original: ma mthong ba'i don bstan pa ni gang gzugs mthong ba med pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar la mthong ba med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i don gyis na mthong ba med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba de ni 'jig rten
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i don bstan pa ni gang gzugs mthong ba med pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar la mthong ba med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i don gyis na mthong ba med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba de ni 'jig rten
translated: The explanation of the meaning of nonseeing is that consciousness does not arise because there is no seeing of form up to no seeing of omniscience. The meaning of nonseeing is seeing form and so on that is not seen.

original: ston pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ston pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the teacher of the world.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par brjod pa shes pa ni gdul bya rnams yang dag par sdud pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par brjod pa shes pa ni gdul bya rnams yang dag par sdud pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the expression of emptiness is the correct gathering of disciples.

original: gang yang 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o zhes brjod pa la sogs pas stong pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten 'di ston pa'o zhes brjod pa la sogs pas stong pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthis world is the teacher‚Äù and so on is taught to be empty.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa gsum la dgongs nas 'phags pa'i gang zag gsum gyi dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa gsum la dgongs nas 'phags pa'i gang zag gsum gyi dbang du mdzad de /
translated: With regard to the three omniscience, the three ƒÅrya persons are considered.

original: go rims bzhin du phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa dang / ched du bya ba'i 'jug pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ston pa dang / shes pa dang / mthong ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa dang / ched du bya ba'i 'jug pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ston pa dang / shes pa dang / mthong ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the knowledge of the object of engagement is the knowledge of the object of engagement in the sense of engagement in one part, the knowledge of the object of engagement in the sense of engagement in the object of engagement, and the knowledge of the object of engagement in the sense of engagement in the object of direct perception.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa shes pa ni gang gzhan yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ston pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa shes pa ni gang gzhan yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ston pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the inconceivable is the knowledge of the inconceivable that is taught.

original: zhi ba'i shes pa ni gang 'di ni zhi ba'o //üîΩston pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba'i shes pa ni gang 'di ni zhi ba'o // ston pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of peace is the knowledge of peace that is taught.üîΩThe knowledge of the cessation of discrimination is the knowledge of the cessation of discrimination that is taught.üîΩThe knowledge of the cessation of discrimination is the knowledge of the cessation of discrimination that is taught.üîΩThe knowledge of the cessation of discrimination is the knowledge of the cessation of discrimination that is taught.üîΩThe knowledge of the cessation of discrimination is the knowledge of the cessation of discrimination that is taught.

original: 'du shes 'gog pa'i shes pa ni gang yang chos rnams med pa nyid kyi ji nas 'jig rten 'di'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba de ltar gzigs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pas 'jig rten gzigs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes 'gog pa'i shes pa ni gang yang chos rnams med pa nyid kyi ji nas 'jig rten 'di'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba de ltar gzigs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pas 'jig rten gzigs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
