original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the characteristics of consciousness.

original: // / shes pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / shes pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of consciousness, in order to explain the characteristics of the distinctions, it is said:

original: bsam mi khyab sogs khyad par gyis //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab sogs khyad par gyis //
translated: The distinctions are inconceivable, etc.

original: bden pa la brten @104b khyad par can //üîΩdrug rnams dang ni bcu yis ni //
analyzed: bden pa la brten @104b khyad par can // drug rnams dang ni bcu yis ni //
translated: The distinctions are based on the truths.üîΩThe characteristics of the distinctions should be understood

original: khyad par mtshan nyid shes par bya //üîΩzhes bstan pa la bden pa'i rten can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par mtshan nyid shes par bya // zhes bstan pa la bden pa'i rten can zhes bya ste /
translated: through the six and the ten.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i spyod yul can no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i spyod yul can no //
translated: The distinctions are based on the truths means that they have the four noble truths as their domain.

original: khyad par zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The distinctions are the distinctions of the sravakas, etc.

original: du zhig ce na /
analyzed: du zhig ce na /
translated: How many are there?

original: drug dang bcu zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩbsam gyis mi khyab pa'i khyad par sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: drug dang bcu zhes bya ba smos te / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i khyad par sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that there are six and ten.

original: bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inconceivable distinction is the inconceivable distinction of the Dharma of the Tathagata, which is included in the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering. It is called the inconceivable distinction because it transcends thought.

original: rab 'byor gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab po //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab po //
translated: Subh≈´ti, form is inconceivable.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i ye shes dang / spangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i ye shes dang / spangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa yin par brjod do //
translated: And similarly, the wisdom and abandonment of stream-enterers up to arhats are said to be the patience of bodhisattvas.

original: mi mnyam pa nyid kyi khyad par sdug bsngal la chos shes pas bsdus pa ni gang mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam ba las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa nyid kyi khyad par sdug bsngal la chos shes pas bsdus pa ni gang mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam ba las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction of inequality subsumed by the knowledge of phenomena with regard to suffering is that which is called inequality because it transcends equality.

original: rab 'byor gzugs mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, form is called unequal and so on.

original: tshad med pa'i khyad par sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni gang tshad med pa zhes bya bas ni tshad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i khyad par sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni gang tshad med pa zhes bya bas ni tshad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction of immeasurability subsumed by the patience of the knowledge of phenomena with regard to suffering is that which is called immeasurable because it transcends measure.

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyang tshad med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyang tshad med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, form is also immeasurable and so on.

original: grangs med pa'i khyad par sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pas bsdus pa ni grang med pa zhes bya ba ni bgrang ba las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs med pa'i khyad par sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pas bsdus pa ni grang med pa zhes bya ba ni bgrang ba las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction of countless is included in subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, because it is beyond counting.

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyang gangs med ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyang gangs med ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti, form is countless, etc.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i khyad par ni bstan par gyur pa'i phyir rgyu'i khyad par gyi sgo nas thams cad la nye bar dgongs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i khyad par ni bstan par gyur pa'i phyir rgyu'i khyad par gyi sgo nas thams cad la nye bar dgongs par shes par bya'o //
translated: The distinction of unequalled is taught, so it should be understood that all are intended from the perspective of the distinction of cause.

original: yang na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa 'di ga nyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i mthar phyin pas mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas dang mnyam par gyur pa la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa 'di ga nyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i mthar phyin pas mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas dang mnyam par gyur pa la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Or, these two, the knowledge of the dharma and subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, are unequalled because they are the culmination of distinction, and they become equal to the unequalled Buddha, so it is taught that they are unequalled.

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang / skyob pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang / skyob pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the protector,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas mdzad pa chen pos @105a * //üîΩnye bar zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas mdzad pa chen pos @105a * // nye bar zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the Tathagata, through the perfection of wisdom, is engaged in the great deed.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa la yang chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid yod par mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa la yang chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid yod par mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it the case that the Sravakas and so on also have the same characteristics of the acceptance of the knowledge of the Dharma?

original: yang ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi byad par du 'phags pa bstan ste ;
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi byad par du 'phags pa bstan ste ;
translated: Then why is it taught that the Tathagata is superior to the Sravakas and so on by up to thirty-two unfathomable qualities?

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyang bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyang bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subhuti, form is also unfathomable, and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa nyid thugs su chud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa brjod par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa nyid thugs su chud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa brjod par rigs pa yin no //
translated: Because all things up to and including omniscience are inconceivable and imperceptible due to the absence of intrinsic reality, it is fitting to say that the TathƒÅgata has inconceivable, etc.

original: gzhan yang nam mkha'i dpes bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i chos bstan pa de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen pa gsal bar thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang nam mkha'i dpes bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i chos bstan pa de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen pa gsal bar thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the teaching of the inconceivable, etc. qualities by the example of space is due to the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs unique knowledge of them.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos bstan pa gyu phun sum tshogs pas 'bras pu med pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni du ma zag pa ma lus pa las sems grol ba la sogs pa yang dag par 'dzin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos bstan pa gyu phun sum tshogs pas 'bras pu med pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni du ma zag pa ma lus pa las sems grol ba la sogs pa yang dag par 'dzin te /
translated: The teaching of the uncontaminated qualities is not fruitless due to the perfection of teaching, as it is said: ‚ÄúHe perfectly seizes the mind liberated from all contaminations, etc.‚Äù

original: de bstan pa'i tshe 'bras bu thob po zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i tshe 'bras bu thob po zhes bstan to //
translated: When that is taught, the result is attained.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad sdud par byed pa'i khyad par kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni gang yang blon po'i dpes nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag par ldan pa nyid kyis mdzad pa chen po la sogs pas nye bar gnas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad sdud par byed pa'i khyad par kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni gang yang blon po'i dpes nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag par ldan pa nyid kyis mdzad pa chen po la sogs pas nye bar gnas pa nyid yin te /
translated: The special inclusion of all noble persons, included in the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin, is the bodhisattva, who is established in the great deeds and so on through possessing the perfection of wisdom, which knows all the dharmas of ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and buddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs yongs su 'dzin pa dang / mngon bar chags pa med do zhes gsungs pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs yongs su 'dzin pa dang / mngon bar chags pa med do zhes gsungs pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that he does not apprehend form and is not attached to it.

original: de bas na thugs su chud pa thun mong ma yin pa'i 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thugs su chud pa thun mong ma yin pa'i 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is reasonable that he has an uncommon understanding.

original: skyes bu'i khyad par gyis rig par bya ba'i khyad par kun 'byung la chos shes pas bsdus pa ni gang 'di'i cha phra ba dang / mkhas pa /
analyzed: skyes bu'i khyad par gyis rig par bya ba'i khyad par kun 'byung la chos shes pas bsdus pa ni gang 'di'i cha phra ba dang / mkhas pa /
translated: The special object to be known by the special person, included in the Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin, is the subtle part of the bodhisattva, the expert,

original: gsal ba / yid gzhungs pas shes par bya ba yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba / yid gzhungs pas shes par bya ba yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is clear, and it is to be known by the clear mind.

original: de la phra ba ni de kho na nyid kyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir phra ba'o //
analyzed: de la phra ba ni de kho na nyid kyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir phra ba'o //
translated: Of these, the subtle is subtle because it penetrates the meaning of reality.

original: ma lus pa'i don la 'jug pa'i phyir mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i don la 'jug pa'i phyir mkhas pa ste /
translated: The wise is wise because it penetrates the meaning of all.

original: ji lta ba dang / ji snyed pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba dang / ji snyed pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the realization of the nature of things as they are and as many as there are.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: These two are also twofold:

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni sngon @105b blo yongs su sbyangs pa dang / so so'i skye bos skye bas thob pas don de gnyi ga la 'jug nus pa ni shes rab dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni sngon @105b blo yongs su sbyangs pa dang / so so'i skye bos skye bas thob pas don de gnyi ga la 'jug nus pa ni shes rab dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: The wise is the one who has previously trained the mind and is able to penetrate both meanings by the wisdom obtained from birth as an ordinary being.

original: yid gsal ba ni de bden pa mthong bas don de gnyis ka la 'jug pa'i shes pa yod pas yid gsal ba'o //
analyzed: yid gsal ba ni de bden pa mthong bas don de gnyis ka la 'jug pa'i shes pa yod pas yid gsal ba'o //
translated: The clear mind is the one who has the clear mind that penetrates both meanings by seeing the truth.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus ba ni gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi grangs snyed 'das pas rjes su 'brang ba nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du gyur pa'iüîΩshes pa dang / spangs pa las 'di nyid la mos pa la sogs pa mchog tu 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus ba ni gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi grangs snyed 'das pas rjes su 'brang ba nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du gyur pa'i shes pa dang / spangs pa las 'di nyid la mos pa la sogs pa mchog tu 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The uncommon feature subsumed by perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin is that it is superior to the knowledge and abandonment of the sriivaka and pratyekabuddha arhants.üîΩThis is taught by the passage beginning with ‚Äúthe knowledge and abandonment of the sriivaka and pratyekabuddha arhants is surpassed by the subsequent knowledge of the first moment of the path of seeing of the Mahayana‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúthe knowledge and abandonment of the first moment of the path of seeing of the Mahayana is surpassed by the subsequent knowledge of the second moment of the path of seeing of the Mahayana.‚Äù

original: myur du shes pa'i khyad par kun 'byung la rjes su shes pas bsdus pa ni gang 'di ni phul du byung ba'i chos yin par rgya cher bshad pas /
analyzed: myur du shes pa'i khyad par kun 'byung la rjes su shes pas bsdus pa ni gang 'di ni phul du byung ba'i chos yin par rgya cher bshad pas /
translated: The feature of swift knowledge subsumed by subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin is that it is superior to the knowledge and abandonment of the sriivaka and pratyekabuddha arhants.

original: nyan thos kyi theg ba la ltos nas 'di nyid la mngon bar brtson pa rnams myur du mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg ba la ltos nas 'di nyid la mngon bar brtson pa rnams myur du mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught by the passage beginning with ‚Äúthe knowledge and abandonment of the sriivaka and pratyekabuddha arhants is surpassed by the subsequent knowledge of the first moment of the path of seeing of the Mahayana‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúthe knowledge and abandonment of the first moment of the path of seeing of the Mahayana is surpassed by the subsequent knowledge of the second moment of the path of seeing of the Mahayana.‚Äù

original: nyung ba dang / mang ba med pa'i khyad par 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni gang sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das su zin kyang 'di la 'phel ba'am /üîΩ'grib pa med pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa che ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyung ba dang / mang ba med pa'i khyad par 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni gang sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das su zin kyang 'di la 'phel ba'am / 'grib pa med pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa che ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The refutation of the distinction of few and many is included in the acceptance of the knowledge of the teaching, which teaches that even if all sentient beings were to attain nirvana in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, there would be no increase or decrease in this.

original: drag tu bsgrub pa'i khyad par 'gog pa la chos shes pas bsdus pa ni gang ba drus ma be'u mi 'dor ba'i dpes thos pa dang bcas pa'i mos pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa sngon gyi thos ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstanüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: drag tu bsgrub pa'i khyad par 'gog pa la chos shes pas bsdus pa ni gang ba drus ma be'u mi 'dor ba'i dpes thos pa dang bcas pa'i mos pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa sngon gyi thos ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstanüîΩpa yin no //
translated: The refutation of the distinction of intense practice is included in the knowledge of the teaching, which teaches that the cause of previous learning and so on is the possession of interest accompanied by learning and so on, as illustrated by the example of the cow not abandoning its calf.

original: yang dag sbyor ba'i khyad par 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pas ni gang yang de nyid sangs rgyas mang po la brten pas dga' ldan nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa nyid skye ba snga mar yongs su dri ba ma byas pa dang
analyzed: yang dag sbyor ba'i khyad par 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pas ni gang yang de nyid sangs rgyas mang po la brten pas dga' ldan nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa nyid skye ba snga mar yongs su dri ba ma byas pa dang
translated: who have not asked questions about it and so on,üîΩwill fall to the two lower realms and will not attain the result of the three vehicles.üîΩThis is taught by the example of the former life of asking questions.üîΩThe specific refutation of the object subsumed by subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation is that those who are not endowed with the former life of asking questions,üîΩwho are endowed with doubt in this life, who have not heard internal emptiness and so on,üîΩwho have not asked questions about it and so on,

original: ldan pa ni 'di la yid gnyis ldan pas de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid ma thos /
analyzed: ldan pa ni 'di la yid gnyis ldan pas de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid ma thos /
translated: will fall to the two lower realms and will not attain the result of the three vehicles.üîΩThis is taught by the example of the former life of asking questions.üîΩThe specific refutation of the object subsumed by subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation is that those who are not endowed with the former life of asking questions,üîΩwho are endowed with doubt in this life, who have not heard internal emptiness and so on,

original: yongs su dri ba ma byas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yongs su dri ba ma byas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: who have not asked questions about it and so on,

original: de dag ni sa gnyis su ltung zhing 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni sa gnyis su ltung zhing 'dod pa yin te /
translated: will fall to the two lower realms and will not attain the result of the three vehicles.üîΩThis is taught by the example of the former life of asking questions.üîΩThe specific refutation of the object subsumed by subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation is that those who are not endowed with the former life of asking questions,üîΩwho are endowed with doubt in this life, who have not heard internal emptiness and so on,

original: sngon gyi rgyu'i bag chags kyis rgyun chad cing spyad pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu'i bag chags kyis rgyun chad cing spyad pa yin te zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: who have not asked questions about it and so on,üîΩwill fall to the two lower realms and will not attain the result of the three vehicles.üîΩThis is taught by the example of the former life of asking questions.

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par 'gog pa la rjes su shes pas bsdus pa ni gang yang rgya mtshor gru zhig pa'i dpes bar chad dang @106a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par 'gog pa la rjes su shes pas bsdus pa ni gang yang rgya mtshor gru zhig pa'i dpes bar chad dang @106a * //
translated: The specific refutation of the object subsumed by subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation is that those who are not endowed with the former life of asking questions,üîΩwho are endowed with doubt in this life, who have not heard internal emptiness and so on,üîΩwho have not asked questions about it and so on,üîΩwill fall to the two lower realms and will not attain the result of the three vehicles.üîΩThis is taught by the example of the former life of asking questions.

original: bcas pa dang / bar chad med pa dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i mtshan mar dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal ba'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩrten gyi khyad par lam la chos shes pa'i bzod bas bsdus pa ni gang yang bum pa so btang ba dang / ma btang ba'i dpes bsgrub pa'i chos gzhi med pa dang / gzhi yod par bstan pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcas pa dang / bar chad med pa dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i mtshan mar dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal ba'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no // rten gyi khyad par lam la chos shes pa'i bzod bas bsdus pa ni gang yang bum pa so btang ba dang / ma btang ba'i dpes bsgrub pa'i chos gzhi med pa dang / gzhi yod par bstan pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and the uninterrupted path are taught to be the object of observation for the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects, and the object of observation for the attainment of the knowledge of paths, respectively.üîΩThe special basis is taught to be the object of observation for the attainment of the knowledge of entities, because it is the object of observation for the attainment of the knowledge of entities subsumed by the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: rgyu tshogs pa'i khyad par las chos shes pas bsdus pa ni gang yang rgya mtshor gru zag lhan byas pa dang / ma byas pa'i dpes sgrub pa tshang ba dang / ma tshang ba'i don gyis bstan to zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa'i khyad par las chos shes pas bsdus pa ni gang yang rgya mtshor gru zag lhan byas pa dang / ma byas pa'i dpes sgrub pa tshang ba dang / ma tshang ba'i don gyis bstan to zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The special cause is taught to be the object of observation for the attainment of the knowledge of entities subsumed by the knowledge of entities, because it is the object of observation for the attainment of the knowledge of entities subsumed by the knowledge of entities.üîΩThe special effect is taught to be the object of observation for the attainment of the knowledge of entities subsumed by the subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, because it is the object of observation for the attainment of the knowledge of entities subsumed by the subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: yongs su bzung ba'i khyad par lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni gang yang skyes bu rgas shing nyam chung ba'i dpes lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba dang /
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba'i khyad par lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni gang yang skyes bu rgas shing nyam chung ba'i dpes lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba dang /
translated: The difference in what is fully grasped is taught by the example of an old, weak man, who is fully grasped by the perfection of wisdom, the co-originating cause, and by skill in means, and who is not fully grasped by the other perfections.

original: yongs su ma bzung bar ldan pas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par lhung ba dang mi lhung bar bstan pa'i don la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su ma bzung bar ldan pas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par lhung ba dang mi lhung bar bstan pa'i don la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is that he does not fall into either cyclic existence or nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: yang thabs la mi mkhas pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa ji lta bu zhen /
analyzed: yang thabs la mi mkhas pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa ji lta bu zhen /
translated: What is lack of skill in means and what is skill in means?

original: dar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni thabs la mi mkhas pas sa gnyis su ltung ngo //
analyzed: dar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni thabs la mi mkhas pas sa gnyis su ltung ngo //
translated: One who practices the six perfections while grasping at things and grasping at ‚Äúmine‚Äù lacks skill in means and falls into the two extremes.

original: de las bzlog pa ni thabs la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni thabs la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is skill in means.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that one definitely goes forth to omniscience.

original: ro myang ba med pa'i khyad par bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pas yang dag par bsdus pa ni gang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kun du rtog pa dang / re ba med pa'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams sngo bar byed cing bsten pa nyid la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ro myang ba med pa'i khyad par bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pas yang dag par bsdus pa ni gang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kun du rtog pa dang / re ba med pa'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams sngo bar byed cing bsten pa nyid la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The sixteenth special feature, the inclusion by subsequent knowledge of the path, is indicated by the statement: ‚ÄúBecause they are devoid of intrinsic reality, they dedicate the roots of virtue to unsurpassed, true, perfect enlightenment without conceptualizing all phenomena and without hope.‚Äù

original: bshad ma thag pa'i lhug bas bstan pa'i don gang yin ba de tshigs su bcad pas phyis bsdus pa ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i lhug bas bstan pa'i don gang yin ba de tshigs su bcad pas phyis bsdus pa ni 'di yin te //
translated: The meaning of the above loose explanation is summarized in the following verse:üîΩInconceivable, unequalled,

original: bsam mi khyab dang mi mnyam dang // gzhal dang grangs las yang dag 'das //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab dang mi mnyam dang // gzhal dang grangs las yang dag 'das //
translated: beyond measure and number,

original: 'phags pa kun sdud mkhas pa yis //
analyzed: 'phags pa kun sdud mkhas pa yis //
translated: the wise who gather all the noble qualities

original: rig bya thun mong min zhes nyid //
analyzed: rig bya thun mong min zhes nyid //
translated: are said to be the uncommon object of knowledge.

original: shes myur bri dang gang ba med //
analyzed: shes myur bri dang gang ba med //
translated: Swift knowledge, neither diminishing nor increasing,üîΩis the uncommon object of knowledge.

original: sgrub dang yang dag 'grub pa dang / dmigs @106b pa rten dang bcas pa dang / yang dag pa dang yongs 'dzin dang // ro myang med dang khyad par ni //
analyzed: sgrub dang yang dag 'grub pa dang / dmigs @106b pa rten dang bcas pa dang / yang dag pa dang yongs 'dzin dang // ro myang med dang khyad par ni //
translated: No enjoyment, and distinction.

original: bcu drug bdag nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: bcu drug bdag nyid ces bya ste /
translated: These are said to be the sixteen.

original: gang gi lam ni gzhan dag las //
analyzed: gang gi lam ni gzhan dag las //
translated: The path of this is superior to others.

original: khyad du 'phags pa khyad par ro //
analyzed: khyad du 'phags pa khyad par ro //
translated: Superiority is distinction.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'grel ba'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the characteristics of distinction.

original: // / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: // / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to explain the characteristics of activity, it is said:üîΩProtection, benefit, happiness,üîΩRefuge for humans,üîΩAbode, ally, island,

original: phan dang bde ba skyob pa dang // mi rnams kyi ni skyabs dag dang // gnas dang dpung gnyen gling dang ni //üîΩyongs su 'dren pa nyid dang ni //üîΩlhun gyis grub dang theg gsum gyis //
analyzed: phan dang bde ba skyob pa dang // mi rnams kyi ni skyabs dag dang // gnas dang dpung gnyen gling dang ni // yongs su 'dren pa nyid dang ni // lhun gyis grub dang theg gsum gyis //
translated: And guide.üîΩSpontaneously present, not actualizing the resultüîΩThrough the three vehicles,

original: 'bras bu mngon sum mi byed bdag / tha ma rten gyi mdzad pa ste //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon sum mi byed bdag / tha ma rten gyi mdzad pa ste //
translated: The final activity is support.

original: 'di ni byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: 'di ni byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
translated: This is the characteristic of activity.

original: zhes smras pa la /
analyzed: zhes smras pa la /
translated: To this, it is said:

original: de la phan pa'i byed pa ni gang rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du shes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jig rten la phan pa dang / 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs nas /
analyzed: de la phan pa'i byed pa ni gang rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du shes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jig rten la phan pa dang / 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs nas /
translated: The meaning of benefit is that, through understanding the emptiness of intrinsic identity, the bodhisattvas enter into complete enlightenment for the benefit of the world and for the happiness of the world.

original: dka' ba spyod pas 'gro ba rgyud lnga rnam par grol ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod pa'i phyir phan pas bsdus pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩbde ba byed pa ni gang sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams nas mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pas 'gro ba rgyud lnga rnam par grol ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod pa'i phyir phan pas bsdus pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no // bde ba byed pa ni gang sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams nas mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten la bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of benefit is that, through the practice of austerities, they establish the five classes of living beings in the nirvana of complete liberation.üîΩThe meaning of happiness is that they enter into complete enlightenment for the happiness of the world and for the sake of establishing those who are suffering, unhappy and disturbed in nirvana.

original: tshe 'di'i bde bas bsdus pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i bde bas bsdus pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of happiness is that they enter into complete enlightenment for the happiness of the world and for the sake of establishing those who are suffering, unhappy and disturbed in nirvana.

original: skyob pa'i byed pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'khor ba na yod pa'i sdug bsngal gang ci yang rung ba las skyob cing /
analyzed: skyob pa'i byed pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'khor ba na yod pa'i sdug bsngal gang ci yang rung ba las skyob cing /
translated: The activity of protection is that by which bodhisattvas protect from any suffering that exists in samsara.

original: yang mi skye ba'i chos bstan pas 'jig rten skyob pa nyid kyi phyir rnam bar smin pa med pa'i chos la bkod pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang mi skye ba'i chos bstan pas 'jig rten skyob pa nyid kyi phyir rnam bar smin pa med pa'i chos la bkod pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: And by teaching the Dharma of nonarising, they protect the world.

original: skyabs kyi byed pa ni gang sems can skye ba'i chos can rnams phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rab tu dgongs pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi skyabs su gyur pa nyid kyis gtan du phan pa la zhugs pa'i don no zhes bstanüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: skyabs kyi byed pa ni gang sems can skye ba'i chos can rnams phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rab tu dgongs pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi skyabs su gyur pa nyid kyis gtan du phan pa la zhugs pa'i don no zhes bstanüîΩpa yin no //
translated: The activity of refuge is that by which they are the refuge of the world, since they are intent on establishing beings who possess birth in the expanse of nirvana that is devoid of the remnants of the aggregates.

original: gnas kyi byed pa ni gang chos thams cad 'dre ba med pa dang / 'brel ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par chos ston pa nyid kyi gnas su gyur ba'i phyir sdug bsngal rgyu las bzlog pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩdpung gnyen gyi byed pa ni @107a * //
analyzed: gnas kyi byed pa ni gang chos thams cad 'dre ba med pa dang / 'brel ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par chos ston pa nyid kyi gnas su gyur ba'i phyir sdug bsngal rgyu las bzlog pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no // dpung gnyen gyi byed pa ni @107a * //
translated: The function of the basis is that it is the basis for teaching the Dharma as the absence of confusion of all phenomena, as the absence of connection, as the absence of origination, and as the absence of cessation.

original: gang zhig gang chos thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang chos thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad ma yin no //
translated: The function of the ally is that it is the ally for teaching the Dharma as the absence of the other shore of all phenomena, as the absence of this shore, as the absence of the middle, and as the absence of the two extremes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩThe other shore of form, etc., is the absence of the discrimination of form, etc.üîΩThe function of the ally is that it is the ally for teaching the Dharma as the absence of the other shore of all phenomena, as the absence of this shore, as the absence of the middle, and as the absence of the two extremes.üîΩThe function of the basis is that it is the basis for teaching the Dharma as the absence of confusion of all phenomena, as the absence of connection, as the absence of origination, and as the absence of cessation.üîΩThe function of the basis is that it is the basis for teaching the Dharma as the absence of confusion of all phenomena, as the absence of connection, as the absence of origination, and as the absence of cessation.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang med par chos ston pa'i dbung gnyen du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa la zhugs pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang med par chos ston pa'i dbung gnyen du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa la zhugs pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The function of the ally is that it is the ally for teaching the Dharma as the absence of the other shore of all phenomena, as the absence of this shore, as the absence of the middle, and as the absence of the two extremes.üîΩThe function of the basis is that it is the basis for teaching the Dharma as the absence of confusion of all phenomena, as the absence of connection, as the absence of origination, and as the absence of cessation.üîΩThe function of the ally is that it is the ally for teaching the Dharma as the absence of the other shore of all phenomena, as the absence of this shore, as the absence of the middle, and as the absence of the two extremes.üîΩThe function of the basis is that it is the basis for teaching the Dharma as the absence of confusion of all phenomena, as the absence of connection, as the absence of origination, and as the absence of cessation.üîΩThe function of the ally is that it is the ally for teaching the Dharma as the absence of the other shore of all phenomena, as the absence of this shore, as the absence of the middle, and as the absence of the two extremes.üîΩThe function of the basis is that it is the basis for

original: gling gi byed pa ni gang gzugs sngon gyi mtha' dang phye ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pas chus yongs su bskor ba dang / chos mthun par sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir gling du gyur pa nyid kyis rang dang /üîΩgzhan gyi don rtogs pa'i rten gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i zhugs pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gling gi byed pa ni gang gzugs sngon gyi mtha' dang phye ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pas chus yongs su bskor ba dang / chos mthun par sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir gling du gyur pa nyid kyis rang dang / gzhan gyi don rtogs pa'i rten gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i zhugs pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The function of an island is to be an island, since it is surrounded by water and cuts off the previous and later limits of form.üîΩSimilarly, it is an island because it cuts off craving, is free from attachment, is cessation, and is nirvana.üîΩIt is the support for the realization of one's own and others' goals.üîΩ

original: yongs su 'dren pa'i byed pa ni gang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir yongs su 'dren par gyur pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa la 'jug pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i byed pa ni gang /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i byed pa ni gang /
translated: What is spontaneous performance?üîΩSubh≈´ti, form has the nature of space, etc.,

original: rab 'byor gzugs ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: and the emptiness of form is non-going,

original: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'ong zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: it does not go or come, etc.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mngon bar 'du byed pa med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mngon bar 'du byed pa med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena have the nature of non-conditioning,üîΩthey do not transcend that nature.

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis chos thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas chos ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir sems can gyi don la lhun gyis grub par 'jug cing zhugs pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin
analyzed: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis chos thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas chos ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir sems can gyi don la lhun gyis grub par 'jug cing zhugs pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin
translated: This teaches that it is because he teaches the Dharma with regard to the knowledge of all phenomena that he engages spontaneously for the sake of sentient beings, and because he engages in that.

original: no // thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: no // thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this teaches that he engages in teaching nirvana with regard to the knowledge of all phenomena.

original: theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba'i don gyis 'bras bu mngon sum du mi byed pa'i byed pa ni gang rab 'byor chos thams cad mi skye mi 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba'i don gyis 'bras bu mngon sum du mi byed pa'i byed pa ni gang rab 'byor chos thams cad mi skye mi 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The function of not actualizing the result by means of the definite emergence of the three vehicles is indicated by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúSubhuti, all dharmas are unborn and unceasing,‚Äù

original: chos thams cad ni @107b mi g-yo ba'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis lam shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas chos bstan pa nyid kyis theg pa ji lta bas nges par 'byung ba dang / de mngon sum du mi byed pa la zhugs pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni @107b mi g-yo ba'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis lam shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas chos bstan pa nyid kyis theg pa ji lta bas nges par 'byung ba dang / de mngon sum du mi byed pa la zhugs pa'i don no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and ending with ‚Äúall dharmas are unmoving by nature.‚Äù

original: rten gyi byed pa ni gang rab 'byor chos thams cad ni gzugs kyi ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rten gyi byed pa ni gang rab 'byor chos thams cad ni gzugs kyi ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The function of the basis is indicated by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúSubhuti, all dharmas are by nature form,‚ÄùüîΩand ending with ‚Äúall dharmas are by nature consciousness.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya bas rnam pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad mkhyen pa nas chos ston pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya bas rnam pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad mkhyen pa nas chos ston pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Thus, it is taught that because of the omniscience of all phenomena in all aspects up to the very teaching of the Dharma,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jig rten du gyur pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jig rten du gyur pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: the bodhisattvas are the meaning that has come into the world.

original: byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the defining characteristic of function, in order to teach the defining characteristic of nature,üîΩthe root text says:üîΩThe afflictions, signs, and marks,üîΩthe discordant class and antidotes,üîΩsolitude, difficulty, certainty,üîΩthe object of intent, non-observation,

original: nyon mongs rtags dang mtshan ma dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dang // dben dang dka' dang nges pa dang // ched du bya dang mi dmigs dang // mngon bar zhen pa bkag pa dang // dmigs pa zhes bya gang yin dang // mi mthun thogs pa med dang ni //
analyzed: nyon mongs rtags dang mtshan ma dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dang // dben dang dka' dang nges pa dang // ched du bya dang mi dmigs dang // mngon bar zhen pa bkag pa dang // dmigs pa zhes bya gang yin dang // mi mthun thogs pa med dang ni //
translated: the negation of manifest clinging,üîΩand what is called the object,üîΩthe discordant class, the unobstructed,üîΩthe groundless, the directionless, the birthless,üîΩand likewise, the non-observation of suchness,

original: gzhi med 'gro med skye med dang // de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs dang // ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid //
analyzed: gzhi med 'gro med skye med dang // de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs dang // ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid //
translated: the essence itself with sixteen aspects,üîΩand the essence itself with four aspects,üîΩthese are the defining characteristics of the nature of the bodhisattvas.

original: mtshan bzhi lta bur mtshon ba nas //üîΩmtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin //
analyzed: mtshan bzhi lta bur mtshon ba nas // mtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin //
translated: The four characteristics are indicated by the four names.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The four characteristics are accepted as the four names.

original: ji ltar bcu drug gi bdag nyid yin zhe na /üîΩnyon mongs pa las dben pa'i rang bzhin ni gang 'dod chags dang // zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par bsal ba'i phyir dben pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩde'i rtags dben pa'i rang bzhin ni gang 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyi rtags kyis dben pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bcu drug gi bdag nyid yin zhe na / nyon mongs pa las dben pa'i rang bzhin ni gang 'dod chags dang // zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par bsal ba'i phyir dben pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no // de'i rtags dben pa'i rang bzhin ni gang 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyi rtags kyis dben pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: How is it of the nature of the sixteen?üîΩThe nature of seclusion is that which is free from passion, hatred, and delusion, because it is the state of freedom from passion, hatred, and delusion.üîΩThe nature of the sign of seclusion is that which is free from the signs of passion, hatred, and delusion, because it is the state of freedom from the signs of passion, hatred, and delusion.

original: de'i mtshan mas dpen pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i mtshan mas dpen pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The nature of the indication of seclusion is that which is free from the indications of passion, hatred, and delusion, because it is the state of freedom from the indications of passion, hatred, and delusion.

original: de la rtags ni lus la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: de la rtags ni lus la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len no //
translated: Therein, the sign is the negative tendencies of the body, etc.

original: mtshan ma ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The indication is incorrect mental activity.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs dag gis dben pa'i rang bzhin ni gang de bzhin du 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang / gti mug med pa dang / dben pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can du 'gyur ba @108a * //üîΩdang / lhag par mos par byed pa rnams la bsgom pa'i lam nye bar bkod pas zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩdka' ba nyid kyi rang bzhin ni gang chos thams cad shin tu med pa yin pas de dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs dag gis dben pa'i rang bzhin ni gang de bzhin du 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang / gti mug med pa dang / dben pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngang tshul can du 'gyur ba @108a * // dang / lhag par mos par byed pa rnams la bsgom pa'i lam nye bar bkod pas zhes bstan pa yin no // dka' ba nyid kyi rang bzhin ni gang chos thams cad shin tu med pa yin pas de dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: The nature of being devoid of discordant classes and antidotes is that, in the same way, it is the state of the knowledge of all aspects, having the nature of being devoid of attachment, non-attachment, aversion, non-aversion, delusion, non-delusion, and so on.üîΩAnd it is taught that it is the path of meditation that is set forth for those who have superior aspiration.üîΩThe nature of difficulty is that, since all phenomena are utterly nonexistent, they are not related to that.üîΩ

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni don dka' ba yin par bstan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni don dka' ba yin par bstan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is taught to be difficult to understand,

original: gcig tu nges pa'i ngo bo ni gang de la go bgos pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar lhung ba'i gnas med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu nges pa'i ngo bo ni gang de la go bgos pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar lhung ba'i gnas med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and the nature of certainty is that there is no possibility of falling into the stage of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc., because of being armored in that.

original: nges par bsgom ba bstan pa nyid kyi don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par bsgom ba bstan pa nyid kyi don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the nature of certainty is the very teaching of cultivation.

original: ched du bya ba'i rang bzhin ni gang byang chub sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob bar bya ba'i don du go cha bgos pa'i ched du bya ba las gzhan du mi 'khrul par shes par bya
analyzed: ched du bya ba'i rang bzhin ni gang byang chub sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob bar bya ba'i don du go cha bgos pa'i ched du bya ba las gzhan du mi 'khrul par shes par bya
translated: The nature of the purpose is that the great bodhisattva is armored for the sake of causing all sentient beings to attain the wisdom of omniscience, and it should be understood that the purpose is not confused with anything else.

original: ba'i don du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'i don du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the nature of the purpose is for the sake of that.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin ni gang bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni shin tu zab ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin ni gang bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni shin tu zab ste /
translated: The nature of non-apprehension is that the Blessed One said, This perfection of wisdom is very profound.

original: de ni sus kyang bsgom par mi bgyi bas bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po dang / sgom pa'i dmigs pa rnam par bsgom pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsgom ba rnam par bsgom pa mi dmigs pa de bas na /üîΩbcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni sus kyang bsgom par mi bgyi bas bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po dang / sgom pa'i dmigs pa rnam par bsgom pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsgom ba rnam par bsgom pa mi dmigs pa de bas na / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: It is not to be cultivated by anyone, and so on, up to cultivation of the object of meditation, and so on, up to cultivation of the knowledge of all modes is not to be cultivated.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bsgom pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgoms pa lags so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bsgom pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgoms pa lags so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is the cultivation of the knowledge of all modes.

original: mngon bar zhen pa bkag pa'i rang bzhin ni gang rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin paüîΩmngon par zhen pa med par yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mngon bar zhen pa bkag pa'i rang bzhin ni gang rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin paüîΩmngon par zhen pa med par yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The nature of the prohibition of attachment is taught in the passage beginning with Subhuti, the irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattva should investigate this deep perfection of wisdom, and so on, up to Subhuti, the irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattva should investigate the perfection of wisdom in this way.üîΩ The nature of the prohibition of non-attachment is taught in the passage beginning with Subhuti, the irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattva should investigate the perfection of wisdom without attachment, and so on, up to Subhuti, the irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattva should investigate the perfection of wisdom in this way.

original: 'di bstan pa'i tshe mi 'jigs /
analyzed: 'di bstan pa'i tshe mi 'jigs /
translated: When this is taught, one should meditate on the knowledge of the path by not being afraid,

original: mi skrag ba la sogs pas lam shes pa'i rnam par bsgom pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi skrag ba la sogs pas lam shes pa'i rnam par bsgom pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: not being terrified, and so forth.üîΩThe nature of the object is taught from the beginning of the passage,

original: dmigs pa'i rang bzhin ni gang bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gzhol ba'i bsam bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yongs su rtog pa @108b lags zhes bya ba nas
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rang bzhin ni gang bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gzhol ba'i bsam bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yongs su rtog pa @108b lags zhes bya ba nas
translated: where it says, Blessed One, how do Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas contemplate the perfection of wisdom with a thought directed towards the knowledge of all aspects?üîΩup to Subhuti, the great Bodhisattvas contemplate this profound perfection of wisdom with a thought directed towards dreams and emanations.

original: brtsams te / rab 'byor rmi lam dang / sprul pa la gzhol ba'i bsam pas byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la yongs su rtog pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par bsgom pa nyid bstan pas zhesüîΩgsungs pa yin ta /
analyzed: brtsams te / rab 'byor rmi lam dang / sprul pa la gzhol ba'i bsam pas byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la yongs su rtog pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par bsgom pa nyid bstan pas zhes gsungs pa yin ta /
translated: This teaches the meditation on the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: It is said, Why is that?

original: gzugs nas rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yang yongs su rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba nas thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa nyid las /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yang yongs su rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba nas thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa nyid las /
translated: From the very statements made in terms of the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of the aspects of the path,

original: dmigs pa'i bsgom pa'i khyad par rab tu bskyed pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa'i khyad par ngo bo ston pa'i don gyis zhus pa la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i bsgom pa'i khyad par rab tu bskyed pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa'i khyad par ngo bo ston pa'i don gyis zhus pa la /
translated: the distinctive object of meditation is generated, and the distinctive object of the knowledge of all aspects is taught in terms of the meaning of the essence.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rtog pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rtog pa ma yin no ;
translated: Subh≈´ti, the great bodhisattva does not conceptualize form up to omniscience.

original: / zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From here onward,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i khyad par shes pa'i don gyi lan so sor bstan
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i khyad par shes pa'i don gyi lan so sor bstan
translated: The suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the buddhas.

original: pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the reply to the question about the distinctive object of knowledge that observes the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is taught.

original: gal te de de ltar yin na /üîΩsdig pa'i chos rnams thams cad de //
analyzed: gal te de de ltar yin na / sdig pa'i chos rnams thams cad de //
translated: If that is so,üîΩthen how is it that all unwholesome dharmas

original: mi dge ba la sogs pa de ji ltar yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ji ltar yin zhen /
analyzed: mi dge ba la sogs pa de ji ltar yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ji ltar yin zhen /
translated: are unwholesome, etc.?

original: gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: Form itself is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is form.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba gsungs pa de nyid kyi phyir gcig la gcig ngo bo zab pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba gsungs pa de nyid kyi phyir gcig la gcig ngo bo zab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are profound in terms of each other.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gi de bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi de bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their suchness is non-dual and indivisible.

original: de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ji ltar 'thad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ji ltar 'thad pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it tenable that the wheel of Dharma is turned in that way?

original: sangs rgyas dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dag ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa nyid kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du thugs las chung ba nyid kyi rgyu ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa'i dbye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dag ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa nyid kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du thugs las chung ba nyid kyi rgyu ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa'i dbye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The suchness of the Buddha and omniscience is nondual and undifferentiated, and the reason for the Buddha‚Äôs lack of concern is that there is no differentiation between the object of observation and the observer.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun @109a * //üîΩpa'i rang bzhin ni gang lha'i bu dag nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun @109a * // pa'i rang bzhin ni gang lha'i bu dag nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir chos 'di zab po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The nature of the Buddha that is incompatible with the entire world

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
translated: is taught beginning from ‚ÄúDivine sons, this Dharma is profound because space is profound‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended.‚Äù

original: mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa yang ma legs so //
analyzed: mi gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa yang ma legs so //
translated: It is not taught in order to apprehend it.üîΩIt is not taught in order to apprehend it.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten ni mtshan ma la spyod do zhes bya ba 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa nyid kyis ni 'dzin pa la spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snod ma yin pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten ni mtshan ma la spyod do zhes bya ba 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa nyid kyis ni 'dzin pa la spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snod ma yin pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has said, ‚ÄúThe world is engaged in signs,‚Äù and so on. The fact that this is contrary to the entire world shows that those engaged in grasping are not vessels for the perfection of wisdom.

original: thogs pa med pa'i rang bzhin ni gang de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum yongs su rdzogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la ye shes thogs pa med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yinüîΩno // gzhi med pa'i rang bzhin ni gang gzugs la sogs pa'i rten mi dmigs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i rang bzhin ni gang de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum yongs su rdzogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la ye shes thogs pa med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no // gzhi med pa'i rang bzhin ni gang gzugs la sogs pa'i rten mi dmigs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: The nature of being unobstructed is taught as the unobstructed knowledge of all phenomena such as form, because it is in accord with the realization of the complete perfection of the three kinds of omniscience in that way.

original: shes pa dang / shes bya mnyam pa nyid kyi don nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang / shes bya mnyam pa nyid kyi don nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The nature of being groundless is taught as the meaning of the equality of knower and known, starting from the non-apprehension of the basis of form and so on.

original: 'gro ba med pa'i rang bzhin ni gang 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa gsum po kun bskyed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa'i rang bzhin ni gang 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa gsum po kun bskyed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la /
translated: With regard to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom, which is the source of all three omnisciences,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor dper byas nas /üîΩji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs ma song ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor dper byas nas / ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs ma song ba de bzhin du /
translated: the elder Subh≈´ti is taken as an example.üîΩJust as the suchness of the TathƒÅgata is not future and not gone,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang ma 'ongs ma song ba nas /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang ma 'ongs ma song ba nas /
translated: in the same way, the suchness of the elder Subh≈´ti is not future and not gone.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so //
translated: The elder Subh≈´ti is born after the TathƒÅgata.

original: de bzhin du chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni chos su mngon bar 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni chos su mngon bar 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, the suchness of phenomena is what is called the ‚Äúsuchness of phenomena.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi yin no //üîΩchos nyid gnas pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi yin no // chos nyid gnas pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: It is the generality of forms and so on.üîΩThe suchness of phenomena is called ‚Äúthe abiding of reality.‚Äù

original: chos nyid kyi rgyun 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o ;
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rgyun 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o ;
translated: The continuum of reality that is unchanging and nonconceptual is called ‚Äúsuchness.‚Äù

original: / bsgrub pa'i chos kyi khyad par du 'gro ba ni de'i rnam par rtog pa med pa ni chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: / bsgrub pa'i chos kyi khyad par du 'gro ba ni de'i rnam par rtog pa med pa ni chos nyid yin no //
translated: The special quality of the practice is that it is the reality of non-conceptuality.

original: mi byed pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa gsum gyi dbye ba dmigs su med pa'i chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi byed pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa gsum gyi dbye ba dmigs su med pa'i chos nyid yin no //
translated: The suchness of non-action is the reality of the non-apprehension of the division into three vehicles.

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa @109b gsum gzhan du tshol ba med pa ni chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa @109b gsum gzhan du tshol ba med pa ni chos nyid yin no //
translated: The suchness of non-otherness is the reality of not seeking the three vehicles elsewhere.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The suchness of the equality of the three times is natural nirvana.

original: de bzhin du phung po rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: Similarly, the suchness of the aggregates, the suchness of the elements and sense fields, the suchness of dependent origination, and so on, the suchness of the perfection of generosity and so on up to the suchness of omniscience,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa nyid du rtogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob par gyur pa'i phyir ming de'i mtshan ma dpang por gyur pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa nyid du rtogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob par gyur pa'i phyir ming de'i mtshan ma dpang por gyur pas /
translated: Since the thusness of the tathagatas is nondual and not to be made dual, by realizing it one obtains the name tathagata.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su rtogs pa mtho ba dang dma' bar gyur ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su rtogs pa mtho ba dang dma' bar gyur ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the name is the sign of the tathagatas, the great trichiliocosm is elevated and lowered.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The sutra states:üîΩAt that time, the great trichiliocosm shook in six ways, and eighteen great signs appeared: it moved, moved strongly, and moved everywhere.

original: mdo las de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yos pa'i mtshan ma chen po bco brgyad du gyur pa ni g-yo ba dang / rab tu g-yos pa dang / kun tu rab tu g-yos pa'o //üîΩ'gul / rab tu 'gul /
analyzed: mdo las de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yos pa'i mtshan ma chen po bco brgyad du gyur pa ni g-yo ba dang / rab tu g-yos pa dang / kun tu rab tu g-yos pa'o // 'gul / rab tu 'gul /
translated: It trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled everywhere.

original: kun tu rab tu 'gul lo //üîΩlde / rab tu ldeg / kun tu rab tu ldeg go //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'gul lo // lde / rab tu ldeg / kun tu rab tu ldeg go //
translated: It shook, shook strongly, and shook everywhere.

original: chem / rab tu chem /üîΩkun tu rab tu chem mo //
analyzed: chem / rab tu chem / kun tu rab tu chem mo //
translated: It quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered everywhere.üîΩIt trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled everywhere.üîΩIt quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked everywhere.

original: 'ur 'ur / rab tu 'ur 'ur /
analyzed: 'ur 'ur / rab tu 'ur 'ur /
translated: It roared, roared strongly, and roared everywhere.

original: kun tu rab tu 'ur 'ur ro //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'ur 'ur ro //
translated: It quakes, it quakes intensely, it quakes all around, it trembles, it trembles intensely, it trembles all around, it rumbles, it rumbles intensely, it rumbles all around.

original: shig / rab tu shig / kun tu rab tu shig shig ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shig / rab tu shig / kun tu rab tu shig shig ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: It shakes, it shakes intensely, it shakes all around. It quakes, it quakes intensely, it quakes all around. It trembles, it trembles intensely, it trembles all around. It rumbles, it rumbles intensely, it rumbles all around.

original: de la rnam pa drug ni g-yo ba dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / steng du 'gro ba dang / 'og tu 'gro ba dang / sgra rjes su sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa drug ni g-yo ba dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / steng du 'gro ba dang / 'og tu 'gro ba dang / sgra rjes su sgrogs pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the six aspects are: shaking, rising, descending, moving upwards, moving downwards, and resounding.

original: ltas chen po bco brgyad ni g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba rnam pa drug po de dag nyid go rims bzhin du chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid kyis shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ltas chen po bco brgyad ni g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba rnam pa drug po de dag nyid go rims bzhin du chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid kyis shes par bya ste /
translated: The eighteen great signs should be understood as the six aspects of shaking, etc., in terms of their lesser, middling, and greater stages.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten spyad bar byas pa dang / ma byas pa'i dbang du byas pa gnyis dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten spyad bar byas pa dang / ma byas pa'i dbang du byas pa gnyis dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The two are in terms of the inhabited and uninhabited world systems, and the four are in terms of the world of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi tshogs mi dge ba la spyod pa dang / sna tshogs la mos pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rigs pa dang ldan pa'i bya ba chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen @110a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs mi dge ba la spyod pa dang / sna tshogs la mos pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rigs pa dang ldan pa'i bya ba chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen @110a * //
translated: The assembly of sentient beings is agitated by the practice of non-virtue, by various aspirations, by pride, and by the division of small, medium, and great in the performance of what is proper.

original: po'i dbye bas g-yos so zhes bya ba nas kun du rab tu shig shig ces bya ba'i bar du tshig bco brgyad kyis don bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes gnas brtan dbyig gnyen gyis bshad do //
analyzed: po'i dbye bas g-yos so zhes bya ba nas kun du rab tu shig shig ces bya ba'i bar du tshig bco brgyad kyis don bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes gnas brtan dbyig gnyen gyis bshad do //
translated: From ‚Äúshake, shake completely‚Äù up to ‚Äúeighteen phrases‚Äù should be understood to teach the meaning.

original: de ltar thams cad shes pa'i rnam par rjes su skyes pa nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad shes pa'i rnam par rjes su skyes pa nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that by being born in the form of omniscience,

original: skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin ni gang lha'i bu dag gnas brtan rab 'byor ni gzugs kyi rjes su ma skyes /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin ni gang lha'i bu dag gnas brtan rab 'byor ni gzugs kyi rjes su ma skyes /
translated: the nature of non-arising is that, O sons of gods, the elder Subh≈´ti is not born after form,

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: not born after the suchness of form, and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos 'di dag med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos 'di dag med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: Because these phenomena do not exist and are not observed.

original: gang skye ba med cing /
analyzed: gang skye ba med cing /
translated: What is non-arising

original: gang skye ba'ang med do //
analyzed: gang skye ba'ang med do //
translated: Nor is there anything that arises.

original: de bzhin du lam gyi rnam par shes pa yang rjes su skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lam gyi rnam par shes pa yang rjes su skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the path consciousness does not arise subsequently.

original: de bzhin nyid mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin bcu drug ni gang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid 'di ni zab ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin bcu drug ni gang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid 'di ni zab ste /
translated: The sixteen aspects of the non-apprehension of thusness are taught: ‚ÄúThis thusness of the Blessed One is profound.

original: rtag tu de bzhin nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu de bzhin nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is always thusness, because it abides thus.‚Äù

original: ma nor ba'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis so //üîΩgzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid ni /üîΩchos nyid las chos nyid brtsal ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: ma nor ba'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis so // gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid ni / chos nyid las chos nyid brtsal ba'i don gyis so //
translated: Unerring thusness is the meaning of non-distortion.üîΩNon-different thusness is the meaning of the nature of dharmas.

original: chos nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi dbye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi dbye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of dharmas is the characteristic of the indivisibility of dharmas.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i chos thams cad thob pa'i rgyu'i don gyis so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i chos thams cad thob pa'i rgyu'i don gyis so //
translated: The dharma-dhƒÅtu is the meaning of the cause for attaining all noble dharmas.

original: chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ‚Äúabiding of dharmas‚Äù is so called because it is the performance of all the Buddhas.

original: chos skyon med pa nyid ces bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos skyon med pa nyid ces bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ‚Äúfaultlessness of dharmas‚Äù is so called because its causes and conditions are infallible.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ‚Äúlimit of reality‚Äù is so called because it is the object of the unerring.

original: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid do //
translated: The ‚Äúunerring‚Äù is the absence of error.

original: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa ste /
translated: Its ‚Äúlimit‚Äù is its ultimate point,

original: bdag med pa las gzhan du de kho na brtsal du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa las gzhan du de kho na brtsal du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because apart from selflessness, the reality is not sought.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended.

original: yang ci'i phyir de bzhin nyid dmigs su med ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de bzhin nyid dmigs su med ce na /
translated: And why is suchness not apprehended?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma skyes pa nyid yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma skyes pa nyid yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the non-arising of the knowledge of all aspects is seen.

original: de'i tshe du ma rnams la bstan pas rtogs pa thob pa gsal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe du ma rnams la bstan pas rtogs pa thob pa gsal ba nyid yin no //
translated: At that time, through teaching the many, the clear realization of the knowledge of all aspects is attained.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas @110b yongs su ma bzung zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas @110b yongs su ma bzung zhing /
