translated: Without being sustained by the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: and lacking skill in means, they fall to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth.üîΩOthers, knowing that, should connect them with the perfection of wisdom and skill in means and encourage them.

original: gzhan de rnams kyis de ltar shes nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs la mkhas pa la sbyar zhing spro ba bskyed pa'i don du bya lus chen por gyur pa'i dpes sbyin pa la sogs pas rab tu zin kyang gnyis pho dang bral na
analyzed: gzhan de rnams kyis de ltar shes nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs la mkhas pa la sbyar zhing spro ba bskyed pa'i don du bya lus chen por gyur pa'i dpes sbyin pa la sogs pas rab tu zin kyang gnyis pho dang bral na
translated: The example of the great body shows that even though they are sustained by generosity and so forth, if they lack the two wings of wisdom and means,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung ste /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung ste /
translated: they fall to the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth.

original: de ltar bstan pas gnyis po ni nges par 'byung ba la gco bo yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pas gnyis po ni nges par 'byung ba la gco bo yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, by teaching that, the two wings are taught to be necessary for deliverance.

original: de la gshog ba dang ldan pa la ni 'dab chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gshog ba dang ldan pa la ni 'dab chags zhes bya'o //
translated: There, one who has wings is called a bird.

original: des dbye ba ni bya nyid yin no //
analyzed: des dbye ba ni bya nyid yin no //
translated: The division of that is birdhood.

original: zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir bya zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir bya zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to understand that, ‚Äúbird‚Äù is stated.

original: de ltar bdag nyid lus che la gshog pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhig ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid lus che la gshog pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhig ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the self is destroyed because it is large and lacks wings.

original: rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: The commentary on the characteristics of the nature is finished.üîΩBut not all those who strive in the practice here have a fruitful result.

original: // / ci nas kyang 'dir sbyor ba la brtson pa thams cad 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩ'dir med par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // / ci nas kyang 'dir sbyor ba la brtson pa thams cad 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba ma yin no // 'dir med par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not that there is no result at all.

original: de lta mod kyi ji lta bu zhig la zhe na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji lta bu zhig la zhe na /
translated: But what kind of result is there?

original: thar pa'i chad dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i chad dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
translated: Those who have the roots of virtue that accord with liberation.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang ji lta bu zhig ce na //üîΩmtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang ji lta bu zhig ce na // mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
translated: And what kind of roots of virtue accord with liberation?üîΩThe roots of virtue that accord with liberation are the practice of generosity and so on that are free of the signs of the three spheres.

original: yang dag bsgrub la mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: yang dag bsgrub la mkhas pa ni //
translated: Those who are skilled in the practice of generosity and so onüîΩthat are free of the signs of the three spheres

original: rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di ru /üîΩthar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di ru / thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
translated: attain all aspects

original: ces bstan to //
analyzed: ces bstan to //
translated: and are said to accord with liberation.

original: gang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa 'di thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang du byas nas dang po sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: gang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa 'di thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang du byas nas dang po sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: This is the root of the wholesome which is conducive to liberation.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thabs la mkhas pas mtshan ma med par byas nas sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par byed pa ni spyod par rjes su gnang ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thabs la mkhas pas mtshan ma med par byas nas sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par byed pa ni spyod par rjes su gnang ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment up until the knowledge of all modes, he who, through skill in means, makes his giving, etc. signless, is permitted to practice.

original: de yang dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be known that these are characterized by faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'dir sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i 'du shes rnams bkag ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'dir sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i 'du shes rnams bkag ce na /
translated: And why are the notions of signs in regard to giving, etc. here prohibited?

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir chos rnams gang cung zad kyang chos kyi ngo bor med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir chos rnams gang cung zad kyang chos kyi ngo bor med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of their complete purity, there is no dharma whatsoever which is a dharma in essence, and there is no apprehension of one.

original: @111a * // mtshan ma'i 'du shes kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @111a * // mtshan ma'i 'du shes kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is difficult to attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment through the perception of signs.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes kyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rnam par goms par byas pas des sla bar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes kyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rnam par goms par byas pas des sla bar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is easy to fully and completely awaken to enlightenment through the perception of signlessness, by cultivating the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes las bzlog pa ni 'khrul pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes las bzlog pa ni 'khrul pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The opposite of the perception of signlessness is called delusion.

original: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' bzlog pa mthong bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' bzlog pa mthong bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is difficult to attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, seeing that as many bodhisattvas as the sands of the Ganges River have been turned back.

original: mtshan ma'i 'du shes ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'du shes ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perception of signs is of four kinds:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang / de las gzhan pa skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / de bzhin nyid kyi 'du shes dang / chos kyi 'du shes so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang / de las gzhan pa skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / de bzhin nyid kyi 'du shes dang / chos kyi 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of form and so on, the perception of other beings, the perception of suchness, and the perception of phenomena.

original: gang la de dag gi med pa ni 'du shes med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang la de dag gi med pa ni 'du shes med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The absence of those in something is called ‚Äúnon-perception‚Äù.

original: des ni yang mngon bar byang chub par sla ba yin no //
analyzed: des ni yang mngon bar byang chub par sla ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is easy to fully awaken to enlightenment.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang / de las gzhan pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de las bzlog pa'i chos gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang / de las gzhan pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / de las bzlog pa'i chos gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not observe forms, etc., anything other than that, suchness, or any other phenomenon that is the opposite of that.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos nges pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings las gzhan pa'i ldog pa byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pas ni yang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par sla ba ni 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos nges pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings las gzhan pa'i ldog pa byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pas ni yang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par sla ba ni 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is tenable that, in that way, it is easy to fully awaken to enlightenment again, since one does not observe a bodhisattva who is other than suchness, the dharma-element, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, the limit of reality, or the inconceivable element.

original: de lta mod kyi nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum med pa'i phyir /
translated: However, because there are not three types of bodhisattvas in the Hearer Vehicle, etc.,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gcig tu yang 'dod par bya ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gcig tu yang 'dod par bya ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow, absurdly, that the bodhisattva would not be one who is to be desired.

original: de lta bu'i nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i nyes par 'gyur te /
translated: Such a fault would ensue.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyed byang chub sems dpa' gcig tu yang 'dod dam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: khyed byang chub sems dpa' gcig tu yang 'dod dam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from the line, ‚ÄúDo you accept that the bodhisattva is one and the same,‚Äù

original: bden pa la gnas pas des chos rnams mi dmigs na de ltar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: bden pa la gnas pas des chos rnams mi dmigs na de ltar ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could this be so, since one who abides in the truth does not perceive phenomena?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gcig dang du mar khas mi len pa'i 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gcig dang du mar khas mi len pa'i 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the rationale for not accepting the bodhisattva as either one or many.

original: bden pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa nyid do //
analyzed: bden pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa nyid do //
translated: The truth is ultimate truth.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Abiding means that it is a conventional designation.

original: @111b thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: @111b thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the nature of that which is conducive to liberation,

original: da ni rtags brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rtags brjod par bya ste /
translated: now the signs will be taught.

original: gang gi rtags su shes she na /
analyzed: gang gi rtags su shes she na /
translated: What are the signs by which this is known?

original: de la rtags ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la rtags ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three signs:

original: gnas ma yin pa la skrag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la skrag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a basis for fear.

original: kun du zhum pa ni rgyun du skrag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du zhum pa ni rgyun du skrag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Depression is constant fear.

original: rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni kun du skrag pa mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni kun du skrag pa mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Retrogression is the culmination of fear.

original: de dag gi snod ma yin pa thob pa'i phyir /üîΩgang zhig de las bzlog pa gang yin pa ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi snod ma yin pa thob pa'i phyir / gang zhig de las bzlog pa gang yin pa ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: Because of their attainment of the non-receptivity to the Dharma,üîΩ the non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu brtags nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' la khyad par med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu brtags nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' la khyad par med do zhes bstan to //
translated: The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum du brtags pa mi dmigs pa sems ma zhum pa dang / mi skrag pa la sogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum du brtags pa mi dmigs pa sems ma zhum pa dang / mi skrag pa la sogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-receptivity to the Dharma is the cause of the non-arising of the cognition of the all-knowing.üîΩ The non-receptivity to the Dharma

original: 'di ltar thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams las de la chung du ni gang mtshan ma med par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams las de la chung du ni gang mtshan ma med par bya ste /
translated: Thus, from the small, medium, and great roots of the wholesome which are conducive to liberation, the small is that which is to be made signless.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa gtong ba dang / thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa gtong ba dang / thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is the giving of gifts, etc. and the skill in means, etc.

original: 'bring ni gang chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rnam par goms par byas pa la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bring ni gang chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rnam par goms par byas pa la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The medium is that which is the cultivation of the emptiness of all dharmas, etc.

original: chen po ni gang gzugs la sogs pa de rnams las de bzhin nyid de gzhan pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i ldog pa'i chos mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po ni gang gzugs la sogs pa de rnams las de bzhin nyid de gzhan pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i ldog pa'i chos mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The great is that which is the non-apprehension of the dharmas of the negation of the suchness of those, i.e. of form, etc. which is other than that, and of that which is other than that.

original: de dag thams cad kyang thos pa dang / bsams pa'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang thos pa dang / bsams pa'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: And all of these should be known as having the nature of the wisdoms of hearing and reflection.

original: dang por bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dang por bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that they are the cause for entering into the first teaching.

original: sbyor ba la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: sbyor ba la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: Application is the factor conducive to liberation.

original: // / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bstan nas da ni sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bstan nas da ni sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having explained the factor conducive to liberation, now the path of preparation that is conducive to penetrative insight should be mentioned.üîΩIn terms of object, aspect,

original: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // rgyu dang yongs su bzung ba yis //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // rgyu dang yongs su bzung ba yis //
translated: cause, and complete acceptance,

original: zhes sngar bstan pa ma yin nam /üîΩsbyor ba la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun @112a * //
analyzed: zhes sngar bstan pa ma yin nam / sbyor ba la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun @112a * //
translated: Haven't these already been explained?

original: pa yang ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: pa yang ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Why is the factor conducive to penetrative insight also explained in terms of application?

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas da ni sems can thams cad kyi rten can sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas da ni sems can thams cad kyi rten can sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Having explained the characteristics of distinction, now, in order to explain the path of preparation that is the basis of all sentient beings,

original: dro ba rnams kyis dmigs pa 'dir //
analyzed: dro ba rnams kyis dmigs pa 'dir //
translated: It is praised that in this context,

original: sems can thams cad yin par bsngags //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yin par bsngags //
translated: the objects of the heat stage are all sentient beings.

original: de dag nyid la sems mnyam sogs //
analyzed: de dag nyid la sems mnyam sogs //
translated: In them, the mind is equal and so on,

original: rnam pa dgu ru rig par bya //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu ru rig par bya //
translated: to be known as the nine aspects.

original: zhes bstan pa las 'dir sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i sems mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa dro bar gyur ba ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa las 'dir sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i sems mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa dro bar gyur ba ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: Here, how does one explain the heat stage of the path of preparation, which is applied to the equality of mind that focuses on all sentient beings?

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: In response to this question, the text says:üîΩHaving generated the equality of mind toward all sentient beings, one focuses on that and abides.üîΩHaving generated a loving mind, one focuses on that.

original: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed nas des dmigs nas gnas pa dang / de bzhin du byams pa'i sems bskyed nas des dmigs pa nyid dang / nga rgyal med pa'i sems bskyed nas 'tshe ba med pa des dmigs par byed pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed nas des dmigs nas gnas pa dang / de bzhin du byams pa'i sems bskyed nas des dmigs pa nyid dang / nga rgyal med pa'i sems bskyed nas 'tshe ba med pa des dmigs par byed pa nyid dang /
translated: Having generated a mind free of pride, one focuses on that.üîΩHaving generated a mind free of anger, one focuses on that.

original: khong khro med pa'i sems bskyed nas des dmigs par byed pa nyid dang / de bzhin du ma dang / pha dang / spun zla dang / sring mo dang / grogs po dang / gnyen dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi bar du sems bskyed nas des dmigs par byed pa nyid dang /
analyzed: khong khro med pa'i sems bskyed nas des dmigs par byed pa nyid dang / de bzhin du ma dang / pha dang / spun zla dang / sring mo dang / grogs po dang / gnyen dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi bar du sems bskyed nas des dmigs par byed pa nyid dang /
translated: Having generated a mind toward one‚Äôs mother, father, brother, sister, friend, relative, and so on, one focuses on that.

original: yang rnam pa thams cad du mi zad pa med pa'i sems bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pas ni gnyis su mi 'byed par shes par bya ba'i ched yin no //
analyzed: yang rnam pa thams cad du mi zad pa med pa'i sems bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pas ni gnyis su mi 'byed par shes par bya ba'i ched yin no //
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚Äúone should generate the thought of awakening that is never exhausted in any way‚Äù and so on is for the purpose of understanding that it is not divided into two.

original: pha dang ma la sogs pa gnyis gnyis gcig tu byas nas rnam pa dgur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: pha dang ma la sogs pa gnyis gnyis gcig tu byas nas rnam pa dgur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Two by two, father and mother, and so on, are made into one, and there are nine aspects.

original: 'dir re zhig sbyor ba'i lam la dro bar gyur ba de lta bu yin na /
analyzed: 'dir re zhig sbyor ba'i lam la dro bar gyur ba de lta bu yin na /
translated: Here, first, on the path of preparation, it is like this:

original: rtse mor gyur pa ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like on the peak?

original: bdag nyid sdig pa las ldog cing //
analyzed: bdag nyid sdig pa las ldog cing //
translated: One‚Äôs own turning away from evil,

original: sbyin la sogs pa gnas pa gzhan //
analyzed: sbyin la sogs pa gnas pa gzhan //
translated: and abiding in generosity and so on,üîΩestablishing others in those,

original: de dag la ni 'god pa dang // bsngags pa brjod dang rjes mthun nyid //
analyzed: de dag la ni 'god pa dang // bsngags pa brjod dang rjes mthun nyid //
translated: and speaking in praise of them, and concordance with them.

original: rtse mor gyur ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rtse mor gyur ces bya ba la /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúon the peak.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid sdig pa las ldog cing sbyin ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa ni gang bdag nyid kyang srog gcod pa spong bar byed /
analyzed: bdag nyid sdig pa las ldog cing sbyin ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa ni gang bdag nyid kyang srog gcod pa spong bar byed /
translated: One‚Äôs own turning away from evil and engaging in generosity and so on is that one‚Äôs self abandons killing,

original: gzhan dag kyang de la sbyor bar byed ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de la sbyor bar byed ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: and one also establishes others in that.

original: bdag kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mthun pa las bzlog pa la mnyam par 'jog par @112b byed cing de la gzhan dag yang dag par sbyor ba dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / de snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan dag la yang mthun pas dga' bar byed cing /
analyzed: bdag kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mthun pa las bzlog pa la mnyam par 'jog par @112b byed cing de la gzhan dag yang dag par sbyor ba dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / de snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan dag la yang mthun pas dga' bar byed cing /
translated: I too will focus on the forward and reverse sequences of dependent origination, and I will perfectly join others to this practice, speak in praise of it, and rejoice in it.

original: 'dir yang sems can thams cad la dmigs nas sdig pa las ldog pa dang / dge ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa la yang dag par sbyor zhing /
analyzed: 'dir yang sems can thams cad la dmigs nas sdig pa las ldog pa dang / dge ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa la yang dag par sbyor zhing /
translated: And here, focusing on all sentient beings, I will perfectly join them to the practice of turning away from evil and engaging in virtue.

original: bsngags pa brjod pa la sogs pas mthun par dga' bar byed pa ni 'dir sbyor ba'i lam rtse mor gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsngags pa brjod pa la sogs pas mthun par dga' bar byed pa ni 'dir sbyor ba'i lam rtse mor gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: And I will rejoice in this practice by speaking in praise of it and so forth.

original: bzod par gyur pa ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: bzod par gyur pa ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is the form of patience?

original: de bzhin bzod pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin bzod pa ni /
translated: Patience is

original: bdag gzhan rten can bden zhes pa //üîΩzhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: bdag gzhan rten can bden zhes pa //üîΩzhes bstan pa la /
translated: the truth of self and others.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sngar gzhan gyi rten can gyi dbye ba ltar /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sngar gzhan gyi rten can gyi dbye ba ltar /
translated: Just as it was previously classified in terms of the differentiation of others,üîΩit is classified in terms of the differentiation of objective supports.

original: dmigs pa'i dbye bas phye ba ni gang bdag gis kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dbye bas phye ba ni gang bdag gis kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya /
translated: One should fully understand suffering,

original: kun 'byung spang bar bya /
analyzed: kun 'byung spang bar bya /
translated: abandon origination,

original: 'gog pa mngon du bya /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du bya /
translated: actualize cessation,

original: lam bsgom par bya zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: lam bsgom par bya zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: and cultivate the path.

original: bdag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par gnon cing /
analyzed: bdag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par gnon cing /
translated: One should also enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva

original: de la gzhan dag sbyor zhing bsngags pa brjod pa la sogs pas de gnon pa la mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag sbyor zhing bsngags pa brjod pa la sogs pas de gnon pa la mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin te /
translated: and rejoice in the encouragement of others in that, through praise, etc.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag brjod pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag brjod pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The differentiation of the aspects of objective supports is as previously explained.

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i bzod par gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i bzod par gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, it is taught that the path of application is the acceptance of the certainty of liberation.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What are the mundane dharmas?

original: chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams //
analyzed: chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams //
translated: The supreme mundane dharmas are like that.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says:üîΩThe supreme mundane dharmas are like that.

original: ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du bzod pa bstan no //
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du bzod pa bstan no //
translated: As it has been explained, so it is to be understood in the case of patience.

original: bdag gzhan rten can nyid kyang 'dir rjes su sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag gzhan rten can nyid kyang 'dir rjes su sbyar ro //
translated: The support of self and others is to be supplied here.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i bre brag rnams ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i bre brag rnams ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What are the differences in their objects and aspects?

original: sems can rnams smin byed sogs kyis /
analyzed: sems can rnams smin byed sogs kyis /
translated: By means of maturing beings, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la gang bdag nyid kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gang bdag nyid kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva himself matures beings, and so on up to:üîΩBy means of the knowledge of the path to all destinations, he teaches the Dharma to beings.

original: de de ltar slob cing 'dod pa de nyid kyis bsgribs pa med pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de de ltar slob cing 'dod pa de nyid kyis bsgribs pa med pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: By means of the knowledge of manifoldness and diversity, he manifests all kinds of bodies.

original: dam pa'i chos gnas pa nyid sgrib pa med par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gnas pa nyid sgrib pa med par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By means of the knowledge of the exhaustion of the outflows, he does not take final Nirvana.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos snga ma bzhin du gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos snga ma bzhin du gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattva, the great being, has not taken up form, etc. up to: the knowledge of all modes.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar @113a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar @113a * //
translated: Because

original: gzugs yongs su gzung ba med pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su gzung ba med pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs yongs su gzung ba med pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su gzung ba med pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of form, etc. to: the non-apprehension of the knowledge of all modes is not the knowledge of all modes.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //
translated: This is the logical method.

original: sbyor ba'i lam 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog de yang de'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i rigs kyi dbye bas re re zhing rnam pa gsum gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog de yang de'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i rigs kyi dbye bas re re zhing rnam pa gsum gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: This Path of Preparation, the supreme mundane dharma, is threefold, weak, middling, and strong, according to the division of the weak, middling, and strong kinds of heat.

original: de la dro bar gyur pa chung ngu ni ji skad du /
analyzed: de la dro bar gyur pa chung ngu ni ji skad du /
translated: The weak heat is as follows:

original: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed nas des dmigs pas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed nas des dmigs pas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Having aroused the thought of the equality of all beings, he should abide in it.

original: tshe 'di yin te /
analyzed: tshe 'di yin te /
translated: This refers to the present life.

original: gzhan la mi 'tshe ba nyid nye bar gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la mi 'tshe ba nyid nye bar gzung ba yin no //
translated: He should not harm others.

original: 'bring ni ji skad du /
analyzed: 'bring ni ji skad du /
translated: The middling heat is as follows:

original: phan pa'i sems bskyed nas des dmigs pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i sems bskyed nas des dmigs pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: Having aroused the thought of benefit, he should abide in it.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is as stated.

original: phyi ma gzhan la phan bar dgongs pa nye bar gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma gzhan la phan bar dgongs pa nye bar gzung ba yin no //
translated: The latter is the intention to benefit others.

original: chen po ni ji skad du /
analyzed: chen po ni ji skad du /
translated: The great is as stated:

original: pha dang / ma dang / spun zla dang / sring mo la sogs pa'i sems bskyed nas des dmigs pa nyid du bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pha dang / ma dang / spun zla dang / sring mo la sogs pa'i sems bskyed nas des dmigs pa nyid du bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Having generated the mind of father, mother, brother, sister, and so on, one should take them as objects.

original: 'phral dang yun ring por yid du 'ong bas bsdus pa la 'jug par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dang / phyi ma gnyi ga yin no zhes nye bar gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'phral dang yun ring por yid du 'ong bas bsdus pa la 'jug par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir 'di dang / phyi ma gnyi ga yin no zhes nye bar gzung ba yin no //
translated: The present and future are both taken as objects because one wishes to engage in what is pleasant for a long time.

original: rtse mo rgyud pa chung ngu ni ji skad du /
analyzed: rtse mo rgyud pa chung ngu ni ji skad du /
translated: The small peak is as stated:

original: bdag nyid kyang srog gcod pa spong bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //üîΩgzhan sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la 'jug pa las bzlog par bzhes pa nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang srog gcod pa spong bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no // gzhan sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la 'jug pa las bzlog par bzhes pa nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should abandon taking life, and so on.

original: rtse mor gyur pa 'bring ni ji skad du /
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa 'bring ni ji skad du /
translated: The medium peak is as stated:

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and one should also perfect the perfection of generosity.

original: gzhan bde ba'i rgyu la yang dag par sbyor bar bzhed pa nye bar bzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan bde ba'i rgyu la yang dag par sbyor bar bzhed pa nye bar bzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is intended to connect others to the cause of happiness.

original: rtse mor gyur pa chen po ni ji skad du /
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa chen po ni ji skad du /
translated: The great peak is stated in the line:

original: bdag nyid kyang nang stong pa nyid la mnyam par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang nang stong pa nyid la mnyam par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should also be equipoised in inner emptiness.

original: gzhan dag sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa spangs par bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa spangs par bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is intended to connect others to the abandonment of the error of apprehending suffering as happiness.

original: bzod pa chung ngu ni ji skad du /
analyzed: bzod pa chung ngu ni ji skad du /
translated: The lesser patience is stated in the line:

original: bdag nyid kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa @113b gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa @113b gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should also fully understand suffering.

original: gzhan dag 'phags pa'i lam la nges par sbyor bar bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'phags pa'i lam la nges par sbyor bar bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is intended to connect others to the ƒÅrya path.

original: bzod pa 'bring ni ji skad du /
analyzed: bzod pa 'bring ni ji skad du /
translated: Medium patience is as follows:

original: bdag nyid kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i shes pa bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i shes pa bskyed par bya ste /
translated: One should generate the knowledge that actualizes the fruit of stream enterer,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: but one should not actualize the perfect endpoint.

original: gzhan dag 'bras bu la yang dag par sbyor bar bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'bras bu la yang dag par sbyor bar bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is stated that one should hold the other in mind, that is, one should hold in mind the other, that is, the fruit.

original: bzod pa chen po ni ji skad du /
analyzed: bzod pa chen po ni ji skad du /
translated: Great patience is as follows:

original: bdag nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa nyid la 'jug par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa nyid la 'jug par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should enter into the faultlessness of a bodhisattva.

original: gzhan dag sangs rgyas nyid la yang dag par sbyor bar bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag sangs rgyas nyid la yang dag par sbyor bar bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is stated that one should hold the other in mind, that is, one should hold in mind the other, that is, buddhahood.

original: bzod pa de yang skad cig ma gcig yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa de yang skad cig ma gcig yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this patience is a single moment.

original: chos kyi mchog chung du ni bdag gis kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog chung du ni bdag gis kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The lesser supreme mundane quality is stated in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúI will also ripen sentient beings.

original: khyad par med pa'i theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äù It is stated in order to take up the ripening of sentient beings by the three vehicles without distinction.

original: chos kyi mchog 'bring ni ji skad du /
analyzed: chos kyi mchog 'bring ni ji skad du /
translated: The medium supreme mundane quality is stated in the passage beginning,

original: bdag nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa bskyed par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa bskyed par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúI will also generate the superknowledges of the bodhisattva.

original: sems can rnams khyad par gyi lam la byang chub sems dpa'i mngon bar shes pa la yang dag par sbyor bar bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams khyad par gyi lam la byang chub sems dpa'i mngon bar shes pa la yang dag par sbyor bar bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äù It is stated in order to take up the ripening of sentient beings by the three vehicles with distinction.

original: chos kyi mchog chen po ni ji skad du /
analyzed: chos kyi mchog chen po ni ji skad du /
translated: The great supreme mundane quality is stated in the passage beginning,üîΩ‚ÄúI will also generate the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bdag nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bskyed par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bskyed par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and I myself will generate the knowledge of all aspects.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: gzhan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mthar thug pa la 'jog pa bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mthar thug pa la 'jog pa bzhed pa nye bar gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that the ultimate is the perfection of all other things.

original: gang 'di ltar bzod pa'i chen po skad cig ma gcig yin par bstan pa de bzhin du chos kyi mchog kyang yin no //
analyzed: gang 'di ltar bzod pa'i chen po skad cig ma gcig yin par bstan pa de bzhin du chos kyi mchog kyang yin no //
translated: Just as the great patience is taught to be a single moment, so too is the supreme mundane state.

original: zhes bya ba de ni rang gi don gyi dbang du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni rang gi don gyi dbang du byas pa yin la /
translated: This is from the point of view of one's own aim.

original: 'dir ni gzhan gyi rten can chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhan gyi rten can chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: But here, the small, medium, and great stages are explained from the point of view of others.

original: gzhan gyi don la gong nas gong du 'gro ba'i gnas skabs yod pa'i phyir de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la gong nas gong du 'gro ba'i gnas skabs yod pa'i phyir de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction with the above, because there is a stage of progress in the benefit of others.

original: sbyor ba'i lam nges par byed pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam nges par byed pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the path of preparation.

original: // / @114a * //  'on te 'di skad du /üîΩnyan thos kyi dge 'dun nam /
analyzed: // / @114a * //  'on te 'di skad du / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun nam /
translated: If one asks,üîΩis it the sa·πÖgha of ≈õrƒÅvakas

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yin zhes zer na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yin zhes zer na /
translated: or the sa·πÖgha of bodhisattvas?

original: da dag ni nyan thos kyi dge 'dun yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: da dag ni nyan thos kyi dge 'dun yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that it is the sa·πÖgha of ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: lam gyi 'bras bu dang / 'bras bu'i lam gyi dbye bas skyes bu zung bzhi yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bu dang / 'bras bu'i lam gyi dbye bas skyes bu zung bzhi yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the four pairs of persons are distinguished by the result of the path and the path of the result.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the bodhisattva-sangha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yin par bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa kun mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yin par bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa kun mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: from the perspective of the complete realization of all aspects,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid las brtsams nas so so'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir dring tha dad pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid las brtsams nas so so'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir dring tha dad pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: beginning with the characteristic of irreversibility, the individual characteristics are taught, saying ‚Äúthey are different.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩ‚ÄúBlessed One, how should I understand the irreversible and the characteristic of irreversibility?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ji ltar phyir mi ldog pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya bas ni bdag dang / gzhan rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni yongs su zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ji ltar phyir mi ldog pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya bas ni bdag dang / gzhan rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni yongs su zhus pa yin no //
translated: This is the question regarding the reason for understanding oneself and others.

original: rab 'byor gang yang so so'i skye bo'i sa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang so so'i skye bo'i sa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, the so-called stage of ordinary beings‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa dang / ma byas pa la blta bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa yin no //üîΩgzhan rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas yang byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rnam pa gsum du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa dang / ma byas pa la blta bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa yin no // gzhan rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas yang byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rnam pa gsum du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha is of three kinds‚Äù up to ‚Äúone should not look to see if others have done it or not‚Äù teaches its definition.üîΩThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha is of three kinds: the bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the stage of earnest aspiration, the bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the path of preparation, and the bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the path of seeing.üîΩThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the stage of earnest aspiration is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of accumulation.üîΩThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the path of preparation is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of preparation.üîΩThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the path of seeing is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of seeing.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i chas bsdus pa sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs dang / bzod pa dang shes rab bsdus pa mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs dang ; rgyun dang ldan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs so //üîΩde yang gang /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i chas bsdus pa sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs dang / bzod pa dang shes rab bsdus pa mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs dang ; rgyun dang ldan pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs so // de yang gang /
translated: The bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the path of meditation is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of meditation.

original: nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung ste //
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung ste //
translated: The bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the stage of definite discrimination is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of preparation.

original: mthong dang goms pa'i sa dag la //
analyzed: mthong dang goms pa'i sa dag la //
translated: The bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the stage of seeing is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of seeing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gnas //üîΩde 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gnas // de 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: The bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the stage of cultivation is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of meditation.üîΩThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the stage of no more learning is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of no more learning.üîΩThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the stage of earnest aspiration is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of accumulation.üîΩThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the path of preparation is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of preparation.üîΩThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the path of seeing is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of seeing.üîΩThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the path of meditation is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of meditation.üîΩThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the stage of definite discrimination is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of preparation.üîΩThe bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the stage of seeing is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of seeing.

original: shes bstan pa ni dge 'dun yin //
analyzed: shes bstan pa ni dge 'dun yin //
translated: The bodhisattva sa·πÖgha of the stage of cultivation is the bodhisattvas who are on the path of meditation.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bodhisattva

original: gzugs la sogs pa las ldog pa'i rtags rnam pa nyi shu ni nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la gnas pa 'di'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las ldog pa'i rtags rnam pa nyi shu ni nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la gnas pa 'di'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The twenty signs that are the opposites of form, etc. are the characteristics of this one who is situated in the limbs of insight.üîΩWhat is meant by aspect?

original: gang bcom ldan 'das rnam pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni rtogs pas bsdus pa ni rtags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das rnam pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni rtogs pas bsdus pa ni rtags zhes bya'o //
translated: The term sign refers to that which is included in realization.

original: rang gi rten @114b mtshon pa ni mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi rten @114b mtshon pa ni mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The term mark refers to the indication of one's own support.

original: des yongs su longs spyod pa ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: des yongs su longs spyod pa ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The term aspect refers to the enjoyment of that.

original: de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that such a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva is irreversible.

original: de ni gzhan dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzhan dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He is one who has entered for the sake of causing others to understand.

original: rtags nyi shu gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtags nyi shu gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty signs?

original: gzugs la sogs pa las ldog pas te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las ldog pas te /
translated: They are the opposites of form, etc.

original: gang rab 'byor chos thams cad ni rnam pa med pa /
analyzed: gang rab 'byor chos thams cad ni rnam pa med pa /
translated: It has been taught that Subh≈´ti, all dharmas are without aspect,

original: rtags med pa /üîΩmtshan ma med pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags med pa /üîΩmtshan ma med pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: without sign,üîΩand without mark.

original: tshor bar bya ba dang / tshor ba po'i 'brel pa bkag pas gzugs la sogs pa nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog pa ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: tshor bar bya ba dang / tshor ba po'i 'brel pa bkag pas gzugs la sogs pa nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog pa ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin no //
translated: The non-returner is one who does not turn back from the form realm, etc. to the perfect enlightenment, by the cessation of the relation between the object of sensation and the subject of sensation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams rang gi ngo bo gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams rang gi ngo bo gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form, etc. do not exist in their own nature.

original: gzhan yang yid gnyis med pa nyid kyis lha gzhan dag la phyag mi 'tshal zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang yid gnyis med pa nyid kyis lha gzhan dag la phyag mi 'tshal zhing /
translated: Moreover, the non-returner does not bow down to other gods, nor does he think of worshipping them with flowers, etc.

original: me tog la sogs pas mchod par mi sems pa dang / gzhan yang mi khom pa brgyad dang / bud med kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba dang / yang bdag nyid kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: me tog la sogs pas mchod par mi sems pa dang / gzhan yang mi khom pa brgyad dang / bud med kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba dang / yang bdag nyid kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par gnas pa yin te /
translated: He does not take up the eight worldly dharmas, nor does he take up the state of a woman, nor does he himself stand in the ten unwholesome ways of action.

original: de nyid gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin te /üîΩde'i bsngags pa brjod pa yin //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin te / de'i bsngags pa brjod pa yin //
translated: He causes others to take up the wholesome ways of action,üîΩhe speaks in praise of them,

original: mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin //
translated: and he rejoices in them.

original: sems can thams cad la pha rol tu phyin pa drug ston cing bsgom pa la mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gtong zhing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la pha rol tu phyin pa drug ston cing bsgom pa la mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gtong zhing /
translated: They give the gift of the Dharma of the sutras and so on to all sentient beings, teaching and meditating on the six perfections.üîΩThey dedicate that to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment in order to completely fulfill the wishes of all sentient beings.

original: de sems can thams cad kyis mngon par 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / chos thams cad mi mthong bas chos zab ma la nam nur dang / the tshom dang /
analyzed: de sems can thams cad kyis mngon par 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / chos thams cad mi mthong bas chos zab ma la nam nur dang / the tshom dang /
translated: They have no doubt, uncertainty or indecision about the profound Dharma because they do not see any phenomena.

original: yid gnyis med pa dang / de las lam gzhan 'dod cing mthar thug pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir nem nur ro //
analyzed: yid gnyis med pa dang / de las lam gzhan 'dod cing mthar thug pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir nem nur ro //
translated: Doubt is indecision about the path because one wishes for another path and is incapable of reaching the final goal.

original: lam dang 'dra ba las bzlog pa ni yid gnyis so //
analyzed: lam dang 'dra ba las bzlog pa ni yid gnyis so //
translated: Uncertainty is the opposite of what is similar to the path.

original: rigs kyi chos dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'phel ba med par 'gro bas na /
analyzed: rigs kyi chos dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'phel ba med par 'gro bas na /
translated: Since the various virtuous qualities of the family do not increase,

original: the tshom za ba'i phyir the tshom mo //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i phyir the tshom mo //
translated: they have doubt because they are uncertain.

original: byams pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las dang ldan pa dang / sgrib pa lnga dang / lhan cig mi gnas pa dang / bag la nyal thams cad dus thams cad du med pa ni ma rig @115a * //
analyzed: byams pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las dang ldan pa dang / sgrib pa lnga dang / lhan cig mi gnas pa dang / bag la nyal thams cad dus thams cad du med pa ni ma rig @115a * //
translated: He is endowed with the activity of loving kindness in thought, word, and deed; he does not dwell with the five hindrances; he is without all latent tendencies at all times.

original: pa dang ; lta bas bsdus pa'i bag la nyal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: pa dang ; lta bas bsdus pa'i bag la nyal ba yin gyi /
translated: The latent tendencies are included in ignorance and views.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsams bzhin du srid pa len pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang / srid pa'i zag pas bsdus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsams bzhin du srid pa len pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang / srid pa'i zag pas bsdus pa ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is not included in the defilements of desire and existence, because he takes existence intentionally.

original: 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba la sogs pa'i spyod lam la sogs pa'i dran pa nye bar 'jog pa nyid dang / gtsang sbra'i kun tu spyod pa dang ldan zhing nad nyung ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba la sogs pa'i spyod lam la sogs pa'i dran pa nye bar 'jog pa nyid dang / gtsang sbra'i kun tu spyod pa dang ldan zhing nad nyung ba nyid yin la /
translated: He is endowed with the mindfulness that is the basis of good conduct, such as going and coming, and he is endowed with pure conduct and has few illnesses.

original: chos gos dang longs spyod smad du med pa nyid kyis drod du gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: chos gos dang longs spyod smad du med pa nyid kyis drod du gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: He is in the stage of warmth, because his Dharma robes and possessions are irreproachable.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa nyid yin pas lus la srin bu'i rigs stong phrag brgyad cu med pa nyid dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir sems kyi gya gyu dang bral bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'das nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa nyid yin pas lus la srin bu'i rigs stong phrag brgyad cu med pa nyid dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa'i phyir sems kyi gya gyu dang bral bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'das nas /
translated: Since the roots of virtue are exalted above all worlds, they are free of the eighty-four thousand types of worms in the body.üîΩSince the roots of virtue are pure, they are free of mental deceit. Thus, they transcend the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth.

original: gong nas gong du lus dang sems yongs su dag pa 'dzin cing rgyu nyid du gyur pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sogs pa lhur len pa ma yin pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs te spyod pa dang /
analyzed: gong nas gong du lus dang sems yongs su dag pa 'dzin cing rgyu nyid du gyur pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sogs pa lhur len pa ma yin pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs te spyod pa dang /
translated: They uphold the purity of body and mind to an ever-increasing degree and become the cause for that. They are not preoccupied with gain, honor, and so forth. They take up and practice the twelve ascetic virtues.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i sems mi bskyed pa dang / blo brten zhing zab pas gzhan las chos nyan pa na chos nyid sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor yang dag par bsgrub pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i sems mi bskyed pa dang / blo brten zhing zab pas gzhan las chos nyan pa na chos nyid sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor yang dag par bsgrub pa dang /
translated: The yoga of the perfection of wisdom is the correct practice of the perfection of wisdom because it is the yoga of the perfection of wisdom that does not generate the mind of miserliness and so on, which are the factors incompatible with the perfections, and that is the basis of the mind and is profound.üîΩMoreover, the evil Mara emanates the eight great hells

original: yang bdud sdig can gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad sprul te /
analyzed: yang bdud sdig can gyis sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad sprul te /
translated: and,üîΩhaving placed the bodhisattva in the power of the sensation of suffering, which is the continuous suffering of falling into the lower realms and the unbearable suffering of being there, he says,

original: ngan song du lhung zhing sdug bsngal mi bzad pas rgyun du sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba'i dbang du byas pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ngan song du lhung zhing sdug bsngal mi bzad pas rgyun du sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba'i dbang du byas pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i phyir mi ldog par lung bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the prediction of the bodhisattva's irreversibility.

original: zhes bstan cing 'byed pa na sems mi 'khrugs par 'gro ba yongs su skyob cing /
analyzed: zhes bstan cing 'byed pa na sems mi 'khrugs par 'gro ba yongs su skyob cing /
translated: When this is revealed and divided, the bodhisattva's mind is not disturbed, but he protects all beings and,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las sems phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyis rtse mor gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las sems phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyis rtse mor gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: by the irreversibility of his mind from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, he is in the stage of the summit.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa'i drung du bdud sdig can dge sbyong gi cha byad du 'ongs te 'di skad du zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa'i drung du bdud sdig can dge sbyong gi cha byad du 'ongs te 'di skad du zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Again, in the presence of the bodhisattva, the sinful Mara, having come in the guise of an ascetic, says this...

original: lam gzhan bstan du zin kyang dge slong dgra bcom pa'i dpes gzhan la yid ches par mi 'gro ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: lam gzhan bstan du zin kyang dge slong dgra bcom pa'i dpes gzhan la yid ches par mi 'gro ba nyid yin no //
translated: ...even if he teaches another path, the monk who is an arhat does not go over to confidence in another.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar @115b des gang la yid ches pas 'gro ba'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba la sogs pa ni 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar @115b des gang la yid ches pas 'gro ba'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba la sogs pa ni 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Because he does not see any dharma whatsoever in which he could go over to confidence.

original: gzhan yang bdud sdig can 'jig rten pa'i rnam pas rus gong gi 'du shes la sogs pa lam gyi gzugs brnyan ston pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdud sdig can 'jig rten pa'i rnam pas rus gong gi 'du shes la sogs pa lam gyi gzugs brnyan ston pa na /
translated: Moreover, when the sinful Mara, with worldly forms, teaches the counterfeit path, such as the perception of skeletons,

original: 'di ni bdud sdig can yin no zhes khong du chud pas sems can thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sems mi bskyed pa'i phyir bzod par gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdud sdig can yin no zhes khong du chud pas sems can thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sems mi bskyed pa'i phyir bzod par gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: he understands, ‚ÄúThis is the sinful Mara,‚Äù and does not generate a thought of abandoning all sentient beings. Therefore, it is the stage of patience.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral bas de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par gsungs pa'i spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pas gnas shing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral bas de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par gsungs pa'i spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pas gnas shing /
translated: And by being inseparable from the attention of the perfection of wisdom, they abide in accordance with the conduct that is truly taught by the Tathagata.

original: spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las yongs su mi nyams pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las yongs su mi nyams pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ste /
translated: With the intention of not falling away from the perfection of generosity and so forth up to omniscience.

original: chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs so //
translated: This is the stage of the supreme mundane state.

original: mdo 'di'i don tshig lhug pas rgya cher bstan pa'i don rjes su dran par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo 'di'i don tshig lhug pas rgya cher bstan pa'i don rjes su dran par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to recall the meaning of this sutra, which is taught extensively in prose,

original: nye bar 'brel pa sdud pa'i tshig le 'ur byas pa ni drug yin te /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa ldog sogs rtags //
analyzed: nye bar 'brel pa sdud pa'i tshig le 'ur byas pa ni drug yin te / gzugs la sogs pa ldog sogs rtags //
translated: the connected verses are made into six chapters.üîΩThe characteristics of irreversibility are generated

original: rnam pa nyi shu bskyed pa yis //üîΩnges 'byed yan lag la gnas pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu bskyed pa yis // nges 'byed yan lag la gnas pa'i //
translated: by the twenty aspects

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid 'di //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid 'di //
translated: of the stage of abiding in the branches of penetration.

original: gzugs la sogs pas ldog pa dang // the tshom mi khom zad pa dang // bdag nyid dge ba la gnas shing //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pas ldog pa dang // the tshom mi khom zad pa dang // bdag nyid dge ba la gnas shing //
translated: and is himself established in virtue.üîΩHe establishes others in it,

original: gzhan dag de la dgod pa dang // gzhan gyi rten can sbyin sogs dang // zab mo'i don la som nyi med //üîΩbyams lus sogs dang sgrib pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan dag de la dgod pa dang // gzhan gyi rten can sbyin sogs dang // zab mo'i don la som nyi med // byams lus sogs dang sgrib pa ni //
translated: and his generosity and so on are based on others. He has no doubts about the profound meaning.üîΩHe is not accompanied by the five kinds of obscurations,üîΩand he destroys all latent dispositions. He has mindfulness and vigilance,üîΩand his clothes and so on are clean.

original: rnam pa lnga dang mi 'grogs dang ; / bag la nyal kun 'joms pa dang // dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dang // gos la sogs pa gtsang ba dang // lus la srin bu rnams mi 'byung //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga dang mi 'grogs dang ; / bag la nyal kun 'joms pa dang // dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dang // gos la sogs pa gtsang ba dang // lus la srin bu rnams mi 'byung //
translated: Worms do not grow in his body.

original: gya gyu med sems sbyangs pa ni //
analyzed: gya gyu med sems sbyangs pa ni //
translated: His mind is not crooked.üîΩHe is not greedy for gain and so on,üîΩand he is endowed with reality. He goes to the very end of the Dharma.üîΩHe seeks the hells for the sake of sentient beings.

original: len dang ser sna med sogs dang // chos nyid ldan pa 'gro nyid dang // sems can don du dmyal 'tshol dang // gzhan gyis bkri bar mi btub dang // lam gzhan nye bar ston bdud la //
analyzed: len dang ser sna med sogs dang // chos nyid ldan pa 'gro nyid dang // sems can don du dmyal 'tshol dang // gzhan gyis bkri bar mi btub dang // lam gzhan nye bar ston bdud la //
translated: He cannot be led astray by others.üîΩHe realizes that the mƒÅras who teach other pathsüîΩare mƒÅras.

original: bdud ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i spyod pa ste //
analyzed: bdud ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i spyod pa ste //
translated: He practices the conduct pleasing to the buddhas.

original: rtags ni nyi shu de dag gis //
analyzed: rtags ni nyi shu de dag gis //
translated: These twenty signs

original: drod dang rtse mo bzod dang bcas //
analyzed: drod dang rtse mo bzod dang bcas //
translated: are the signs of heat, peak, and forbearance.

original: chos mchog @116a * //üîΩrnams la gnas pa ni //
analyzed: chos mchog @116a * // rnams la gnas pa ni //
translated: The supreme qualitiesüîΩare the signs of the irreversible.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi ldog / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi ldog / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: The explanation of the characteristics of the irreversible bodhisattva is complete.

original: // / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas da ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: // / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas da ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: Having explained the characteristics of the irreversible bodhisattva in terms of the stage of the factors conducive to penetration, now, in order to explain the stage of the path of seeing, it is said:

original: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig bcu drug gis //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig bcu drug gis //
translated: On the path of seeing, through the sixteen moments of acceptance and knowledge,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //üîΩmtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i // mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //
translated: the bodhisattva

original: zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa la /
translated: is known to have the characteristics of irreversibility.

original: bcu drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the sixteen?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The forbearance that is the knowledge of the phenomena of suffering is the forbearance that is the non-returner in the context of the path of seeing.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes las phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes las phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the non-returner by the definition of not returning from the discriminations of form and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug ste /
translated: It is because the irreversible bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva enters into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva because all phenomena are empty of their own marks.

original: des chos de yang dmigs la des na mngon bar 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: des chos de yang dmigs la des na mngon bar 'du mi byed do //
translated: He observes those phenomena, but he does not form them.

original: des na skye bo de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba la bzod pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na skye bo de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba la bzod pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that person is called the irreversible bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who has forbearance for the non-arising of phenomena.‚Äù

original: 'du shes dang / mngon par 'du byed pa las ldog pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes dang / mngon par 'du byed pa las ldog pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //
translated: The reason is: because the characteristic of irreversibility is the turning away from perception and the formative forces.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni gang yang bdud sdig can nye bar 'ongs te mos pa zlog par byed cing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni gang yang bdud sdig can nye bar 'ongs te mos pa zlog par byed cing /
translated: When one knows the Dharma in relation to suffering, then even if Mara, the Evil One, were to come near and try to turn one away from one‚Äôs aspiration,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: one would know that the knowledge of all modes is like space, is the insubstantiality of all things,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: is empty of essential nature, and so on.

original: rtogs pa po dang / rtogs pa dang / rtogs par bya ba mi dmigs pas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa ldog pa na /üîΩde khong du chud cing sems brtan pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyis dam bcas pa'i sbyor bas ched du bya ba @116b las mi nyams pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rtogs pa po dang / rtogs pa dang / rtogs par bya ba mi dmigs pas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa ldog pa na / de khong du chud cing sems brtan pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyis dam bcas pa'i sbyor bas ched du bya ba @116b las mi nyams pa'i don gyis so //
translated: When one has understood that the knower, the knowing, and the known are not apprehended, and when one has turned away from the Dharma,üîΩthen one has understood that the knower, the knowing, and the known are not apprehended, and one has turned away from the Dharma.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught in the passage beginning with: ‚ÄúThe one who has understood this, who is firm in mind, unshakable, and unassailable, does not fall away from his vow through his application to it, because he does not fall away from his aim.‚Äù

original: de la sems brtan pa ni rgyun du gces par byed pas so //
analyzed: de la sems brtan pa ni rgyun du gces par byed pas so //
translated: The mind is firm in it because it is always cherished.

original: mi g-yo ba ni mngon sum du byed pas so //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni mngon sum du byed pas so //
translated: It is unshakable because it is made manifest.

original: mi 'phrogs pa ni gzhan rnams kyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa ni gzhan rnams kyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is not carried away because it is not the object of others.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis dag dang / rnam pa tham cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa'i bar la ldog pa dang / 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ldog pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa gnyis ka la mi brten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩbden pa la zhugs pa las ldog pa yod pa gang yin pa dang / bden pa la ma zhugs pa las 'jug pa yod pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis dag dang / rnam pa tham cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa'i bar la ldog pa dang / 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ldog pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa gnyis ka la mi brten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pas so zhes bstan pa yin no // bden pa la zhugs pa las ldog pa yod pa gang yin pa dang / bden pa la ma zhugs pa las 'jug pa yod pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: The acceptance of the knowledge of the path in regard to suffering is taught by the teaching of the bodhisattva who does not rely on either the turning back or the non-turning back of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, up to the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe turning back from entering the truths and the entering into not entering the truths

original: 'dir ldog pa dang / mi ldog par sbyar gyi /üîΩldog pa tsam mam /
analyzed: 'dir ldog pa dang / mi ldog par sbyar gyi / ldog pa tsam mam /
translated: are here to be connected with turning back and not turning back,üîΩbut not with mere turning back

original: 'jug pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: or mere entering.

original: skad cig ma gsum la ni rjes su shes pa dang 'brel bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar lhung bar 'gyur ba mi srid de /
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum la ni rjes su shes pa dang 'brel bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar lhung bar 'gyur ba mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible for them to fall to the ≈õrƒÅvaka and so on levels, because they are connected to subsequent knowledge in three moments.

original: de ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they have obtained the antidote to the three realms.üîΩThe subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering is for bodhisattvas who abide in the elimination of the branches.
