original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni gang yan lag zad par byed pa spang ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dbang du mdzad nas mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni gang yan lag zad par byed pa spang ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dbang du mdzad nas mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
translated: With regard to the nine serial absorptions, the thirty seven factors of enlightenment and the three doors of liberation,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: they enter into meditative equipoise on concentration.

original: de'i 'bras bu thob par mi byed pas yan lag zad par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir yan lag zad par byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu thob par mi byed pas yan lag zad par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir yan lag zad par byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But because they do not obtain the result of that concentration, they are called eliminators of the branches, because they take up a body that is suitable for sentient beings in order to eliminate the branches.

original: bsam gtan nam snyoms par 'jug pa gang la yan lag gang yod pa de spong ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: bsam gtan nam snyoms par 'jug pa gang la yan lag gang yod pa de spong ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúabiding in the abandonment of any branch of any meditative absorption or equipoise‚Äù is that.üîΩFor example, ‚Äúthe first meditative absorption has five branches‚Äù and so on.

original: dper na bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yan lag zad par byed pa zhes smos pa'i rjes su shes pas ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i gnyen po nyid yin par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: dper na bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yan lag zad par byed pa zhes smos pa'i rjes su shes pas ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i gnyen po nyid yin par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe exhaustion of the branches‚Äù is made in order to understand that it is the antidote to the form and formless realms.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i gnas skabs su @117a * //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i gnas skabs su @117a * //
translated: ‚ÄúBy maintaining a state that is in accordance with‚Äù means that in the situation of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: the bodhisattva is free from attachment and abandons the branches.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po byang chub yid la byed pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po byang chub yid la byed pa dang ldan te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe acceptance of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the origin‚Äù is when the bodhisattva, endowed with the attention of enlightenment,

original: byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba nyid kyis lus dang sems yang ba nyid kyis gzugs lhur len pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas blta ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lhur len pa nyid kyi bar du rgya cher bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba nyid kyis lus dang sems yang ba nyid kyis gzugs lhur len pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas blta ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lhur len pa nyid kyi bar du rgya cher bkag pa yin no //
translated: Not being separated from the Thought of Enlightenment is the very clearing away of the discriminations to be abandoned by the Path of Seeing. It is the non-preoccupation with form, etc., because of the lightness of body and mind. It is the non-preoccupation with the Buddhas, etc., up to the non-preoccupation with the generation of the roots of virtue. This is the extensive refutation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar de'i chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam zhing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de'i chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam zhing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //
translated: It is because all his dharmas are equal to space, and are the insubstantiality of own-nature, the emptiness of own-mark. This is the logical proof.

original: de ltar yid la byed pa na /
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa na /
translated: When one thus attends to the mind,

original: 'o na spyod lam thams cad du 'khrul ba med pa'i sems kyis byed pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na spyod lam thams cad du 'khrul ba med pa'i sems kyis byed pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that one acts with a mind that is not confused in all one's activities.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa ni gang yang khyim na gnas pa thabs la mkhas pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga len pa dang / zas la sogs pa'i yo byad mang zhing sna tshogs pas sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bdag nyid gnas pa dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa ni gang yang khyim na gnas pa thabs la mkhas pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga len pa dang / zas la sogs pa'i yo byad mang zhing sna tshogs pas sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bdag nyid gnas pa dang /
translated: Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin is the skill in means of a layperson who enjoys the five sense objects and who practices the perfection of generosity by possessing many various necessities such as food and so on.

original: gzhan dag yang dag par dgod pa dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag yang dag par dgod pa dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is also the correct establishment of others in that practice and rejoicing in it through praising it.

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par tshangs par spyod pa dang / gzhan mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa mi byed ces bya ba ni rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par tshangs par spyod pa dang / gzhan mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa mi byed ces bya ba ni rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Acceptance of subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin is the constant practice of celibacy and the nonperformance of harm that is unpleasant for others.

original: 'khrug pa'i 'dod chags spang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i 'dod chags spang ba yin no //
translated: This is the abandonment of sexual desire that is agitation.

original: gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'di zhi gnas kyis rgyud mnyen pa nyid du ston pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'di zhi gnas kyis rgyud mnyen pa nyid du ston pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling nas brtsams te /
translated: Because he does not harm others, he demonstrates that his mindstream is pliable through calm abiding.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jigs rten gyi khams kyi bar du rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ba sbyin pa gtong ba dang / lag na rdo rje'i rigs lnga rjes su 'brang bas de la bdud la sogs pas mi brdzi ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jigs rten gyi khams kyi bar du rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ba sbyin pa gtong ba dang / lag na rdo rje'i rigs lnga rjes su 'brang bas de la bdud la sogs pas mi brdzi ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: He demonstrates that he is not overwhelmed by demons and so on through the five classes of Vajrapani who follow him.

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni gang sems mi g-yeng ba thob pas dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po @117b ma tshang ba med pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa la dbang thob pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni gang sems mi g-yeng ba thob pas dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po @117b ma tshang ba med pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa la dbang thob pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin is the attainment of the five faculties of faith and so on that are not incomplete because he has attained undistracted mind and he has attained control over not forgetting the mind of enlightenment.

original: skyes bu dam par gyur pa nyid dang / bud med dbang du 'gyur ba'i sngags dang / rig pa dang / sman dang / rtsi la sogs pa dang / bud med dang / skyes pa la sogs pa ze slong ba'i sbyor ba mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dam par gyur pa nyid dang / bud med dbang du 'gyur ba'i sngags dang / rig pa dang / sman dang / rtsi la sogs pa dang / bud med dang / skyes pa la sogs pa ze slong ba'i sbyor ba mi byed pa yin no //
translated: He does not practice the mantra, knowledge, medicine, herbs, etc. which bring women under one‚Äôs power, or the practice of soliciting women, men, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi mthong ba dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas gnas pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi mthong ba dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas gnas pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva, due to the emptiness of inherent characteristics, does not see any characteristics in all dharmas, and abides with a pure livelihood.

original: de la yan lag tshogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni sman no //
analyzed: de la yan lag tshogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni sman no //
translated: Among them, medicine has the characteristic of combining ingredients.

original: yan lag gcig pa ni rtsi'o //
analyzed: yan lag gcig pa ni rtsi'o //
translated: A single ingredient is a herb.

original: yang na nad skyes pa gso bar byed pa ni sman no //
analyzed: yang na nad skyes pa gso bar byed pa ni sman no //
translated: Or, that which cures a sickness that has arisen is medicine.

original: phyis mi skye bar byed pa 'gegs pa ni rtsi'o //
analyzed: phyis mi skye bar byed pa 'gegs pa ni rtsi'o //
translated: That which prevents it from arising again in the future is an herb.

original: yang na lus la bgos pa'i gnas skabs thob par byed pa ni sman no //
analyzed: yang na lus la bgos pa'i gnas skabs thob par byed pa ni sman no //
translated: Or, that which brings about the state of being applied to the body is medicine.

original: mi rgas pa'i khyad par thob par byed pa ni rtsi zhes bya ste rnam grangs gzhan no //
analyzed: mi rgas pa'i khyad par thob par byed pa ni rtsi zhes bya ste rnam grangs gzhan no //
translated: The other synonyms are: ‚Äúthe elixir‚Äù which causes the attainment of the special state of an aged person, and ‚Äúthe medicine‚Äù which cures the disease of the afflictions.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na byang chub yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na byang chub yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The forbearance of the dharma knowledge of cessation is from the passage beginning: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, here the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom is never separate from the attention of enlightenment‚Äù up to

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba bkag pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i phyin ci log yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba bkag pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i phyin ci log yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äúthe application and subsequent application to the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres are stopped.‚Äù This is in order to understand the errors of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba smos pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa gnyis dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa gnyis go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba snga ma dang /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba smos pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa gnyis dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa gnyis go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba snga ma dang /
translated: The mention of application and subsequent application is in order to understand the two truths of suffering and origin and the two truths of cessation and path in order, as the former and latter applications and subsequent applications.

original: phyi mar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi mar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be known in the future.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ni 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang bzang po'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang bzang po'am /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause, in this way, by abiding in the emptiness of its intrinsic nature, he does not see any dharma as good or bad.

original: ngan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ngan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: phyin ci ma ldog pa'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir ni 'thad pa yin no //üîΩ'gog pa la chos shes pa ni gang rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i dge ba'i phyogs 'phrog pa'i bar chad kyi chos kyi @118a * //
analyzed: phyin ci ma ldog pa'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir ni 'thad pa yin no // 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni gang rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i dge ba'i phyogs 'phrog pa'i bar chad kyi chos kyi @118a * //
translated: It is tenable because it is non-inverted knowledge.

original: gtam la sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor bar gnas pa bkag pas de dag shin tu mi snang bar gyur pa'i don bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: gtam la sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor bar gnas pa bkag pas de dag shin tu mi snang bar gyur pa'i don bstan pa nyid de /
translated: The Dharma knowledge of cessation is the teaching of the meaning that those who are engaged in and devoted to the Dharma teachings that are obstacles that steal away the side of virtue that serves as the cause of realization are completely non-apparent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la chos gang yang 'phrog pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la chos gang yang 'phrog pa'am /
translated: This is because,

original: sbyin par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas so //
analyzed: sbyin par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas so //
translated: in this way, he does not see any dharma that is stolen or given away in regard to dharmas that are empty of their own marks.üîΩThis is the tenable explanation.

original: gtam smos pa ni dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung shes pa'i dus su 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtam smos pa ni dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung shes pa'i dus su 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúdiscourse‚Äù is to indicate that the conceptualization of things ceases at the time of the knowledge of suffering and origination.

original: 'gog pa shes pa ni gtam gyi sbyor ba tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ni gtam gyi sbyor ba tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of cessation is the knowledge of the antidote to conceptualization, merely through the application of discourse.

original: de lta bu'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With this situation in mind,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: it is said:

original: 'di dag thams cad ming tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ming tsam ste /
translated: All this is mere name,

original: 'du shes tsam du rab tu gnas //üîΩbrjod pa las ni gzhan gyur pa //
analyzed: 'du shes tsam du rab tu gnas // brjod pa las ni gzhan gyur pa //
translated: it is established as mere ideation.üîΩApart from verbalization,

original: brjod par bya ba yod ma yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yod ma yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: there is no object of verbalization.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gtam mang po rnam pa sna tshogs pa chos kyi gtam gyi sbyor ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gtam mang po rnam pa sna tshogs pa chos kyi gtam gyi sbyor ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The acceptance of the knowledge of the subsequent cessation is the application of the discourse of Dharma, the various kinds of generosity and so forth that are the accumulation of enlightenment, as before.

original: 'gog ba shes pa ni gnas skabs su yang dag par bsgrub pa mang po dang nye bar ldan pa'i don ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog ba shes pa ni gnas skabs su yang dag par bsgrub pa mang po dang nye bar ldan pa'i don ston pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of cessation is the teaching of the meaning of the possession of many perfect accomplishments in the state of.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ni 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang nyung ngu'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang nyung ngu'am /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause, by abiding in the emptiness of its intrinsic reality, one does not see any dharma as few or many.

original: mang por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i 'thad pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mang por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i 'thad pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught by the logical argument.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ni gang gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag gsod pa po dang / gsad par bya ba'i g-yul gyi gtam ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ni gang gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag gsod pa po dang / gsad par bya ba'i g-yul gyi gtam ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The subsequent knowledge of cessation is the discourse of the battle between the slayer and the slain, which is the antidote and the opposing side.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩlam gyi de bzhin nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang chags pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / lam gyi de bzhin nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang chags pa'am /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause, by abiding in the suchness of the path, one does not see any dharma as attached or

original: khong khro ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khong khro ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: averse. This is taught.

original: gang de lta bu'i gnas su rang nyid kyis rnam par smin pa'i 'gog pa rnam pa bzhi las gang gis 'dir dbang po'i grong 'gog pa dang / de nas gzhan yang rnam par smin pa ma lus pa'i dbang po'i grong gi @118b gtam ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gang de lta bu'i gnas su rang nyid kyis rnam par smin pa'i 'gog pa rnam pa bzhi las gang gis 'dir dbang po'i grong 'gog pa dang / de nas gzhan yang rnam par smin pa ma lus pa'i dbang po'i grong gi @118b gtam ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, the story of the city of the faculties, the complete cessation of karmic ripening, is as before.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar de chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang tshogs sam /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang tshogs sam /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause in this way, by abiding in the emptiness of all phenomena, one does not see any phenomenon as a collection or not a collection.

original: tshogs ma yin par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs ma yin par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: dbang po'i rten 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i grong khyer 'gog pa ni gang /
analyzed: dbang po'i rten 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i grong khyer 'gog pa ni gang /
translated: What is the cessation of the city of the great elements, the support of the faculties?

original: de nas dbang po'i rten du gyur pa 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i grong khyer gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas dbang po'i rten du gyur pa 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i grong khyer gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then, the application of the story of the city of the elements that become the support of the faculties is as before.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nam mkha' stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang la yang gzung ba'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang la yang gzung ba'am /
translated: Because he abides in the emptiness of space, he does not see any dharma as something to be grasped or not grasped.

original: mi gzung bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gzung bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: dbang po'i yul gyi grong rdal la 'gog pa ni gang /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul gyi grong rdal la 'gog pa ni gang /
translated: What is the cessation of the city of the objects of the senses?

original: de nas gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi grong rdal gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi grong rdal gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then, the application of the discourse on the city of objects such as form is the same as before.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas chos gang yang 'phel ba'am /
analyzed: de yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas chos gang yang 'phel ba'am /
translated: Because he abides in the limit of reality, he does not see any dharma as increasing or

original: 'grib par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grib par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: decreasing. This is the teaching.

original: bdag tu mngon bar zhen pa 'gog pa ni gang de nas rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings bsgoms bas de'i bdag nyid can nyid kyis gnas yongs su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir gtam gyi spyor ba la mi gnas pa snga ma bzhin
analyzed: bdag tu mngon bar zhen pa 'gog pa ni gang de nas rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings bsgoms bas de'i bdag nyid can nyid kyis gnas yongs su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir gtam gyi spyor ba la mi gnas pa snga ma bzhin
translated: The cessation of clinging to a self is when, through cultivating the completely pure realm of phenomena in all aspects, one abides in the transformation of the basis because of having that nature. The application of the discourse is the same as before.

original: no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: no // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtam gyi sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la gnas par gsungs pa ni 'thad pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtam gyi sbyor ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba la gnas par gsungs pa ni 'thad pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is tenable that he is said to abide in the application and subsequent application of the perfection of wisdom through mental attention endowed with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'gog pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di yang khams gsum po re re na yang yod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'gog pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di yang khams gsum po re re na yang yod par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these four types of cessation of karmic maturation exist in each of the three realms.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re zhig dbang po la 'gog ba ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa gang na dbang po gang zhig yod pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig dbang po la 'gog ba ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa gang na dbang po gang zhig yod pa ste /
translated: First, the cessation of faculties is in the absorptions and formless states where a particular faculty exists.

original: ji ltar yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / btang snyoms kyi yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms la ni btang snyoms dang // tshor ba'i bye brag bsam gtan skyes //
analyzed: ji ltar yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / btang snyoms kyi yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms la ni btang snyoms dang // tshor ba'i bye brag bsam gtan skyes //
translated: As it is said, Joy, equanimity, equanimity and joy, and equanimity arise in the absorptions due to the distinction of feeling,

original: zhes bshad pa dang / gzugs med na ni btang snyoms dang // srog dang yid kyi dbang po yod //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa dang / gzugs med na ni btang snyoms dang // srog dang yid kyi dbang po yod //
translated: and in the formless states, equanimity, life force, and the faculty of thought exist.
Thus it is taught.

original: bstan to // ji ltar de dbang po'i rten 'gog pa yin zhe na /üîΩrigs mthun pa dang srog la 'dir //
analyzed: bstan to // ji ltar de dbang po'i rten 'gog pa yin zhe na / rigs mthun pa dang srog la 'dir //
translated: How is it the cessation of the support of the sense faculties?üîΩHere, the continuum of mind is understood

original: sems kyi rgyud ni rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud ni rtogs pa yin //
translated: in terms of similarity and life force.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no /
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: dbang po'i yul gyi grong rdal ni de na yod pa yid kyi yul chos rnams kyang 'gog pa yin no ;
analyzed: dbang po'i yul gyi grong rdal ni de na yod pa yid kyi yul chos rnams kyang 'gog pa yin no ;
translated: The cessation of the objects of the sense faculties, the cities, is also the cessation of the objects of mind, the dharmas, that exist there.

original: / bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ni thams cad na yod pa'i phyir de thams cad du'ang 'gog pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: / bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ni thams cad na yod pa'i phyir de thams cad du'ang 'gog pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since clinging to self exists everywhere, cessation is everywhere.

original: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
translated: The acceptance of the knowledge of dharmas on the path is for one who practices the six perfections.

original: ser sna la sogs pa'i rjes su sbyor ba la brtson pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / bzod pa bar chad med pa'i lam yin pa nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rgyu nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas shing chos 'dod pa 'di nyid kyis dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'i rjes su 'jug pa shes par bya ba'i phyir dang /

translated: Because it stops one from striving to follow miserliness and so on, because it is the uninterrupted path of patience, because it is the cause of freedom from affliction, because it is the cause of freedom from attachment and because it is the cause of the abandonment of attachment, it is the antidote to attachment.üîΩüîΩBecause it is the cause of the abandonment of anger, it is the antidote to anger.üîΩ

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i bshes gnyen mngon du bya bar 'dod pas mnyes par byed pa nyid kyis shin tu khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob pa'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pas 'gro ba rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bskul ba dang /
translated: One should understand that the cause of attaining the special state of a buddha or bodhisattva spiritual master is pleasing them,

original: gzhug pa dang / rab tu 'jog pas khyad par rtogs pas thob pa'i tshogs 'dod pas sangs rgyas mngon du gyur par skye zhing /
analyzed: gzhug pa dang / rab tu 'jog pas khyad par rtogs pas thob pa'i tshogs 'dod pas sangs rgyas mngon du gyur par skye zhing /

analyzed: skye ba la dbang ba shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: nang stong pa nyid nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa la gnas pa'i bar gyi rang gis la dogs pa med pa nyid kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam nyid du shes pa'i bral ba thob pa'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir /

translated: In order to know the cause of attaining freedom, the path of liberation, by means of the absence of doubt regarding the path of the noble ones, from the emptiness of internal phenomena up to the door of liberation that is the wishlessness.

original: phyir @119b mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ni /

analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pa'i skyes bu'i dpes yang dag pa la gnas shing /

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa'i sems ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bzlog par mi nus so //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ni 'di ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' la nem nur med pa'i phyir gcig gam /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' la nem nur med pa'i phyir gcig gam /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because one does not see the limit of reality as either one or two, because one has no doubt about the limit of reality.

original: tshe 'phos su zin kyang nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems mi skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe 'phos su zin kyang nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems mi skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because even if one were to die, one would not generate the thought of a ≈õrƒÅvaka and so on.

original: sbyor ba theg pa gzhan du nges par 'byung ba med pas gcig tu nges pa nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba theg pa gzhan du nges par 'byung ba med pas gcig tu nges pa nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one should know that the application is definitely not liberation in another vehicle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all phenomena are empty of their own marks.

original: skye ba'am / 'gag pa lam chen po'i chen por rtog pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i bar du spong ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'am / 'gag pa lam chen po'i chen por rtog pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i bar du spong ba yin no //
translated: One abandons the conception of great arising and cessation, up to the conception of small arising and cessation.

original: dang po nyid lam chen po skye ba'i phyir dang / lam chen po skyes pa na nyon mongs pa chen po yod pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dang po nyid lam chen po skye ba'i phyir dang / lam chen po skyes pa na nyon mongs pa chen po yod pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the great path arises from the beginning, and when the great path arises, it is impossible for there to be great afflictions.

original: dang por gos kyi dri ma chen po bsal nas phyis chung ba dag par byed pa dang / mun pa chen po ni snang ba chung @120a * //üîΩngus sel la /
analyzed: dang por gos kyi dri ma chen po bsal nas phyis chung ba dag par byed pa dang / mun pa chen po ni snang ba chung @120a * // ngus sel la /
translated: First, the great stains of clothing are removed and later the small stains are removed.üîΩGreat darkness is removed by small light.

original: chung ngu ni chen pos sel ba'i dpes chung ngus chen po sel ba'i dpe de rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu ni chen pos sel ba'i dpes chung ngus chen po sel ba'i dpe de rigs pa yin no //
translated: The example of small removing great is reasonable.

original: dkar po'i chos ni stobs dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: dkar po'i chos ni stobs dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: White dharmas are powerful

original: nag po ni nyam chung ba yin pas 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig ma gcig la chung ngus kyang 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i nyon mongs pa chen po brtan pa rtsa ba nas 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nag po ni nyam chung ba yin pas 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig ma gcig la chung ngus kyang 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i nyon mongs pa chen po brtan pa rtsa ba nas 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and black dharmas are weak, because even small white dharmas uproot great, stable afflictions that have been transmitted from beginningless samsara in a single moment of the ƒÅrya path.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang dus mang por bsags pa'i nad rnams dur byid kyi khu ba btang bas nad rnams sel ba dang mtshungs pa dang / skad cig ma gcig la sgron me chung ngun  gyis mun pa chen po 'joms pa dang 'dra'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang dus mang por bsags pa'i nad rnams dur byid kyi khu ba btang bas nad rnams sel ba dang mtshungs pa dang / skad cig ma gcig la sgron me chung ngun  gyis mun pa chen po 'joms pa dang 'dra'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The master Vasubandhu also explains that it is like the case of many illnesses accumulated over a long time being removed by taking myrobalan fruit, and like the case of a small lamp instantly destroying great darkness.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bas bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du dkon mchog gsum la zang zing gi sbyin pa sbyin bas zhes bya ba la sogsüîΩpas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bas bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du dkon mchog gsum la zang zing gi sbyin pa sbyin bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the great of the great aspects of conceptuality is taught to be that which, due to being separated from the perfection of wisdom, gives material gifts to the Three Jewels for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges river.

original: de'i gnyen po lam gyi rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa la sogs pa la brtson par byed na /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po lam gyi rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa la sogs pa la brtson par byed na /
translated: The small of the small aspects of the path that is the antidote to that is that which, when one strives in listening to the perfection of wisdom and so forth,

original: de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: one's merit greatly increases.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ni 'di yin no zhes 'bad pas bstan pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ni 'di yin no zhes 'bad pas bstan pa 'di yin no //
translated: This is the path of the great bodhisattvas who are fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rnam par rtog pa chen po'i 'bring ni gang de nyid bskal pa de srid du /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chen po'i 'bring ni gang de nyid bskal pa de srid du /
translated: The medium of the great discriminations is taught as follows: ‚ÄúFor that long, for that many eons,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la zang zing gi yon phul bas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la zang zing gi yon phul bas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: one would offer material gifts to the Stream-Enterers up to the TathƒÅgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened Ones.‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù means being without the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the following.

original: 'di'i gnyen po'i lam chung ngu'i 'bring ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed na bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: 'di'i gnyen po'i lam chung ngu'i 'bring ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed na bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: The small of the medium antidote path is taught as follows: ‚ÄúIf one exerts oneself in the perfection of wisdom, merit increases greatly.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'das nas /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'das nas /
translated: Having transcended the stages of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and so on,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @120b 'thad pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @120b 'thad pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chung ngu ni gang yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du gnas shing sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab bsgoms pas so zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chung ngu ni gang yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du gnas shing sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab bsgoms pas so zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The small of the great discriminations is taught by ‚Äúwho abides for that many eons and cultivates generosity, morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom.‚Äù

original: 'di'i gnyen po'i lam chung ngu'i chen po ni gang cig shos nyin zhag gcig la sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: 'di'i gnyen po'i lam chung ngu'i chen po ni gang cig shos nyin zhag gcig la sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: The great of the small counteragent path is taught by ‚Äúthe other who has generosity and so on for one day has much greater merit.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di la gnas na chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la gnas na chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since it causes the completion of all dharmas when one abides in it, the perfection of wisdom is the mother of the bodhisattvas. This is the demonstration of the logical possibility.

original: cig shos zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: cig shos zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The other is one who is endowed with striving in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the following.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chen po ni gang yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du sems can rnams la chos kyi sbyin pas zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chen po ni gang yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du sems can rnams la chos kyi sbyin pas zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The middling of the great discriminations is taught by for that long, he would give the gift of Dharma to sentient beings.

original: de'i gnyen po'i lam 'bring gi chung ngu ni gang cig shos kyis nyin zhag gcig chos kyi sbyin pa byin pas de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i lam 'bring gi chung ngu ni gang cig shos kyis nyin zhag gcig chos kyi sbyin pa byin pas de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: The small of the middling path that is the antidote to that is taught by the other, by giving the gift of Dharma for one day, would have an increase in merit that is greater than that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa dang ma bral bar yongs su bsngo ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral bar gnas pa nyid 'thad pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa dang ma bral bar yongs su bsngo ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral bar gnas pa nyid 'thad pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is tenable that one who dedicates without being separated from the perfection of wisdom is one who abides without being separated from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi 'bring ni gang yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du bsam gtan bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la brtson par byas pa bas zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi 'bring ni gang yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du bsam gtan bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la brtson par byas pa bas zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The medium of the medium is taught by ‚Äúeven if one were to make an effort at the four concentrations and the four establishments of mindfulness for that many eons, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, it is not comparable.‚Äù

original: 'di'i gnyen po lam 'bring gi 'bring ni cig shos kyis de rnams la nyin zhag gcig mngon bar brtson par byas na de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: 'di'i gnyen po lam 'bring gi 'bring ni cig shos kyis de rnams la nyin zhag gcig mngon bar brtson par byas na de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: The medium of the medium antidote to that is taught by ‚Äúif the other were to make an effort at those for one day, his merit would increase much more.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar gnas pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las phyir ldog pa'i gnas skabs med cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar gnas pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las phyir ldog pa'i gnas skabs med cing /
translated: It is tenable because of definite emergence from one extreme.üîΩThe small of the middling discriminations are those of the small of the small.üîΩThat one who abides without being separated from the perfection of wisdom has no occasion to turn away from the knowledge of all aspects, and it is not possible.

original: gnas ma yin pa nyid du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa nyid du'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is tenable because of definite emergence from one extreme.üîΩThe small of the middling discriminations are those of the small of the small.üîΩThat one who abides without being separated from the perfection of wisdom has no occasion to turn away from the knowledge of all aspects, and it is not possible.üîΩIt is tenable because of definite emergence from one extreme.

original: mtha' gcig tu nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni 'thad ba yin no //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ni 'thad ba yin no //
translated: The small of the middling discriminations are those of the small of the small.üîΩThat one who abides without being separated from the perfection of wisdom has no occasion to turn away from the knowledge of all aspects, and it is not possible.üîΩIt is tenable because of definite emergence from one extreme.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chung ngu ni gang yang @121a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chung ngu ni gang yang @121a * //
translated: The small of the middling discriminations are those of the small of the small.

original: de'i bskal pa de snyed zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / nang du yang dag 'jog pa dang ldan pa yid la byed pa de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bas zhes smos pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bskal pa de snyed zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / nang du yang dag 'jog pa dang ldan pa yid la byed pa de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bas zhes smos pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: That one who abides without being separated from the perfection of wisdom has no occasion to turn away from the knowledge of all aspects, and it is not possible.üîΩIt is tenable because of definite emergence from one extreme.

original: 'di'i gnyen po lam 'bring gi chen po ni gang cig shos kyis nyi ma gcig zang zing gi sbyin pa de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: 'di'i gnyen po lam 'bring gi chen po ni gang cig shos kyis nyi ma gcig zang zing gi sbyin pa de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: The small of the middling discriminations are those of the small of the small.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: That one who abides without being separated from the perfection of wisdom has no occasion to turn away from the knowledge of all aspects, and it is not possible.üîΩIt is tenable because of definite emergence from one extreme.üîΩThe small of the middling discriminations are those of the small of the small.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni mtshan nyid do zhes bya bas 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni mtshan nyid do zhes bya bas 'thad pa yin no //
translated: The dedication of the perfection of wisdom is the characteristic.

original: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chen po ni gang yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci yod pa de dag thams cad la rjes su yi rang nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chen po ni gang yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci yod pa de dag thams cad la rjes su yi rang nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs
translated: The small of the great discriminations is when someone dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment the wholesome roots of whatever Buddhas, Blessed Ones, there are in the past, present and future, together with their communities of ≈õrƒÅvakas, after rejoicing in them for that many eons.

original: su bsngo bas zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: su bsngo bas zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught by the phrase ‚Äúafter rejoicing in them, dedicating to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di'i gnyen po'i lam chen po'i chung du ni gang cig shos kyis nyi ma gcig rjes su yi rang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsdos na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: 'di'i gnyen po'i lam chen po'i chung du ni gang cig shos kyis nyi ma gcig rjes su yi rang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsdos na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: The small of the great antidote path is when someone else, after rejoicing in the wholesome roots for one day, dedicates them to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. The merit increases much more than that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i bsngo ba ni mchog nyid yin no zhes 'thad pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i bsngo ba ni mchog nyid yin no zhes 'thad pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the dedication of rejoicing in the perfection of wisdom is the best.

original: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i 'bring ni gang mngon bar 'du byas pa ni yongs su btags pa nyid kyis bsod nams mang du skye ba na /üîΩmngon bar 'du byas pas yang dag par lta ba bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i 'bring ni gang mngon bar 'du byas pa ni yongs su btags pa nyid kyis bsod nams mang du skye ba na / mngon bar 'du byas pas yang dag par lta ba bskyed pa'am /
translated: The medium of the small discrimination is that when much merit is produced by mere imputation,üîΩone does not wish to generate the correct view through application,

original: skyon med par 'jug pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba mi nus pas mi 'dod pa bskyed pa nyid do zhes bstan ba yin no //
analyzed: skyon med par 'jug pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba mi nus pas mi 'dod pa bskyed pa nyid do zhes bstan ba yin no //
translated: or to enter the faultless state of unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment and fully awaken.

original: de'i gnyen po'i lam chen po'i 'bring ni gang rab 'byor mngon du byas pa de yang stong pa nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i lam chen po'i 'bring ni gang rab 'byor mngon du byas pa de yang stong pa nyid du snang ngo //
translated: The medium of the great antidote is that, Subh≈´ti, that which is made manifest appears as emptiness.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni snying po med pa nyid du snang bar bshad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni snying po med pa nyid du snang bar bshad do //
translated: The emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of own-characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence are explained as the appearance of essencelessness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du shin tu bslabs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du shin tu bslabs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because of thorough training in inner emptiness up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence. This is taught as the logical argument.

original: yang mngon bar 'du byas pa ni go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas stong pa nyid du snang ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang mngon bar 'du byas pa ni go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas stong pa nyid du snang ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir brjod pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the four aspects beginning with the appearance of emptiness are stated in terms of the accomplishment of armor, engagement, accumulation, and definite emergence.

original: de yang de rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni go cha chen po bgos pa lags par rig par bgyi ste /
analyzed: de yang de rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni go cha chen po bgos pa lags par rig par bgyi ste /
translated: Moreover, according to my understanding of the meaning of the words spoken by the Lord, those bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas should be known as wearing the great armor,

original: ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni mi skye ba'i chos nyid lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni mi skye ba'i chos nyid lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: just as the emptiness of intrinsic nature is the unborn nature of dharmas.

original: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa rjes su mi mthong bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa la go bzlog par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa rjes su mi mthong bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa la go bzlog par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that because of not seeing the small of the small conceptualizations and so forth, in order to turn away from the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth, it should be known.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang bdag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam pa'i nges par mngon bar byang chub pa dang mi 'bral ba'i sbyor ba shes pa'i phyir
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gang bdag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam pa'i nges par mngon bar byang chub pa dang mi 'bral ba'i sbyor ba shes pa'i phyir
translated: The acceptance of subsequent knowledge of the path is the application of the knowledge that one will definitely attain manifest complete enlightenment in one‚Äôs unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: ro // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ro // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment is empty of its own characteristics.

original: de ltar gnas pa ni rang gi sa la gnas pa ni thams cad shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa ni rang gi sa la gnas pa ni thams cad shes pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, abiding in one‚Äôs own level is the knowledge of all phenomena.

original: @122a * // gzhan gyi lam la rag ma lus pa ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: @122a * // gzhan gyi lam la rag ma lus pa ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
translated: Not depending on the paths of others is the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: gzhan gyis gzhol bar mi nus pa ni rang gis zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhol bar mi nus pa ni rang gis zhes bya ste /
translated: Not being able to be diverted by others is called ‚Äúone‚Äôs own‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: and is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yang bral ba thob pa de ni bdud kyi las yin par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: yang bral ba thob pa de ni bdud kyi las yin par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Moreover, the attainment of freedom is the power of realization of the deeds of MƒÅra.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause one who is thus situated, by possessing unassailable intuition, should attain the state of an arhat right now.

original: de ltar gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid kyis na 'di nyid du dgra bcom pa thob par gyis shig / khyod ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ma bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid kyis na 'di nyid du dgra bcom pa thob par gyis shig / khyod ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ma bstan to //
translated: You have not been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gang gis khyod lung bstan par 'gyur ba mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa khyod kyis ma thob bo //
analyzed: gang gis khyod lung bstan par 'gyur ba mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa khyod kyis ma thob bo //
translated: You have not attained the acceptance that things are not produced, by which you would be predicted.

original: des yon tan gyi khyad par mngon par bsgrub pa shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / yang gzungs thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyis nyen pa po'i lha la sogs pa'i skad dang brda la sogs pa la nges par rnyed pa nyid kyis de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid 'gog pa thob pas sems can smin par bya ba'i thabs kyis byed pa shes parüîΩbya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des yon tan gyi khyad par mngon par bsgrub pa shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / yang gzungs thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyis nyen pa po'i lha la sogs pa'i skad dang brda la sogs pa la nges par rnyed pa nyid kyis de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid 'gog pa thob pas sems can smin par bya ba'i thabs kyis byed pa shes par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate the special qualities that are accomplished, and in order to demonstrate the method of ripening sentient beings through the attainment of the sign of irreversibility, the stage of definite emergence.

original: yon tan chen po dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i bzod pa thob pa de ni yon tan chen po dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan chen po dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i bzod pa thob pa de ni yon tan chen po dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Possessing great qualities means that one who has attained the previously explained acceptance possesses great qualities.

original: gang 'di ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang 'bral bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang 'di ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang 'bral bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is separated from the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i shes pa thob pa ni yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i shes pa thob pa ni yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Endowed with immeasurable good qualities means that one who has attained the knowledge as it has been taught is endowed with immeasurable good qualities.

original: dus gsum rnams tshad med pa'i phyir dang / gang 'di ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa yang mi skye bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum rnams tshad med pa'i phyir dang / gang 'di ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa yang mi skye bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three times are immeasurable, and because one causes the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing not to arise.

original: yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni des phyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon bar 'grub pa ni de'i yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni des phyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon bar 'grub pa ni de'i yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Endowed with immeasurable good qualities means that later, when one has attained the knowledge of all aspects, one is endowed with immeasurable good qualities.

original: gang 'di ltar tshad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang 'di ltar tshad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the knowledge of all aspects, which cannot be measured in this way.

original: de ltar ji skad du /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad du /
translated: Thus, as it is said:

original: rab 'byor de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, why is that?

original: 'di ltar de nyid kyi phyir 'dis ni mtha' las 'das pa mthar thug pa med pa'i ye shes thob pa dang / rtogs par mi nus pa'i ye shes rab tu thob pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid kyi phyir 'dis ni mtha' las 'das pa mthar thug pa med pa'i ye shes thob pa dang / rtogs par mi nus pa'i ye shes rab tu thob pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, he has attained the wisdom that transcends the extremes, the wisdom that is not attained by the ultimate, the wisdom that is not taken away by the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de mngon sum du mdzad pa nyid kyis rjes su bzlas nas gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de mngon sum du mdzad pa nyid kyis rjes su bzlas nas gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One, having repeated it by his own direct experience, has spoken.

original: de la mtha' yas pa ni rnam pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mtha' yas pa ni rnam pa mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, the infinite is because of the infinite aspects.

original: mthar thug pa med pa ni thams cad du yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar thug pa med pa ni thams cad du yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate is because of the non-object everywhere.

original: de bas na 'di skad @123a * //
analyzed: de bas na 'di skad @123a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said thus:

original: du so so yang dag par rig pa mngon bar bsgrubs pas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mthar gtugs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du so so yang dag par rig pa mngon bar bsgrubs pas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mthar gtugs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By accomplishing the analytical knowledges, the world with its gods is unable to reach the end of them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis phyir mi ldog pa 'di'i rnam pa la sogs par bstan par bcom ldan 'das kyis spyod mod kyi /

translated: Profound is free from the path of superimposition and denial.

original: ces bya ba ni /üîΩgang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa yang gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni / gang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa yang gzugs ma yin /
translated: This teaches thatüîΩthe suchness of form is not form,üîΩand form is not separate from the suchness of form.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yang gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ni zab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yang gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ni zab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of this, they are profound.

original: chos thams cad zab pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad zab pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that all phenomena are profound.

original: ji ltar sgro btags pa spang zhe na /üîΩgang gzugs las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar sgro btags pa spang zhe na / gang gzugs las kyang ma yin /
translated: How does it avoid reification?üîΩIt is taught that form is not the suchness,

original: de bzhin nyid la yang gzugs med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la yang gzugs med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and that suchness is not form.

original: ji ltar skur pa 'debs pa spang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar skur pa 'debs pa spang zhe na /
translated: How does it avoid deprecation?

original: gang mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
analyzed: gang mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
translated: It is taught that nirvana is form.

original: gzugs las gzhan na yang de bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan na yang de bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because suchness is not other than form.

original: chos thams cad bsal nas mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad bsal nas mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that nirvana is all phenomena.

original: yang bsgom pa'i lam ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang bsgom pa'i lam ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is the path of cultivation?üîΩThe path of cultivation is reflection,

original: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam //
analyzed: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam //
translated: evaluation, and ascertainment.

original: zhes bstan pa ni gang /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni gang /
translated: What is taught?

original: gang gi tshe gnas zab mo 'di dag dang ldan pa zhes zlos pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i don gyis ni sems shing zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnas zab mo 'di dag dang ldan pa zhes zlos pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i don gyis ni sems shing zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: The meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúWhen one possesses these profound subjects,‚Äù is taught by the statement, ‚ÄúOne reflects.‚Äù

original: 'jal ba ni bsams pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: 'jal ba ni bsams pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The measure is the nature of reflection.

original: rtogs par byed pa ni bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab bo //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa ni bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab bo //
translated: The realization is the wisdom that has the nature of meditation.

original: yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi yul ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi yul ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Again, what is the object of the path of meditation?

original: nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //
translated: The limbs of penetration and the path of seeing,

original: @124a * // lam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
analyzed: @124a * // lam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
translated: and the path of meditation itself,

original: zhes bstan pa ni gang bdag gis ji ltar gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha ji lta ba'i dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'o //üîΩji ltar bdag gis bslab par bgyi zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ji lta ba'i dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni gang bdag gis ji ltar gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha ji lta ba'i dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'o // ji ltar bdag gis bslab par bgyi zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ji lta ba'i dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement How should I abide? is the teaching of the perfection of wisdom from the perspective of the factors of penetration.üîΩ The statement How should I train? is the teaching of the perfection of wisdom from the perspective of the path of seeing.

original: ji ltar bdag gis bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam ji lta ba'i dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam ji lta ba'i dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: The statement How should I accomplish? is the explanation of the perfection of wisdom from the perspective of the path of meditation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, with respect to the four aspects of the path of preparation, the path of seeing, and the path of meditation,üîΩthe sutra states six phrases:

original: de bzhin du bsgrub pa dang / de bzhin du sems pa dang / de bzhin du yongs su rtog pa dang / de bzhin du yang brtson pa dang / de bzhin du 'bad pa zhes bya ba tshig drug gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrub pa dang / de bzhin du sems pa dang / de bzhin du yongs su rtog pa dang / de bzhin du yang brtson pa dang / de bzhin du 'bad pa zhes bya ba tshig drug gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äúthus practicing, thus reflecting, thus discerning, thus striving, thus endeavoring.‚Äù

original: ji ltar bsgom pa'i lam gyi yul de nyid ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom pa'i lam gyi yul de nyid ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the path of meditation?

original: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir //
translated: It is the same as the object of the path of seeing.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The sutra states:üîΩ‚ÄúBecause it is continuous.‚Äù

original: phyi ma phyi ma'i yul snga ma snga ma yin pas nyes pa med do /
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma'i yul snga ma snga ma yin pas nyes pa med do /
translated: There is no error because the latter is the object of the former.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi phan yon rnam pa gsum ni gang tshad med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi phan yon rnam pa gsum ni gang tshad med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pas /
translated: The benefits of the path of meditation are threefold:

original: gzhan gyi bud med dang dus btab nas brda byas pa'i skyes bu'i rtogs pa mang po'i dpes bsod nams tshad med pa skye bas bskal pa dpag tu med par 'khor ba spong zhing rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med dang dus btab nas brda byas pa'i skyes bu'i rtogs pa mang po'i dpes bsod nams tshad med pa skye bas bskal pa dpag tu med par 'khor ba spong zhing rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Since immeasurable merit arises through the example of many stories of men who made an appointment with another's wife and then sent a sign, one turns one's back on samsara for immeasurable eons, abandoning karma.

original: las zad pa dang / bsal ba dang / sngar ma skyes pa'i tshig gis ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi byed pa yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las zad pa dang / bsal ba dang / sngar ma skyes pa'i tshig gis ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi byed pa yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The words exhaustion of karma, removal of karma and not previously arisen karma indicate the function of the path of meditation.

original: rnam pa du zhig yin zhe na //
analyzed: rnam pa du zhig yin zhe na //
translated: How many aspects does it have?üîΩIt has nine aspects

original: de ni rgyun chags pa yi phyir //üîΩchung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
analyzed: de ni rgyun chags pa yi phyir // chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
translated: because it is continuous.üîΩThe small, medium and great

original: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yi //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yi //
translated: are divided into small of the small and so on.

original: rnam pas rnam pa dgur 'dod do //üîΩzhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: rnam pas rnam pa dgur 'dod do // zhes bstan pa la /
translated: They are asserted to be nine aspects.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro /
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro /
translated: The words unfavorable and its antidote should be applied.

original: 'dir rtsa ba'i rnam par dbye ba ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po gsum yin la /
analyzed: 'dir rtsa ba'i rnam par dbye ba ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po gsum yin la /
translated: Here the primary classification is threefold: small, medium and great.

original: de rnams re re yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye ba byas pas rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams re re yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye ba byas pas rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
translated: Each of these is divided into small, medium, and great, making nine types.

original: 'di ltar chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / @124b chung ngu'i chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / @124b chung ngu'i chen po'o //
translated: Thus, there is the small of the small, the small of the medium, and the small of the great.

original: 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po'o //
analyzed: 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po'o //
translated: There is the medium of the small, the medium of the medium, and the medium of the great.

original: chen po'i chung ngu dang // chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen pos dgur 'dod do //
analyzed: chen po'i chung ngu dang // chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen pos dgur 'dod do //
translated: There is the great of the small, the great of the medium, and the great of the great.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The opposing factors should be understood in the same way as the aspects of the counteragent.

original: de la lam chung du'i chung dus ni rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chen po spong ba nas /
analyzed: de la lam chung du'i chung dus ni rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chen po spong ba nas /
translated: Here, the small of the small path abandons the great of the great discursive thought, and so on.

original: lam chen po'i chen pos ni rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung du spong ba'i bar du ni grangs yod pa dang / dpag tu yod pa dang / tshad yod pa'i rtog pas bsdus pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas dgu pa'i gnyen po ni lam gyi rnam pa chen po'i chen po ni gang stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgus bsdus pa /üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba la bsod nams grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / tshad med pas bsdus pas nye bar bsdus pa rnam pa gsum char dgag pa med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩgrangs med pa la sogs pa la khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: lam chen po'i chen pos ni rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung du spong ba'i bar du ni grangs yod pa dang / dpag tu yod pa dang / tshad yod pa'i rtog pas bsdus pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas dgu pa'i gnyen po ni lam gyi rnam pa chen po'i chen po ni gang stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgus bsdus pa / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba la bsod nams grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / tshad med pas bsdus pas nye bar bsdus pa rnam pa gsum char dgag pa med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // grangs med pa la sogs pa la khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: The great of the great path abandons the small of the small conception and so on, and is subsumed by conceptions of number, measure and magnitude, in terms of the path of meditation.

original: tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: The antidote of the ninth stage is the great of the great aspects of the path, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the nine aspects of the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation, which is subsumed by the three types of merit subsumed by the path of meditation

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang nye bar mtshon pa'i ched du yongs su dris pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang nye bar mtshon pa'i ched du yongs su dris pa yin la /
translated: It is asked in order to indicate its own characteristic.

original: grangs yod pa dang / grangs med pa'i khams ni 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
