analyzed: grangs yod pa dang / grangs med pa'i khams ni 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The realms are not countable and are not uncountable, because samsara and nirvana do not have the characteristic of existence.

original: grangs med pa nyid kyis de mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: grangs med pa nyid kyis de mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: In order to understand that it is realized as equality by being uncountable.

original: dus rnams la tshad mi dmigs pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa nyid kyis de'i rtogs pa 'dus ma byas pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: dus rnams la tshad mi dmigs pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa nyid kyis de'i rtogs pa 'dus ma byas pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: It is immeasurable because the measure of the times is not observed. In order to understand that it is realized as unconditioned by being immeasurable.

original: gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: It is unlimited because it cannot be measured. In order to understand that the object of omniscience is inconceivable by being unlimited.

original: de ni grangs med pa la sogs pa'i nye bar mtshon pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ni grangs med pa la sogs pa'i nye bar mtshon pa yin no ;
translated: That is the indication of being uncountable and so on.

original: / rang gi ngo bos mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: / rang gi ngo bos mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: From the perspective of its own nature,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir grangs med /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir grangs med /
translated: because all things are emptiness.

original: dpag tu med /
analyzed: dpag tu med /
translated: They are immeasurable,

original: tshad med pa stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: and they are infinite emptiness.

original: gal te de lta yin na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: grangs med la sogs bstan pa rnams //
analyzed: grangs med la sogs bstan pa rnams //
translated: then the teachings on the immeasurable, etc.

original: dam pa'i don du bzod ma yin //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du bzod ma yin //
translated: are not accepted in the ultimate sense.

original: stong @125a * //
analyzed: stong @125a * //
translated: The immeasurable, etc.

original: pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: are not different in their characteristics of emptiness.

original: rjod par byed pa'i dbye ba dang / don gyi dbye ba med par dgongs so //üîΩkun rdzob de dag thugs brtse ba'i //üîΩrgyu mthun gyur pa thub pa bzhed //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i dbye ba dang / don gyi dbye ba med par dgongs so // kun rdzob de dag thugs brtse ba'i // rgyu mthun gyur pa thub pa bzhed //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha intended that there be no difference in their verbal expression or in their meaning.üîΩThe Sage accepts those conventional expressions

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: as the natural outcome of his compassion.

original: gang don yin par yi ge tha dad du bya ba mi dmigs mod kyi /
analyzed: gang don yin par yi ge tha dad du bya ba mi dmigs mod kyi /
translated: Although the letters that express the meaning are not perceived as different,üîΩthe TathƒÅgata teaches the immeasurable, etc.

original: grangs med pa zhes bya ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du 'di ni brjod du med pa las de bzhin gshegs pas thugs rje'i rgyu mthun par gyur pas bstan pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: grangs med pa zhes bya ba nas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du 'di ni brjod du med pa las de bzhin gshegs pas thugs rje'i rgyu mthun par gyur pas bstan pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: up to nirvƒÅ·πáa, as the natural outcome of his compassion for those who are not beyond the conventional.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i rgyu mthun pa'i dbang gis 'di dag thams cad kyi yul du gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i rgyu mthun pa'i dbang gis 'di dag thams cad kyi yul du gyur pa zhig na /
translated: By the power of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs compassion, they are the objects of all of these.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
translated: But according to my understanding of the meaning of what the Lord has said,

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par byang chub pa'i rnam pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos thams cad ni brjod du ma mchis pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par byang chub pa'i rnam pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos thams cad ni brjod du ma mchis pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: all things are completely and totally awakened to by the TathƒÅgata, and all things of the TathƒÅgata are inexpressible.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang de rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni brjod par mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang de rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni brjod par mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that their emptiness cannot be expressed.

original: dngos po brjod du med pa la //
analyzed: dngos po brjod du med pa la //
translated: In the inexpressible thing

original: nyams pa dang ni 'phel mi rung //
analyzed: nyams pa dang ni 'phel mi rung //
translated: there is no decrease or increase.

original: bsgom zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: bsgom zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: By the path called ‚Äúcultivation‚Äù

original: ci zhig nyams shing ci zhig thob //
analyzed: ci zhig nyams shing ci zhig thob //
translated: what is decreased and what is obtained?

original: ces bya ba ni ji skad du /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ji skad du /
translated: This is taught by the following verse.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rigs chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgu ni ci zhig nyams zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rigs chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgu ni ci zhig nyams zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The nine kinds of discrimination, from the great of the great to the subtle of the subtle, are what is decreased.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: lam chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa rnams pa rnams pa dgu ni ci zhig thob ces brgal ba ni gang brjod du med pa'i don la 'phel ba dang / yongs su 'grib pa bkag pas /
analyzed: lam chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa rnams pa rnams pa dgu ni ci zhig thob ces brgal ba ni gang brjod du med pa'i don la 'phel ba dang / yongs su 'grib pa bkag pas /
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúBecause the increase and decrease of the object that is inexpressible is refuted,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi 'phel ba dang / yongs su 'grib pa bkag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i skal ba med pa nyid do zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi 'phel ba dang / yongs su 'grib pa bkag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i skal ba med pa nyid do zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: there is no opportunity to obtain the complete enlightenment of omniscience through the increase and decrease of the perfections and so on up to the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha.‚Äù

original: 'di la lan du brjod pa ni //
analyzed: 'di la lan du brjod pa ni //
translated: The reply to that is taught:

original: byang chub ji lta de bzhin du //üîΩde yi 'dod pa don sgrub byed //
analyzed: byang chub ji lta de bzhin du // de yi 'dod pa don sgrub byed //
translated: Just as with enlightenment,

original: ces bstan te /
analyzed: ces bstan te /
translated: so too with the accomplishment of their wishes.

original: bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The path of meditation is the meaning of the term.

original: gang thams cad du rtogs pa'i nga rgyal bkag pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du yid la byed pa la sogs pas yongs su bsngo @125b ba dang ldan pa de snod du 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bstan pa
analyzed: gang thams cad du rtogs pa'i nga rgyal bkag pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du yid la byed pa la sogs pas yongs su bsngo @125b ba dang ldan pa de snod du 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bstan pa
translated: It is taught that one becomes a vessel by stopping the pride of realization everywhere, and by dedicating with the attention to the way things really are, etc., of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: yin no // byang chub kyang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: yin no // byang chub kyang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is enlightenment?

original: byang chub de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid //
analyzed: byang chub de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid //
translated: Enlightenment is suchness, its characteristic.

original: de yang de yi mtshan nyid bzhed //
analyzed: de yang de yi mtshan nyid bzhed //
translated: And that is accepted as its characteristic.

original: ces bya ba ni gang /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang /
translated: What is that?

original: gzugs nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that suchness of form, etc., up to nirvana is unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel ba dang / yongs su 'grib pa bkag pa'i sbyor ba rjes su gnang ba nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel ba dang / yongs su 'grib pa bkag pa'i sbyor ba rjes su gnang ba nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that by the permission of the application which stops the increase and decrease of the perfection of wisdom, one becomes a vessel.

original: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gam /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gam /
translated: Thus, cause and effect are taught.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu dag gcig la gcig rang bzhin gyis rjes su brgyud pas //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu dag gcig la gcig rang bzhin gyis rjes su brgyud pas //
translated: The effect and the cause are mutually dependent by way of intrinsic nature.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba phyin ci ma log par 'byung bar gyur pa yin par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba phyin ci ma log par 'byung bar gyur pa yin par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The relation of cause and effect is explained as being unmistaken.

original: yang de ltar byas nas gang /üîΩsems ni snga mas byang chub par //
analyzed: yang de ltar byas nas gang / sems ni snga mas byang chub par //
translated: Moreover, having done that, what?üîΩThe previous mind does not awaken

original: rigs min phyi mas kyang ma yin //
analyzed: rigs min phyi mas kyang ma yin //
translated: to enlightenment, nor does the later one.

original: zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la //
translated: Here,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa dang // phyis skyed pa dag ni gcig la gcig phrad pa med pas /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa dang // phyis skyed pa dag ni gcig la gcig phrad pa med pas /
translated: the first production of the thought of enlightenment and the later production of the thought of enlightenment do not meet each other.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs su 'gyur ba med pas sems can gang /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs su 'gyur ba med pas sems can gang /
translated: Since there is no accumulation of the roots of virtue that are correctly accomplished over three incalculable aeons, what sentient beingüîΩwill become fully awakened to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes zhus pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes zhus pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the question that is being taught.

original: da ni ji ltar byang chub 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar byang chub 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, how will enlightenment occur?

original: 'jig rten du grags pa'i mar me'i dpe tshul gyis ni zhes bya ba ni gang snying po'i dpes sems bskyed pa gnyi ga 'bras bu dang bcas par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten du grags pa'i mar me'i dpe tshul gyis ni zhes bya ba ni gang snying po'i dpes sems bskyed pa gnyi ga 'bras bu dang bcas par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin terms of the example of a lamp that is well known in the world‚Äù means that the two forms of generating enlightenment mind are to be understood as having results, in the manner of the example of the lamp‚Äôs flame.

original: sems bskyed pa de'i yul du 'gyur bas sa bcu la bslabs pas /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de'i yul du 'gyur bas sa bcu la bslabs pas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving trained in the ten spiritual levels‚Äù means that the ten spiritual levels are the domain of that enlightenment mind.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par shes pa ni sems bskyed pa dang po dang / phyi ma dag bsgom pa la ma brten par mngon bar byang chub pa rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par shes pa ni sems bskyed pa dang po dang / phyi ma dag bsgom pa la ma brten par mngon bar byang chub pa rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone should understand that one attains unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment‚Äù means that one should understand that the first and subsequent forms of generating enlightenment mind are not realized without relying on the cultivation of the path.

original: 'dir ci zhig shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ci zhig shes par bya zhe na /
translated: What is to be understood here?

original: zab mo'i chos nyid rnam pa brgyad //
analyzed: zab mo'i chos nyid rnam pa brgyad //
translated: The eight aspects of the profound Dharma

original: ces bya bstan pa'i skabs 'dir rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces bya bstan pa'i skabs 'dir rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: should be applied here in this section on the teaching.

original: ji ltar na rnam pa brgyad yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam pa brgyad yin zhe na /
translated: How are there eight aspects?

original: zab mo rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: zab mo rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: There are eight aspects of the profound.

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang shes bya dang // shes @126a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang shes bya dang // shes @126a * //
translated: suchness, the knowable,üîΩand the knower, practice, nonduality,

original: dang spyod dang gnyis med dang // thabs la mkhas pa zab pa nyid //
analyzed: dang spyod dang gnyis med dang // thabs la mkhas pa zab pa nyid //
translated: and profound skill in means.

original: ces bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught.

original: de la skye ba zab pa ni de dag ma yin la /
analyzed: de la skye ba zab pa ni de dag ma yin la /
translated: Therein, the profundity of arising is that it is not from those,

original: de las gzhan pa las kyang ma yin pas mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang ba de ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa las kyang ma yin pas mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang ba de ni /
translated: and it is not from something other than those.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa nyid kyis 'gags pa'i sems skye ba 'gags pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa nyid kyis 'gags pa'i sems skye ba 'gags pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: That complete and perfect enlightenment is taught to be the arising of the mind that has ceased due to the profundity of dependent origination.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a s≈´tra teaches:

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, what do you think?

original: sems gang 'gags pa de phyis skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: sems gang 'gags pa de phyis skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Does the mind that has ceased arise again later?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩ'gag pa zab pa ni gang sems skyes pa ni 'gags pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes gsungs pa yin no // 'gag pa zab pa ni gang sems skyes pa ni 'gags pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, it does not.‚Äù

original: chos can de 'gag pa bkag pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos can de 'gag pa bkag pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The profundity of cessation is that the cessation of the mind that has arisen is taught to be the cessation of the basis itself.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a sutra declares:

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhuti, what do you think?

original: gang skyes pa de 'gag par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin nam /üîΩbcom ldan 'das 'gag pa'i chos can lags so //
analyzed: gang skyes pa de 'gag par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin nam / bcom ldan 'das 'gag pa'i chos can lags so //
translated: Is that which has arisen a phenomenon that will cease?

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhuti, what do you think?

original: gang 'gag pa'i chos can ni yang 'gag par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gang 'gag pa'i chos can ni yang 'gag par 'gyur ram /
translated: Is that which is a phenomenon that will cease something that will cease again?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti replied, ‚ÄúNo, Blessed One.‚Äù

original: don ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: don ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: skyes pa tsam nyid na de 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa tsam nyid na de 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because as soon as it has arisen, it is directed toward cessation.üîΩWhat is it that will cease?

original: yang ci zhig 'gag par 'gyur ba de bzhin nyid zab pa ni gang de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du de la gnas pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i yul yin par dgongs pas /
analyzed: yang ci zhig 'gag par 'gyur ba de bzhin nyid zab pa ni gang de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du de la gnas pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i yul yin par dgongs pas /
translated: The profound suchness is the object of the nonconceptual mind, because it is the suchness that abides just as it is.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba nyid kyis so //
translated: It is the suchness that is the reality of the perfect limit.

original: de bzhin nyid zab po zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid zab po zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the profound suchness that is taught.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a sutra declares:

original: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin nyid gnas so zhes bya ba las gso pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin nyid gnas so zhes bya ba las gso pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thusness abides just as it is.

original: shes bya gang de zab pa ni gang sems de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: shes bya gang de zab pa ni gang sems de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no /
translated: The profundity of the object of cognition is indicated because the mind is not other than suchness.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a s≈´tra teaches:

original: de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSuchness is not other than the inconceivable.‚Äù

original: shes pa zab pa ni gang de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mi mthong ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa zab pa ni gang de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mi mthong ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The profundity of cognition is indicated because suchness does not see suchness.

original: ji @126b skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji @126b skad du mdo las /
translated: As a s≈´tra teaches:

original: yang de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩspyod pa zab pa ni gang de ltar spyod pa de ni ci la yang mi spyod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no // spyod pa zab pa ni gang de ltar spyod pa de ni ci la yang mi spyod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúSuchness does not see suchness.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa zab pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa zab pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The profundity of practice is indicated because the practice of the perfection of wisdom is profound, since one who practices in that way does not practice anything at all.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a sutra declares:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas pa la lung bstan pa la sogs pa'i yongs su rgyu ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas pa la lung bstan pa la sogs pa'i yongs su rgyu ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because for one who abides in reality, there is no discursive thought of prophecy, etc.

original: gnyis su med pa zab pa ni gang don dam pa la spyod pa la gnyis su kun du spyod pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa zab pa ni gang don dam pa la spyod pa la gnyis su kun du spyod pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The profundity of nonduality is taught because there is no duality in the practice of the ultimate.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes kyi sbyor ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes kyi sbyor ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is because the bodhisattva has no application of the notion of sign or signlessness.

original: thabs la mkhas pa zab pa ni gang stobs bcu la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par ma bgyis par /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa zab pa ni gang stobs bcu la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par ma bgyis par /
translated: The profundity of skill in means is taught because, without completing the ten powers, etc., up to the unshared qualities of a buddha,üîΩby the skill in means of blocking the path, one does not attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgyab bkag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa nyid kyis chos gang yang dngos po dang / dngos po med pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgyab bkag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa nyid kyis chos gang yang dngos po dang / dngos po med pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: By that skill in means, no dharma is blocked as existent or nonexistent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du shes pa la gnas pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dang de la spyod pa'i sems can rnams /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du shes pa la gnas pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dang de la spyod pa'i sems can rnams /
translated: It is taught that the bodhisattva who abides in the knowledge that the intrinsic identity of all phenomena is emptiness,

original: gnyen po'i phyogs de dang de la rab tu 'god kyang sems can yongs su smin pa la mkhas pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs de dang de la rab tu 'god kyang sems can yongs su smin pa la mkhas pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: even though he establishes sentient beings who engage in this and that opposing side in this and that antidote, is skilled in ripening sentient beings.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa byang chub sems dpa' slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun gyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa byang chub sems dpa' slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun gyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the chapter on the irreversible sa·πÖgha of bodhisattvas in training, who abide on the path of cultivation.

original: // / slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun bstan nas /
analyzed: // / slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the sa·πÖgha of bodhisattvas in training who are irreversible,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: the equality of sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa should be expressed.

original: mi slob pa'i dge 'dun bstan pa'i don ci dgos she na /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i dge 'dun bstan pa'i don ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the purpose of explaining the sa·πÖgha of those beyond training?

original: 'di nyid kho na bslab par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kho na bslab par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not to be trained in at all.

original: gang 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtog pa spang bar bya ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i rtog pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtog pa spang bar bya ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i rtog pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to abandon the conception of defilement and the conception of purification,

original: de gnyis mnyam pa nyid du rdzogs pas mi slob par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis mnyam pa nyid du rdzogs pas mi slob par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: they are perfected as sameness, and so they become nonlearners,

original: de phan chad bslab par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phan chad bslab par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing further to learn beyond that.

original: yang ji ltar 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid yin @127a * //
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid yin @127a * //
translated: Moreover, how are samsara and nirvana the same?

original: zhe na ; chos rnams rmi lam 'dra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: zhe na ; chos rnams rmi lam 'dra ba'i phyir //
translated: Because phenomena are like a dream,

original: srid dang zhi bar mi rtog pa //
analyzed: srid dang zhi bar mi rtog pa //
translated: samsara and nirvana are not imagined.

original: zhes bstan pa ni gang de nas mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs dang bral ba'i sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gnyi ga mnyam par rtogs pas 'khor ba rmi lam dang 'dra bar rtogs nas /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni gang de nas mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs dang bral ba'i sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gnyi ga mnyam par rtogs pas 'khor ba rmi lam dang 'dra bar rtogs nas /
translated: This is taught. Having realized both to be the same, one realizes that samsara is like a dream, in terms of the state of conception of the factors that are discordant and their antidotes.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la /
translated: In nonconceptual wisdom,

original: nyin mo bsgoms pas rnam par 'phel ba bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyin mo bsgoms pas rnam par 'phel ba bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: meditation during the day is blocked from increasing.

original: rmi lam gyi nang du bsgoms pas rnam par 'phel ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang du bsgoms pas rnam par 'phel ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: Meditation in dreams is refuted by the word ‚Äúincrease.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra,

original: rmi lam dang / nyin par du rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / nyin par du rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that there is no conceptualization in dreams and in the daytime.

original: mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa yin no //
translated: The reason is that there is no conceptualization of the side of the antidote and the side of the object of abandonment.

original: las med la sogs klan ka yi //
analyzed: las med la sogs klan ka yi //
translated: The response to the objection that there is no karma, etc.

original: lan ni ji ltar bshad par zad //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: lan ni ji ltar bshad par zad // ces bya ba la /
translated: is just as has been explained.

original: de la las med pa'i klan ka ni gang rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i chos nyid la rmi lam lta bu'i sbyor ba dang / dngos dang mjug gis bsdus ba'i las de la sogs pa dang / 'bri ba med par bstan pa nyid kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la las med pa'i klan ka ni gang rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i chos nyid la rmi lam lta bu'i sbyor ba dang / dngos dang mjug gis bsdus ba'i las de la sogs pa dang / 'bri ba med par bstan pa nyid kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the objection that there is no karma is that in the reality that is like a dream, the karma that is included in the preparation, the actual basis, and the conclusion that is like a dream is taught by the very teaching of the absence of decrease.

original: de'i lan ni gal te sad nas /
analyzed: de'i lan ni gal te sad nas /
translated: The response to that is that if one wakes up,

original: bla na med par yongs su shes pas rnam par rtog pa ni de la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: bla na med par yongs su shes pas rnam par rtog pa ni de la sogs pa'am /
translated: the conceptualization that is fully understood as unsurpassed is that, etc.

original: 'bri bar yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'bri bar yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: and also written,

original: mi rtog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not non-conceptual.

original: las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba ni brda tsam du bshad pas /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba ni brda tsam du bshad pas /
translated: The connection between action and result is explained as mere convention.

original: gang yang nyin par srog gcod par byas pa dang / rmi lam nang du srog gcod pa zhes bya ba ni nyin mo dang / mtshan mo zhes bya bar grags pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang nyin par srog gcod par byas pa dang / rmi lam nang du srog gcod pa zhes bya ba ni nyin mo dang / mtshan mo zhes bya bar grags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is called ‚Äútaking life during the day‚Äù and ‚Äútaking life in a dream‚Äù is known as ‚Äúduring the day‚Äù and ‚Äúduring the night.

original: nang du smos pa ni 'khor ba'i rmi lam khyad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang du smos pa ni 'khor ba'i rmi lam khyad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äù The mention of ‚Äúduring the night‚Äù is to distinguish the dream of cyclic existence.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu las de la khyod ci zer zhes bya ba ni bden pa dang / bden pa ma yin pa dris pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu las de la khyod ci zer zhes bya ba ni bden pa dang / bden pa ma yin pa dris pa yin te /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, what do you say about that action?‚Äù This is asking about truth and untruth.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs rtogs su zin kyang rnam par rtog pa rjes su 'jug pa skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs rtogs su zin kyang rnam par rtog pa rjes su 'jug pa skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Even though the antidote has been realized, conceptual thoughts continue to arise.

original: de ni don dam pa bstan pa'i phyir rgol ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni don dam pa bstan pa'i phyir rgol ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a challenge in order to teach the ultimate.

original: 'di'i lan ni gang dmigs pa las las skye bar bshad pa dang / dmigs pa med pa las las skye ba 'gag pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni gang dmigs pa las las skye bar bshad pa dang / dmigs pa med pa las las skye ba 'gag pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The answer to this is that action arises from observation, and the cessation of action arising from non-observation is taught.

original: de yang brda dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang brda dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is accompanied by a sign.

original: dmigs pa'i @127b dngos po med pa yin no zhes brgal ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i @127b dngos po med pa yin no zhes brgal ba la /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs argument is that the object of observation does not exist.

original: 'di'i lan ni ji skad du /
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni ji skad du /
translated: The reply to that is as follows.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mtshan mar byas nas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mtshan mar byas nas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, having made a sign,

original: yongs su brtag pa'i dngos po dmigs par brten pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrmi lam gyi nang gi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na yang dag pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa'i dngos po dmigs par brten pa'i phyir ro // rmi lam gyi nang gi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na yang dag pa'am /
translated: because the object of investigation is based on the object of observation.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par bsngos pa yin zhes dris pa la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par bsngos pa yin zhes dris pa la /
translated: If the roots of virtue such as generosity in a dream are dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, is it a correct dedication or is it not a correct dedication?‚Äù

original: 'di'i lan ni ji skad du /
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni ji skad du /
translated: The reply to that is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa mngon sum du gyur pa ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pa 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa mngon sum du gyur pa ;
translated: This bodhisattva Maitreya has actualized the realization of the three exalted knowers.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa yin pas don 'di lan ldon par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa yin pas don 'di lan ldon par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since he is obstructed by only one birth, he will reply to this topic.‚Äù

original: don ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: don ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning?

original: dris pa de'i lan ldon pa'i dbang du mdzad pas ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i dri ba de ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dris pa de'i lan ldon pa'i dbang du mdzad pas ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i dri ba de ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The answer to that question is given. The question, ‚ÄúDo Buddhas arise one after another in the future?‚Äù is not complete.

original: de rdzogs par gyur na ni ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas 'byung ba don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rdzogs par gyur na ni ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas 'byung ba don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were complete, it would follow that the appearance of Buddhas in the future would be purposeless.

original: ji ltar yongs su ma rdzogs pa bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su ma rdzogs pa bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that it is not complete?üîΩIt is not complete because it does not include the question, ‚ÄúDo all things exist or not exist?‚Äù

original: ming nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ming nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with the name,

original: chos thams cad ldan ldon par byed pa'i dngos po dmigs su med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ldan ldon par byed pa'i dngos po dmigs su med pa yin no //
translated: the entity that causes all things to be connected is not perceived.

original: de ltar 'di dag rang nyid kyis mngon sum du byas par dam 'cha' zhing don mngon sum du byas na /
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag rang nyid kyis mngon sum du byas par dam 'cha' zhing don mngon sum du byas na /
translated: Thus, if one promises to make this directly evident and to make the meaning directly evident,

original: dris pa'i lan yongs su rdzogs pa'i nyes par spang bar bya ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun chad med par 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dris pa'i lan yongs su rdzogs pa'i nyes par spang bar bya ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul rgyun chad med par 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: in order to avoid the fault of not completing the answer to the question, one must assert that the way of the future Buddhas is uninterrupted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' chen po byams pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la mi dmigs par spyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' chen po byams pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la mi dmigs par spyod pa'i phyir /
translated: For that reason, this great bodhisattva Maitreya is endowed with profound wisdom, because he practices the six perfections without objectification.

original: shes rab zab mo dang ldan pa nyid yin pas ma 'ongs pa'i 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'i mtshan ma med pa rtogs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩ'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa ni dus de nyid kyi dgongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas dmigs pa med par spyod pa yin pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa mngon bar byang chub pa nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: shes rab zab mo dang ldan pa nyid yin pas ma 'ongs pa'i 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'i mtshan ma med pa rtogs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa ni dus de nyid kyi dgongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas dmigs pa med par spyod pa yin pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa mngon bar byang chub pa nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro
translated: Therefore, he is taught to realize the signlessness of the division of future cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩ'khor ba dang mya ngan las @128a * //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no // 'khor ba dang mya ngan las @128a * //
translated: The teaching of the equality of cyclic existence and nirvana is taught by the power of his intention at that time, because he practices without objectification, and because he is certain to manifest the fearlessnesses and so on.

original: 'das pa mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: 'das pa mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: The commentary on the equality of cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: // /'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: // /'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the equality of cyclic life and nirvana,

original: da ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: now, the purification of the buddhaverse should be explained.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
translated: And that is taught in two parts:

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi bye brag gis yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi bye brag gis yin te /
translated: the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment, by way of their distinction.

original: sems can 'jig rten de bzhin du //
analyzed: sems can 'jig rten de bzhin du //
translated: The world of sentient beings is like that.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ma dag pa //üîΩde la dag pa sgrub pa yis //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ma dag pa // de la dag pa sgrub pa yis //
translated: The impure world of the environmentüîΩis purified by the practice of purification.

original: sangs rgyas zhing ni dag pa nyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing ni dag pa nyid //
translated: Thus, the buddhaverse is purified.

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten bkres pa la sogs pa ni lus kyi ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten bkres pa la sogs pa ni lus kyi ma dag pa'o //
translated: The world of sentient beings, with hunger and so forth, is the impurity of the body.

original: de'i gnyen po ni lha'i longs spyod la sogs pa dag pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni lha'i longs spyod la sogs pa dag pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: Its antidote is the purification of divine enjoyments and so forth.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ni sa chen po 'di la sdong du ma dang / tsher ma la sogs pa ni ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ni sa chen po 'di la sdong du ma dang / tsher ma la sogs pa ni ma dag pa'o //
translated: The world of the environment, this great earth, with its stumps, thorns, and so forth, is impure.

original: de'i gnyen po ni lag mthil ltar mnyam pa la sogs pa dag pas bsdus ba ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni lag mthil ltar mnyam pa la sogs pa dag pas bsdus ba ste /
translated: Its antidote is the purification of the evenness of the palm of the hand and so forth.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa mdor bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa mdor bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is a brief description of the purification of the Buddha land.

original: rgyas par ni mdo las gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rgyas par ni mdo las gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In detail, the sutra describes the purification of the Buddha land in terms of the following.

original: sems can bkres pa la sogs pa mthong nas /
analyzed: sems can bkres pa la sogs pa mthong nas /
translated: Seeing hungry ghosts, etc.,

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing lha'i ris dag gi longs spyod la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing lha'i ris dag gi longs spyod la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: the bodhisattva practices the perfections in such a way that his own Buddha land will be like the celestial realms in terms of enjoyments, etc.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the perfection of giving.

original: de la nye bar longs spyod pa ni zas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nye bar longs spyod pa ni zas la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, enjoyment refers to food, etc.

original: yongs su longs spyod pa ni nor bu dang / mu tig gi rgyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa ni nor bu dang / mu tig gi rgyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: Full enjoyment refers to ornaments of jewels and pearls, etc.

original: de bzhin du srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / de'i 'bras bu las bzlog pas bsdus pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / de'i 'bras bu las bzlog pas bsdus pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the perfection of morality is perfected by the opposite of killing, etc., and their results.

original: gnod sems las bzlog pas bsdus pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod sems las bzlog pas bsdus pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of patience is completed by the inclusion of the reversal of malice.

original: le lo las bzlog pas bsdus pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: le lo las bzlog pas bsdus pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of effort is completed by the inclusion of the reversal of laziness.

original: sgrib pa lnga dang / bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa ma gtogs pa las bzlog pas bsdus pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga dang / bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa ma gtogs pa las bzlog pas bsdus pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of meditation is completed by the inclusion of the reversal of the five hindrances and the first meditative absorption, etc.

original: de la sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / @128b gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom rnams yin no //üîΩshes rab 'chal ba las bzlog pas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / @128b gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom rnams yin no // shes rab 'chal ba las bzlog pas bsdus pa ni /
translated: The five hindrances are: sensual desire, malice, sleepiness and drowsiness, excitation and regret, and doubt.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is completed by the inclusion of the reversal of stupidity.

original: thams cad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nye bar gyur pa dang / yang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sems can log par nges pa dang / ma nges pa'i phung po gsum du shes pa med pa dang / ngan song gsum gyi sgra yang shes pa med pa dang /
analyzed: thams cad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nye bar gyur pa dang / yang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sems can log par nges pa dang / ma nges pa'i phung po gsum du shes pa med pa dang / ngan song gsum gyi sgra yang shes pa med pa dang /
translated: and in his own buddha-field, he is without the knowledge of the three groups of beings who are destined for perdition and who are not destined, and he is without the knowledge of the three lower realms.

original: yang sdong du ma dang / tsher ma la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang / sa chen po 'di sa'i rgyu las grub pa las bzlog pas bsdus pa dang / de bzhin du bdag tu yongs su 'dzin pa las bzlog pa dang / rigs bzhir yongs su 'dzin pa las bzlog pas nye bar bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: yang sdong du ma dang / tsher ma la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang / sa chen po 'di sa'i rgyu las grub pa las bzlog pas bsdus pa dang / de bzhin du bdag tu yongs su 'dzin pa las bzlog pa dang / rigs bzhir yongs su 'dzin pa las bzlog pas nye bar bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, he is included in the opposite of the great earth, which is composed of the elements of earth, and so on, and he is included in the opposite of the grasping of self and the grasping of the four castes.

original: de dag las bzlog pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The opposite of these is as follows:

original: gang ci nas bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na chung du na rigs bzhi'i ming yang mi srid ba dang / zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang ci nas bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na chung du na rigs bzhi'i ming yang mi srid ba dang / zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn whatever way, in my buddha-field, even the names of the four castes will not exist. ‚Äù

original: des ni rigs kyi tshul gyi don med de /
analyzed: des ni rigs kyi tshul gyi don med de /
translated: This shows that the meaning of the caste system does not exist.

original: 'di ni bram ze zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni dmangs rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bram ze zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni dmangs rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is a Brahmin, this is a Ksatriya, this is a Vaisya, this is a Sudra.

original: sems can rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma dang / kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / chos gnyis po ma gtogs pa gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nyid ma gtogs pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma dang / kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / chos gnyis po ma gtogs pa gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nyid ma gtogs pa dang /
translated: It is based on the dependent nature, except for the two dharmas of good and bad color, and except for the foundations of mindfulness, etc.

original: 'gro bas phye ba'i rdzus te skye ba ma gtogs pa skye gnas gsum po dang / mngon bar shes pa dang bral ba dang ; bshan gcig la sogs pa 'dzag pa dang / 'od dang mi ldan pa dang / nyin mo dang / mtshan mo dang /
analyzed: 'gro bas phye ba'i rdzus te skye ba ma gtogs pa skye gnas gsum po dang / mngon bar shes pa dang bral ba dang ; bshan gcig la sogs pa 'dzag pa dang / 'od dang mi ldan pa dang / nyin mo dang / mtshan mo dang /
translated: It is based on the three birth processes, except for the miraculous birth that is distinguished by the realms, and except for those who are devoid of supernormal knowledge, those who are leaking, etc., those who are not radiant, and those who are of the day and night.

original: nyi ma dang / zla ba la sogs pa dang / tshe thung ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang bral ba dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byed par nus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi ldan pa dang / khams mi mnyam pas kun nas ldang ba'i nad rnams las bzlog pas nye bar bsdus pa de dag las bzlog pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: nyi ma dang / zla ba la sogs pa dang / tshe thung ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang bral ba dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byed par nus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi ldan pa dang / khams mi mnyam pas kun nas ldang ba'i nad rnams las bzlog pas nye bar bsdus pa de dag las bzlog pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The opposite of those is the opposite of the following: the sun, moon, etc.,üîΩshort life, being devoid of the marks of a great being, not possessing the roots of virtue that are able to serve the Buddha, and being afflicted by illnesses that arise from the agitation of the humors.

original: rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / 'dus pas kun nas dkris pa'i nad rnams skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dag go rims @129a * //
analyzed: rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / 'dus pas kun nas dkris pa'i nad rnams skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dag go rims @129a * //
translated: The opposite of those is this: the arising of illnesses that are the entanglements of wind, bile, phlegm, and their combinations, whether they have arisen or not.

original: bzhin du bsal ba dang / mi skye ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i gso bas nye bar bsdus pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa la mos pa dang / nga rgyal can las bzlog pas ci rigs par rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du phun sum tshogs pa'i rnam pa de dang de rnams kyis bsdus pa la zhugs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang
analyzed: bzhin du bsal ba dang / mi skye ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i gso bas nye bar bsdus pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa la mos pa dang / nga rgyal can las bzlog pas ci rigs par rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du phun sum tshogs pa'i rnam pa de dang de rnams kyis bsdus pa la zhugs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang
translated: Similarly, they are included in the six perfections and in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: nye bar 'gyur ba dang / tshe dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la tshad yod pa las go bzlog pas de dag tshad med par 'gyur ba nyid mngon bar 'tshang rgya bar sems bskyed pa dang / gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu gyur par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
analyzed: nye bar 'gyur ba dang / tshe dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la tshad yod pa las go bzlog pas de dag tshad med par 'gyur ba nyid mngon bar 'tshang rgya bar sems bskyed pa dang / gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu gyur par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
translated: the bodhicitta of generating the mind to manifest complete buddhahood with the opposite of the limited lifespan and the limited sa·πÖgha of monks, which is to have an immeasurable lifespan and an immeasurable sa·πÖgha of monks,üîΩand the bodhicitta of the intention to manifest complete buddhahood in the unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment in which all the buddha realms of however many world systems there are in all the buddha realms of however many buddha realms there are in the sands of the River Ganges become one buddha realm,

original: rgya ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / nam mkha' ltar mu med pa'i sems can gyi khams la 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang med par yongs su spyod pa'i yid la byed pas /
analyzed: rgya ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / nam mkha' ltar mu med pa'i sems can gyi khams la 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang med par yongs su spyod pa'i yid la byed pas /
translated: and the mental contemplation of the realm of sentient beings that is limitless like space, which is to engage in samsara and nirvana without either existing.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: He has perfected the six perfections and has approached the knowledge of all aspects.

original: srid mo gang g'a'i lha mos de lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar khas blangs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pas 'khor rnams ji skad du bshad pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing
analyzed: srid mo gang g'a'i lha mos de lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar khas blangs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pas 'khor rnams ji skad du bshad pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing
translated: By the cause of the root of merit of the sister Ganga-devi's vow to purify the buddha-field in that way, she was prophesied to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. The assembly, believing that they will attain the purification of the buddha-field as explained, are the sense objects of the sense faculties.

original: yongs su sbyang ba thob par yid ches pas dbang po'i don gyis dbang por gyur pa yin te zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su sbyang ba thob par yid ches pas dbang po'i don gyis dbang por gyur pa yin te zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained by the phrase they have become the sense faculties.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the purification of the buddha-field.

original: // / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bstan nas thabs la mkhas pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bstan nas thabs la mkhas pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having explained the purification of the buddha-field, skillful means should be discussed.

original: de la re zhig de'i yul dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig de'i yul dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: In that regard, first, it is the domain and application.

original: ci zhig brjod par bya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci zhig brjod par bya zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: What is to be said?

original: de la thabs la mkhas pa'i yul ni gang ji skad du /üîΩde dang der thabs la mkhas pas gsungs pa de ltar rang gi yul gyi sbyor ba tha dad pa bstan pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la thabs la mkhas pa'i yul ni gang ji skad du / de dang der thabs la mkhas pas gsungs pa de ltar rang gi yul gyi sbyor ba tha dad pa bstan pa nas brtsams te /
translated: The domain of skill in means is as follows.

original: stong @129b pa nyid la sogs pa rnams nas /
analyzed: stong @129b pa nyid la sogs pa rnams nas /
translated: Just as it is said in the sutra, ‚ÄúIn this and that way, through skill in means, one should teach the application of one‚Äôs domain, beginning with the emptinesses,üîΩand one should cultivate the meditative equipoise that is familiar with the factors of enlightenment.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams la goms pa snyoms par 'jug pa bsgom pa yongs su 'dris pas ni thabs la mkhas pa'i yul don gyis bstan to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams la goms pa snyoms par 'jug pa bsgom pa yongs su 'dris pas ni thabs la mkhas pa'i yul don gyis bstan to zhes bstan to //
translated: The domain of skill in means is taught by implication.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the sutra,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar stong pa nyid la ji ltar 'dris par bgyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar stong pa nyid la ji ltar 'dris par bgyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, how should bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom familiarize themselves with emptiness?‚Äù

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris pas snyoms par 'jug par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris pas snyoms par 'jug par bgyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúHow should one familiarize oneself with emptiness and enter meditative equipoise on it?‚Äù

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs stong pa'o zhes so sor rtog par byed cing thabs la mkhas pa la nye bar 'grong pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gzugs stong pa'o zhes so sor rtog par byed cing thabs la mkhas pa la nye bar 'grong pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The application of skill in means is taught as the discernment of form as empty, and the approach to skill in means.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the s≈´tra:

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid la so sor rtog cing zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid la so sor rtog cing zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas discern emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations, and so on, up to

original: goms par bsgom zhing mngon sum du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin par shes so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: goms par bsgom zhing mngon sum du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin par shes so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: they know it is not the time to cultivate familiarity and actualize it.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid ni sbyin pa dang bral ba ma yin /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid ni sbyin pa dang bral ba ma yin /
translated: There, emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations is not divorced from generosity,

original: tshul khrims dang bral ba ma yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang bral ba ma yin /
translated: not divorced from discipline,

original: bzod pa dang bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtsug na rin po che'i mdo blang ngo //
analyzed: bzod pa dang bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtsug na rin po che'i mdo blang ngo //
translated: The S≈´tra of the Questions of Ratnac≈´·∏ça should be cited as a source for the statement ‚ÄúHe is not without patience.‚Äù

original: thabs ni rnam pa bcur 'gyur bas //üîΩde'i phyir / mtshon bya rnams las 'das pa dang // mi gnas de bzhin shugs dang ni //
analyzed: thabs ni rnam pa bcur 'gyur bas // de'i phyir / mtshon bya rnams las 'das pa dang // mi gnas de bzhin shugs dang ni //
translated: Skill in means is tenfold.üîΩTherefore, it is taught:üîΩTranscending what is to be characterized,

original: thun mong ma yin nyid dang ni //üîΩma chags pa dang mi dmigs dang // mtshan ma smon lam zad pa dang // de yi rtags dang tshad med dang // thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin nyid dang ni // ma chags pa dang mi dmigs dang // mtshan ma smon lam zad pa dang // de yi rtags dang tshad med dang // thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu //
translated: nonabiding, likewise, power,üîΩnonattachment, nonobservation,üîΩexhaustion of signs and vows,üîΩits marks, immeasurables,

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩde la bar chad kyi chos la yang dag pa'i 'da' ba'i thabs la mkhas pa ni gang skyes bu sgyu rtsal la byang ba zhig /'brog dgon par chas pa'i dpes bdag gir byas pa'i sems can gyi khams phyir rgol ba'i chos las yang dag par 'da' ba shes
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no // de la bar chad kyi chos la yang dag pa'i 'da' ba'i thabs la mkhas pa ni gang skyes bu sgyu rtsal la byang ba zhig /'brog dgon par chas pa'i dpes bdag gir byas pa'i sems can gyi khams phyir rgol ba'i chos las yang dag par 'da' ba shes
translated: and skill in means are tenfold.

original: pa ni thabs la mkhas pa yin par don gyis bstan to zhes bshad do //
analyzed: pa ni thabs la mkhas pa yin par don gyis bstan to zhes bshad do //
translated: Skill in means for correctly transcending the phenomena of obstacles is taught by the example of a skilled person who sets out for a remote wilderness. It is skill in means to know how to cause the realm of sentient beings to transcend the phenomena of adversaries.

original: mi gnas pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in the means of non-abiding is

original: gang yang bya bar snang la rgyu ba sa la mi lhung @130a * //
analyzed: gang yang bya bar snang la rgyu ba sa la mi lhung @130a * //
translated: that, although one appears to act, one does not fall into the extreme of existence.

original: ba'i dpes mi gnas pa rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: ba'i dpes mi gnas pa rtogs pa ni /
translated: The realization of non-abiding is

original: mi gnas pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: skill in the means of non-abiding.

original: phyogs kyi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang / grogs dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phyogs zhes bya ba ni yang 'jug pas bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang / grogs dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phyogs zhes bya ba ni yang 'jug pas bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The term side refers to the characteristic of what is to be established, the characteristic of what accompanies it, and the side that is mentioned by engaging in action again.üîΩSkill in the means of the noble ones through previous momentum is

original: sngon gyi shugs kyis 'phags pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni gang skyes bu mthu dang ldan pa 'phong gi slob dpon du gyur pas /
analyzed: sngon gyi shugs kyis 'phags pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni gang skyes bu mthu dang ldan pa 'phong gi slob dpon du gyur pas /
translated: that, through the momentum of a vow, one understands the engagement in means, as indicated by the example of a powerful person who becomes a master of archeryüîΩand shoots an arrow into the sky, where it is caught by another.üîΩSkill in the means that is not shared isüîΩthat, through the power of a vow, one understands the engagement in means, as indicated by the example of a powerful person who becomes a master of archery

original: mda' nam mkhar 'phangs pa gcig la gcig long btags pa'i dpes smon lam btab pa'i shugs kyis thabs la rjes su 'jug pa shes pa yin par don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mda' nam mkhar 'phangs pa gcig la gcig long btags pa'i dpes smon lam btab pa'i shugs kyis thabs la rjes su 'jug pa shes pa yin par don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and shoots an arrow into the sky, where it is caught by another.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in the means that is not shared isüîΩthat, through the power of a vow, one understands the engagement in means, as indicated by the example of a powerful person who becomes a master of archeryüîΩand shoots an arrow into the sky, where it is caught by another.

original: gang sems can yongs su gtang ba'i bsam pas de ltar dga' ba'i gnas la sbyor ba shes pa ni /
analyzed: gang sems can yongs su gtang ba'i bsam pas de ltar dga' ba'i gnas la sbyor ba shes pa ni /
translated: The one who, with the thought of giving up sentient beings, knows how to apply them to such a delightful object,

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: is taught by implication to be skilled in the uncommon method.

original: ma chags pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: ma chags pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in the method of nonattachment is

original: gang rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bsam gtan la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad las yongs su ma nyams shing /
analyzed: gang rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bsam gtan la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad las yongs su ma nyams shing /
translated: the one who, without having attained the fruits of stream-enterer and so on, has not fallen away from all virtuous dharmas such as the meditative stabilizations,

original: mngon bar 'brel bar brjod par shes pa ni ro myang ba med par thabs la mkhas pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon bar 'brel bar brjod par shes pa ni ro myang ba med par thabs la mkhas pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: and who knows how to connect with the result. He is taught by implication to be skilled in the method of not relishing.

original: mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in the method of nonapprehending is

original: gang yang stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam par thar pa'i sgo sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par rtogs pas mi dmigs pa'i thabs shes pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam par thar pa'i sgo sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par rtogs pas mi dmigs pa'i thabs shes pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: the one who, by realizing the perfection of the cultivation of the door of liberation of the meditative stabilization of emptiness, knows how to apprehend without apprehending. He is taught by implication to be skilled in the method of nonapprehending.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in the method of signlessness isüîΩthe one who, by realizing the perfection of the cultivation of the door of liberation of the meditative stabilization of signlessness, knows how to apprehend without apprehending. He is taught by implication to be skilled in the method of signlessness.

original: gang yang mtshan ma med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo yongs su rdzogs par rtogs pas mtshan ma med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa shes pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //üîΩsmon pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang mtshan ma med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo yongs su rdzogs par rtogs pas mtshan ma med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa shes pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no // smon pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
translated: It is also taught by implication that the knowledge of the skill in means of signlessness is the full realization of the door of liberation of signlessness.

original: gang yang smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par rtogs pas smon pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa shes pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par rtogs pas smon pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa shes pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The skill in means of wishlessness is taught by implication as the knowledge of the skill in means of wishlessness, which is the full realization of the meditation on the door of liberation of wishlessness.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni /
translated: Emptiness and so on are taught by implication as the skill in means of emptiness and so on.

original: nyan thos pa la sogs pa dang / thun mong yin du zin kyang de thabs kyi khyad par yod pa'i @130b don ni de ltar spyod na mngon bar 'du bya ba med par ltung ba khams gsum pa dang lhan cig gnas pa ni gnas med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos pa la sogs pa dang / thun mong yin du zin kyang de thabs kyi khyad par yod pa'i @130b don ni de ltar spyod na mngon bar 'du bya ba med par ltung ba khams gsum pa dang lhan cig gnas pa ni gnas med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Even though emptiness and so on are shared with the sravakas and so on, the meaning of their existence as special skillful means is taught by the statement: If one practices in this way, it is impossible to fall into the absence of conflict and to dwell in the three realms together.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags kyi thabs la mkhas pa ni gang gzhan gyis dris pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dang rjes su mthun pa'i lung bstan pa la lung mi ston pas phyir mi ldog pa dang / phyir ldog pa nges par gzung ba'i thas la mkhas pa de'i rtags shes pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no //üîΩyul tshad med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni gang yang gang rnam pa de ltar lan ldon pa de dag mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyis thabs la mkhas pa'i yul tshad med pa nyid shes pa yin bar don gyis bstan to zhes don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags kyi thabs la mkhas pa ni gang gzhan gyis dris pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dang rjes su mthun pa'i lung bstan pa la lung mi ston pas phyir mi ldog pa dang / phyir ldog pa nges par gzung ba'i thas la mkhas pa de'i rtags shes pa yin par don gyis bstan pa yin no // yul tshad med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni gang yang gang rnam pa de ltar lan ldon pa de dag mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyis thabs la mkhas pa'i yul tshad med pa nyid shes pa yin bar don gyis bstan to zhes don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Skill in the means of the sign of irreversibility is skill in the means of the sign of irreversibility, which is indicated by the fact that one does not give a prophecy in accordance with the sign of irreversibility when asked by others, and skill in the means of ascertaining the reversible and irreversible, which is indicated by the fact that one knows the sign of that.üîΩSkill in the means of immeasurable objects is skill in the means of immeasurable objects, which is indicated by the fact that one knows the immeasurable objects of skill in means by being unassailable in answering questions in that way.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the chapter on skill in means, the eighth chapter of The Treatise on the Pith Instructions on Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ, Called The Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: // / de dag de ltar byas na rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang / phan yon dang bcas pa dang / bar chad dang bcas pa dang / yul dang bcas pa dang / khyad par dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: // / de dag de ltar byas na rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang / phan yon dang bcas pa dang / bar chad dang bcas pa dang / yul dang bcas pa dang / khyad par dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is endowed with aspects, endowed with practice, endowed with benefits, endowed with hindrances, endowed with objects, endowed with distinctions,

original: byed pa dang bcas pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa dang / 'jug pa dang bcas pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang bcas pa dang / rten dang bcas pa dang / yan lag dang bcas pa dang / nye ba'i yan lag dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: byed pa dang bcas pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa dang / 'jug pa dang bcas pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang bcas pa dang / rten dang bcas pa dang / yan lag dang bcas pa dang / nye ba'i yan lag dang bcas pa dang /
translated: endowed with activity, endowed with essence, endowed with engagement, endowed with full maturation, endowed with support, endowed with branches, endowed with sub-branches,

original: yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa ni /
translated: and endowed with appropriation.

original: rnam pa thams cad mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs par gyur par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs par gyur par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the complete realization of all aspects.

original: de la yul ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul gang yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yul ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul gang yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Among these, the object should be understood as the object characterized by consciousness.

original: 'jug pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams yin te /
translated: Engagement refers to the factors conducive to liberation,

original: de rnams kyi bstan pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bstan pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they engage in the teaching of those.

original: yongs su smin pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams te /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams te /
translated: The fully matured is the factors conducive to penetration,

original: de rnams kyi rgyud yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyud yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because their continuum becomes fully matured.

original: rten ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: rten ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun no //
translated: The support is the community of irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: yan lag ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The branch is the equality of samsara and nirvana.

original: nye ba'i yan lag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i yan lag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The subsidiary branch is the purification of the buddhafield.

original: lhag ma ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //üîΩyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs @131a * //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye'o // yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs @131a * //
translated: The rest is easy to understand and thus is not explained.

original: pa la khyad bar ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: pa la khyad bar ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: Again, what is the difference between the knowledge of all aspects and the complete clear knowledge of all aspects?

original: kun mkhyen gsum ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa rnams so sor nges pa yin pas rnam pa'i yul re rer nges pa yin la /
analyzed: kun mkhyen gsum ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa rnams so sor nges pa yin pas rnam pa'i yul re rer nges pa yin la /
translated: The three knowledges are individually ascertained aspects as they have been explained, and thus they are ascertained as the objects of individual aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa ni rnam pa ma lus pa yul du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa ni rnam pa ma lus pa yul du byed pa yin te /
translated: The complete clear knowledge of all aspects is the object of all aspects without exception.

original: de ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ni khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the difference.

original: yang na kun mkhyen gsum du bzhag pa ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na kun mkhyen gsum du bzhag pa ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: Or else, the three knowledges are defined by their characteristics.

original: rnam pa kun mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The complete clear knowledge of all the modes is defined by its application.

original: khyad par gzhan yang rnam pa kun mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa ni mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po'i gnas skabs kyis rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan yang rnam pa kun mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa ni mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po'i gnas skabs kyis rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the complete clear knowledge of all the modes is distinguished by the state of the counteractives and their opposites.

original: rnam pa la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de lta bu ma yin te /
