translated: But the knowledge of all the modes is not like that,

original: rnam pa ni zhi ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa ni zhi ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mode is only peace.

original: de ni de ltar byas na /
analyzed: de ni de ltar byas na /
translated: Thus,üîΩthe modes, together with their application,

original: rnam pa sbyor bar bcas rnams dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
analyzed: rnam pa sbyor bar bcas rnams dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
translated: and the qualities and faults, together with their characteristics,üîΩare the factors of liberation and the factors conducive to liberation,

original: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: the assembly of the learners and the assembly of the nonreturners,

original: srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhing dag bla na med pa ste //
analyzed: srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhing dag bla na med pa ste //
translated: the equality of existence and of peace, and the unsurpassable field.

original: de ltar thabs la mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: de ltar thabs la mkhas pa ni //
translated: Thus, skill in means

original: rnam kun mngon rtogs rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam kun mngon rtogs rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The complete clear realization of all aspects.

original: zhes bya ba ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i 'brel pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i 'brel pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is to be seen as the connection with the sequence.

original: mngon bar rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las rnam pa kun mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: mngon bar rtogs pa'i rgyan shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos las rnam pa kun mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the complete clear realization of all aspects, a treatise of advice on the perfection of wisdom, an ornament to clear realization.

original: // / rnam pa kun mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa bstan nas da ni rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / rnam pa kun mngon bar rdzogs par rtogs pa bstan nas da ni rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having explained the complete clear realization of all aspects, now the clear realization of the peak should be explained.

original: de la re zhig gang gis de mtshon par 'gyur ba'i rtags brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig gang gis de mtshon par 'gyur ba'i rtags brjod par bya ste /
translated: To begin with, the signs by which that is indicated should be mentioned.

original: de'i rtags gang yin pa de yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de'i rtags gang yin pa de yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What are the signs of that?

original: rmi lam na yang chos rnams kun //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang chos rnams kun //
translated: In dreams all phenomena

original: rmi lam lta bu lta la sogs //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu lta la sogs //
translated: Are seen to be like dreams and so on.

original: rtse mor phyin pa'i sbyor ba'i rtags //
analyzed: rtse mor phyin pa'i sbyor ba'i rtags //
translated: These are the signs of the peak

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu bzhed //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu bzhed //
translated: Application, asserted to be of twelve kinds.

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de la rtags dang po ni /
analyzed: de la rtags dang po ni /
translated: The first sign is as follows.

original: gang rmi lam gyi nang du yang chos rnams ni rmi lam lta bur blta'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang rmi lam gyi nang du yang chos rnams ni rmi lam lta bur blta'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In a dream, one should see phenomena as like a dream.

original: de'i mdo ni /
analyzed: de'i mdo ni /
translated: The s≈´tra says:

original: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rmi lam gyi nang du yang chos rnams rmi lam lta bur blta zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rmi lam gyi nang du yang chos rnams rmi lam lta bur blta zhing /
translated: Subh≈´ti, if a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva, even in a dream, sees phenomena as like a dream,

original: de @131b bzhin du sgra brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang / sprul pa dang / sgyu ma dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang 'dra bar chos thams cad la blta zhing mngon du mi byed na de ni rtse mo las phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de @131b bzhin du sgra brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang / sprul pa dang / sgyu ma dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang 'dra bar chos thams cad la blta zhing mngon du mi byed na de ni rtse mo las phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and similarly sees all phenomena as like an echo, a mirage, a magical creation, an illusion, and a gandharva city, but does not actualize them, this should be known as the characteristic of irreversibility from the peak.

original: don ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: don ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: gang de ltar thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor gyi chos bsgoms pas rtse mo thob pa ni rmi lam gyi nang du yang rnal 'byor 'di nges par mthong ba'i yid la byed pa gang yin pas sems can gyi khams
analyzed: gang de ltar thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor gyi chos bsgoms pas rtse mo thob pa ni rmi lam gyi nang du yang rnal 'byor 'di nges par mthong ba'i yid la byed pa gang yin pas sems can gyi khams
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the peak through cultivating the yoga of Dharma, which is fully embraced by means of and wisdom, is one who, even in dreams, is constantly mindful of this yoga.

original: la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa yin no //
translated: He remains in a state of concern for the realm of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du mdo gzhan las bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo gzhan las bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught in another sutra.

original: gnyis pa ni gang de nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa dang / khams gsum po 'dor ba'i sems dang / dga' ba'i sems mi skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gang de nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa dang / khams gsum po 'dor ba'i sems dang / dga' ba'i sems mi skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The second is taught by the phrase ‚Äúbecause he does not generate a mind that rejects the stage of the sravaka and so on and the three realms, and a mind of joy.‚Äù

original: gsum pa ni gang de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor chen pos bskor ba mthong zhing /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gang de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor chen pos bskor ba mthong zhing /
translated: The third is taught by the phrase ‚Äúbecause he sees the Tathagata surrounded by a great retinue,

original: de dam pa'i chos ston pa'i chos kyi rjes su sgrub pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dam pa'i chos ston pa'i chos kyi rjes su sgrub pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and because he practices the Dharma that he teaches.‚Äù

original: bzhi pa ni gang yang de nyid sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul ba mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gang yang de nyid sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul ba mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is taught by the fact that he sees the miracles of the Buddha's magical power.

original: lnga pa ni gang yang de nyid 'jigs pa'i gnas thams cad la khams gsum pa rmi lam lta bur chos ston pas nye bar bsdus pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩdrug pa ni gang yang sems can nga dmyal ba la sogs pa mthong nas /
analyzed: lnga pa ni gang yang de nyid 'jigs pa'i gnas thams cad la khams gsum pa rmi lam lta bur chos ston pas nye bar bsdus pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // drug pa ni gang yang sems can nga dmyal ba la sogs pa mthong nas /
translated: The fifth is taught by the fact that he is able to gather the thought of enlightenment by teaching the Dharma to all the beings in the three realms, who are the objects of his fear, as being like a dream.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ngan song spang bar bya ba rjes su dran pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ngan song spang bar bya ba rjes su dran pa thob pa yin no //
translated: The sixth is taught by the fact that he remembers the abandonment of the evil states in his own Buddha-field, having seen beings in the hells, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa ni /
translated: The realization of the peak is

original: 'khor ba rmi lam dang / rmi lam gang yin pa gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba rmi lam dang / rmi lam gang yin pa gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa'o //
translated: the nonduality and indivisibility of cyclic life and a dream.

original: bsam pas rnam pa gnyis su dbyer mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pas rnam pa gnyis su dbyer mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that it is indivisible into two aspects by thought.

original: bdun pa ni gang rmi lam sad pa'i gnas skabs su grong khyer la sogs pa mes tshig par gyur pa bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rab tu zhi bar nus pas phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin pa dang / de'i phyogs gcig zhi bar mi nus pa ni chos spong ba'i las byas pa nyid dang /üîΩkhyim la la ni tshig @132a * //
analyzed: bdun pa ni gang rmi lam sad pa'i gnas skabs su grong khyer la sogs pa mes tshig par gyur pa bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rab tu zhi bar nus pas phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin pa dang / de'i phyogs gcig zhi bar mi nus pa ni chos spong ba'i las byas pa nyid dang / khyim la la ni tshig @132a * //
translated: One who is unable to pacify even a part of that is one who has committed the karma of abandoning the Dharma.üîΩSome houses are burned

original: khyim la la ni ma tshig pa las /
analyzed: khyim la la ni ma tshig pa las /
translated: and some houses are not burned.

original: sems can de dag gi las tshe 'di la rnam par smin pa nyid do zhes bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi las tshe 'di la rnam par smin pa nyid do zhes bstan pa nyid do //
translated: It is taught that the karma of those sentient beings ripens in this life.

original: brgyad pa ni gang yang mi ma yin pas byin gyis brlabs pa la /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni gang yang mi ma yin pas byin gyis brlabs pa la /
translated: The eighth is that one who is blessed by a nonhuman

original: de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to dispel that,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i bden pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa la 'byor pa dang / bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs nas bsal ba de la rang nyid nga rgyal skye ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la brnyas pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i bden pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa la 'byor pa dang / bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs nas bsal ba de la rang nyid nga rgyal skye ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la brnyas pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: has mastery in the power of the true reality of irreversibility and who generates pride in dispelling that which is blessed by a mƒÅra and who has the characteristic of despising other bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thabs la mkhas pas yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir dang / bdud kyis de'i ming dang rus la sogs pa gtan la phebs par smra bas slu ba rtogs pa'i ngag ma rtogs pa dang / yang bdud rang gis brtags pa'i slu tshig gtan pa bdag gir byed pa dang /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir dang / bdud kyis de'i ming dang rus la sogs pa gtan la phebs par smra bas slu ba rtogs pa'i ngag ma rtogs pa dang / yang bdud rang gis brtags pa'i slu tshig gtan pa bdag gir byed pa dang /
translated: Because they are not sustained by skill in means, because they are not aware of the speech that is deceived by Mara, who speaks of the determination of their name, clan, and so on, because they are not aware of the deceptive words that Mara himself has determined,üîΩand because that pride in displaying one's name is a heavier karma than the four defeats and five inexpiable sins.

original: phas pham pa bzhi dang / mtshams med pa lnga bas kyang ming bstan pa'i rlom sems de shin tu lci ba'i las nyid dang yang bdud kyis dben pa'i yon tan bstan pas /
analyzed: phas pham pa bzhi dang / mtshams med pa lnga bas kyang ming bstan pa'i rlom sems de shin tu lci ba'i las nyid dang yang bdud kyis dben pa'i yon tan bstan pas /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that because Mara teaches the qualities of solitude,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems kyi dpen pa rjes su gnang ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems kyi dpen pa rjes su gnang ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: the Bhagavan approved of the solitude of the minds of sravakas and so on.

original: dgu pa ni gang mngon ba'i nga rgyal can gyi gang zag spangs pa dang / rang gi don la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa'i rang gi mngon bar shes pas pha rol gnon pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen chos thams cad thob pa'i rgyu yin par shes par bya ba nyid dang /
analyzed: dgu pa ni gang mngon ba'i nga rgyal can gyi gang zag spangs pa dang / rang gi don la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa'i rang gi mngon bar shes pas pha rol gnon pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen chos thams cad thob pa'i rgyu yin par shes par bya ba nyid dang /
translated: The spiritual master is the result, the cause, the path, and the method.üîΩThe spiritual master is the eye, form, light, and vision.üîΩThe spiritual master is the ear, sound, hearing, and understanding.üîΩThe spiritual master is the nose, smell, scent, and cognition.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa nyid dang / de rnams dge ba'i chos thob pa'i lam shes par bya ba'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩbcu pa ni gang mngon bar 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'dod na /üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa nyid dang / de rnams dge ba'i chos thob pa'i lam shes par bya ba'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no // bcu pa ni gang mngon bar 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'dod na / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya ste /
translated: The spiritual master is the tongue, taste, flavor, and cognition.üîΩThe spiritual master is the body, touch, contact, and cognition.üîΩThe spiritual master is the mind, phenomena, thought, and cognition.üîΩThe spiritual master is the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of effort, the perfection of meditation, and the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe spiritual master is the perfection of skill in means, the perfection of aspiration, the perfection of strength, the perfection of knowledge, and the perfection of gnosis.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad rgya cher bstan to zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad rgya cher bstan to zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The spiritual master is the perfection of the four immeasurables, the perfection of the four means of gathering, the perfection of the four forms of correct understanding, and the perfection of the four forms of thorough knowledge.üîΩThe spiritual master is the perfection of the four forms of correct knowledge, the perfection of the four forms of individual knowledge, the perfection of the four forms of complete knowledge, and the perfection of the four forms of complete understanding.üîΩThe spiritual master is the perfection of the four forms of correct knowledge, the perfection of the four forms of individual knowledge, the perfection of the four forms of complete knowledge, and the perfection of the four forms of complete understanding.üîΩThe spiritual master is the perfection of the four forms of correct knowledge, the perfection of the four forms of individual knowledge, the perfection of the four forms of complete knowledge, and the perfection of the four forms of complete understanding.üîΩThe spiritual master is the perfection of

original: bcu gcig pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags med pa shes par bya ba'i don dang / dben pa dang /
analyzed: bcu gcig pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags med pa shes par bya ba'i don dang / dben pa dang /
translated: The eleventh is that since the perfection of wisdom has the characteristic of being free from the latent tendencies of the concepts of object and subject, like space, it is the object to be known.

original: stong @132b pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam dag gi chos thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: stong @132b pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam dag gi chos thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: And since it has the characteristic of emptiness and isolation, all phenomena are, in order, the perfection of wisdom, existing as its characteristic.

original: de lta na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de lta na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med par 'gyur bas na /
translated: If that were so, then there would be no affliction and purification.

original: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Therefore, Subh≈´ti, what do you think?üîΩAre sentient beings engaged for a long time in the notion of I and mine?

original: sems can rnams yun ring po nas bdag dang bdag gir bya ba la spyod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa de grub po zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams yun ring po nas bdag dang bdag gir bya ba la spyod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa de grub po zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that this is established.

original: bcu gnyis pa ni gang de ltar spyod pa ni zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ni gang de ltar spyod pa ni zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: The twelfth is the one who is not overpowered by others because he practices in that way.üîΩ

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The twelfth is taught because one who practices in that way is close to the knowledge of all aspects because one cannot be overcome.

original: rtags kyi rnam par 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: rtags kyi rnam par 'grel ba'o /
translated: The explanation of the signs.

original: // / rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa gang gis mtshon par 'gyur ba'i rtags rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: // / rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa gang gis mtshon par 'gyur ba'i rtags rnams bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the signs that are characterized by the peak realization,

original: da ni de'i rnam par 'phel ba gang zhig yin zhe na ;
analyzed: da ni de'i rnam par 'phel ba gang zhig yin zhe na ;
translated: now, what is its enhancement?

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi grangs snyed kyi //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi grangs snyed kyi //
translated: The enhancement of the peak is as follows:

original: sangs rgyas mchod pa'i dge la sogs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mchod pa'i dge la sogs //
translated: The merit of worshipping the buddhasüîΩAs numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges

original: dper mdzad nas ni rnam mang du //
analyzed: dper mdzad nas ni rnam mang du //
translated: And so on is taken as an example

original: rnam 'phel bcu drug bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnam 'phel bcu drug bdag nyid do //
translated: And multiplied sixteenfold.

original: de la rnam par 'phel pa dang po ni //
analyzed: de la rnam par 'phel pa dang po ni //
translated: The first enhancement is as follows:üîΩThe merit of worshipping tathagatas

original: gang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyi grangs snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa la /
analyzed: gang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyi grangs snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa la /
translated: as numerous as the number of sentient beings in Jambudvipa

original: rim gro la sogs pas mchod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: rim gro la sogs pas mchod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
translated: The wholesome roots of worship and so on that are dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are not as great as the merit that increases when this perfection of wisdom is taught to others, and when one is not separated from the attention endowed with the perfection of wisdom.

original: ma bral ba na de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel ba dang / de bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bzhag nas /
analyzed: ma bral ba na de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel ba dang / de bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bzhag nas /
translated: Similarly, if all the sentient beings there are in the great billion world universe were to be established in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa bas cig shos kyis bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa bas cig shos kyis bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid yin no //
translated: and if the wholesome roots of that were dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, the other would have merit that increases even more.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa'i byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas @133a * //
analyzed: de'i de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa'i byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas @133a * //
translated: The love, compassion, joy, and equanimity of beings other than the Tathagata are not like that.

original: par bya ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: par bya ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no /
translated: The TathƒÅgata has taught that there is no abiding in love, compassion, joy, and equanimity other than the TathƒÅgata.

original: de'i mdo ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de'i mdo ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: The s≈´tra says, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, what do you think?

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can de dag thams cad mi'i bdag nyid thob nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur la /üîΩde la rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can de dag thams cad mi'i bdag nyid thob nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur la / de la rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: If all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa were to attain the state of a human and fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment,üîΩand if some son or daughter of good family were to serve and respect them for as long as they live,

original: rigs kyi bu mo 'ga' zhig gis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bsnyen bkur la sogs pa byas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo 'ga' zhig gis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bsnyen bkur la sogs pa byas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: and so on.

original: de bzhin du mdo gzhan las kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo gzhan las kyang gsungs so //
translated: And so it is stated in other s≈´tras as well.

original: gnyis pa ni gang skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis nor bu rin po che rnyed ma myong ba zhig rnyed pa las yang stor ba'i dpes /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gang skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis nor bu rin po che rnyed ma myong ba zhig rnyed pa las yang stor ba'i dpes /
translated: The second is the example of a person who finds a precious jewel that they have never seen before, but then lose it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gcig tu gtod pa'i yid la byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gcig tu gtod pa'i yid la byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the mental activity that is single-pointedly focused on the perfection of wisdom.

original: yid la bya ba thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid la bya ba thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all mental activities are empty by nature.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba nyid kyi dngos po bskyed pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba nyid kyi dngos po bskyed pas /
translated: Because the entity that is not separate from the perfection of wisdom is generated.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
translated: Thus, all phenomena are free from intrinsic nature.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa bkag pas mi 'bral ba nyid du rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa bkag pas mi 'bral ba nyid du rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because the increase and decrease of the perfection of wisdom are refuted, it is established as being inseparable.

original: gsum pa ni gang rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gang rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The third is from the passage that begins, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, when bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, there is no increase or decrease,‚Äù

original: rab 'byor de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa ste /
translated: up to the passage that states, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, that is the attainment of the acceptance that phenomena are not produced by bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas.

original: rab 'byor bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i gnas
analyzed: rab 'byor bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i gnas
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is impossible that a bodhisattva great being who has such patience will not attain the great wisdom of the unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, the wisdom of omniscience.

original: med do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: med do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar de de la gzhol bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de de la gzhol bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: It is because they will be inclined toward that.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no /
translated: They will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: bzhi pa ni /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni /
translated: The fourth is as follows.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das ji ltar lags /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das ji ltar lags /
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúHow is it?

original: chos thams cad mi skye ba nyid gang lags pa de las /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi skye ba nyid gang lags pa de las /
translated: From the nonarising of all phenomena,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems @133b dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems @133b dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ram /
translated: will bodhisattva great beings receive a prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment?‚Äù

original: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subhuti, it is not so, and so on up to

original: rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs par byed pa'i chos nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs par byed pa'i chos nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the phenomena that are to be realized and the one who realizes them are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par rtog pa de lta bu thams cad med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par rtog pa de lta bu thams cad med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the bodhisattva who practices this has no such conceptual thoughts at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa la /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa la /
translated: In the realization of the peak

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: lnga pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon bar brtson pa las /
analyzed: lnga pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon bar brtson pa las /
translated: The fifth is the explanation of the great merit of training in that,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mi brtan pa dang ldan pa bkag pas /üîΩde la slob pa bsod nams mang bar bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mi brtan pa dang ldan pa bkag pas /üîΩde la slob pa bsod nams mang bar bshad pa'i phyir /

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pas /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pas /
translated: Because the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa have attained the path of the ten virtues and the meditative absorptions and formless [absorptions],

analyzed: chos 'di la mngon bar brtson pa dang ldan pa bsod nams mang du 'phel ba'i phyir te /
translated: [the bodhisattva] who is endowed with striving in this Dharma increases his merit greatly.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad dang / nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mi mkhas pa thams cad zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad dang / nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mi mkhas pa thams cad zil gyis mnan te /
translated: Because [the bodhisattva] surpasses all worldly [persons], the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc., and all bodhisattvas who are unskilled in means,

original: nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩdrug pa ni gang de ltar spyod pa la lha'i tshogs thams cad nye bar 'dod pa dang / sems par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa rnams la yang khams mi mnyam pas /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // drug pa ni gang de ltar spyod pa la lha'i tshogs thams cad nye bar 'dod pa dang / sems par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa rnams la yang khams mi mnyam pas /
translated: and because [the bodhisattva] is destined for definite emergence.

original: kun nas bslangs pa'i nad la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas bslangs pa'i nad la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The sixth [benefit] is that the entire host of gods will desire to approach and attend upon one who practices in that way, and because [the bodhisattva] stops the illnesses, etc. that are brought about by the imbalance of the elements, even when harmed by others.üîΩThus it is taught.

original: bdun pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa' slob pa'i dus su nyan thos la sogs pa slob pa'i sar ltung ba byas pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba las gzhan du 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bdud rnams dogs pa skye bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdun pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa' slob pa'i dus su nyan thos la sogs pa slob pa'i sar ltung ba byas pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba las gzhan du 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bdud rnams dogs pa skye bar byed pa dang /
translated: The seventh is when, while bodhisattvas are training, they are made to fall to the level of training of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on, and the mƒÅras of the worlds of the great trichiliocosm are made to fear that they will go elsewhere than to manifest complete buddhahood in unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: de mya ngan gyi zug rngu zug par 'gyur pa dang / yang de rnams skar mda' ltung ba gtong ba la sogs pa dang / kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi @134a * //
analyzed: de mya ngan gyi zug rngu zug par 'gyur pa dang / yang de rnams skar mda' ltung ba gtong ba la sogs pa dang / kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi @134a * //
translated: They are made to feel the pain of grief, and they are made to cast down shooting stars and so on.

original: mdun du bdud sdig can 'tshe ba'i bsam pas 'ong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mdun du bdud sdig can 'tshe ba'i bsam pas 'ong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ƒÄnanda, the sinful MƒÅra does not come before all bodhisattvas with the intention of harming them.

original: sngon gyi tshe rabs su chos 'di la lhag par mos pa dang / the tshom za bar gyur pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang pa na la sogs pa'i chos ma yin pa 'dzin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: sngon gyi tshe rabs su chos 'di la lhag par mos pa dang / the tshom za bar gyur pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang pa na la sogs pa'i chos ma yin pa 'dzin par byed pa dang /
translated: In former lives, they had little interest in this teaching, had doubts about it, were separated from spiritual teachers, and held to non-Dharmic teachings such as the LokƒÅyata.

original: de'i bsngags pa brjod pa la khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos pas ci zhig bya zhes zer zhing rnam par 'byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la brnyas pa dang / nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag rnams dang lhan cig 'thab cing rtsod pa la sogs pa dang /

translated: They disparage other bodhisattvas, quarrel with and dispute with the listeners and bodhisattvas,üîΩand are malicious toward those who are not predicted to attain buddhahood and those who are predicted to attain it.

original: lung ma bstan pa dang / lung bstan pa gzhan dag la gnod sems dang ldan pa la ni bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa dang / lung bstan pa gzhan dag la gnod sems dang ldan pa la ni bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur bas /

analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su gtang ba dang ldan pa ni /
translated: They are endowed with the complete abandonment of omniscience.

original: de srid kyi dus su dmyal bar gnas par go cha bgo bar khas blangs pa nyid dang / 'chags shing sdom par brtson gyi sdom pa la gnas pas las kyi sgrib pa de las ldang ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de srid kyi dus su dmyal bar gnas par go cha bgo bar khas blangs pa nyid dang / 'chags shing sdom par brtson gyi sdom pa la gnas pas las kyi sgrib pa de las ldang ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: It is taught that at that time, one should don the armor of remaining in hell, and that one should rise from that karmic obscuration by remaining in the vow of striving to confess and restrain from faults.

original: gnas pa nyung ba'i dpes rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu nyid thob pa rnyed pa ni ches nyung ba nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩbcu gnyis pa ni gang yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems mi skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa nyung ba'i dpes rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu nyid thob pa rnyed pa ni ches nyung ba nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩbcu gnyis pa ni gang yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems mi skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The twelfth is taught in order to understand that the attainment of the fruit of Buddhahood, the realization of the peak, is extremely rare, as illustrated by the example of the few

original: bcu gsum pa ni gang gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa ni gang gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thirteenth is because the mind that is endowed with form and so on is not generated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the great bodhisattva who practices this perfection of wisdom, which has the characteristic of the realization of the peak, does so because all phenomena are unobservable.

original: bcu bzhi pa ni gang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par thams cad du 'dus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩbco lnga pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni /
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa ni gang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par thams cad du 'dus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // bco lnga pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni /
translated: The fourteenth is taught because all [phenomena] are included in the perfection of wisdom through the example of the view of the transitory collection.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩgal te de lta yin na nyan thos sam /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // gal te de lta yin na nyan thos sam /
translated: The fifteenth is taught because training in the perfection of wisdom is the cause for attaining all perfections.

original: rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then [the bodhisattva] would become a ≈õrƒÅvaka orüîΩa pratyekabuddha.

original: de'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnams shes pa dang / mthong bas de dag bltas te 'da' bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnams shes pa dang / mthong bas de dag bltas te 'da' bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the perfection of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas should be seen and transcended through knowledge and insight.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bsal ba'i phyir mthong ba zhes smos pa yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bsal ba'i phyir mthong ba zhes smos pa yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äúseeing‚Äù is used to eliminate the knowledge of inference.

original: 'khrul par snang ba bsal ba'i phyir shes pa smos pa yin no //üîΩshes pa dang mthong @135a * //
analyzed: 'khrul par snang ba bsal ba'i phyir shes pa smos pa yin no // shes pa dang mthong @135a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúknowledge‚Äù is used to eliminate deluded appearances.

original: ba'i tshig ni yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i tshig ni yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúknowledge‚Äù and ‚Äúseeing‚Äù are used to show that the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas are to be known as the bodhisattva‚Äôs path of cultivation.

original: yang ci'i phyir de dag 'di'i bsgom pa'i lam du bkag ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de dag 'di'i bsgom pa'i lam du bkag ce na /
translated: Why are they blocked from this path?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang ; spangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa yin zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang ; spangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa yin zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the knowledge and abandonment of the stream-enterers up to the pratyekabuddhas is the bodhisattva‚Äôs acceptance.

original: gtso bo gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtso bo gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are not the principal ones.

original: yang 'da' bar byed pa ni rnam pa thams cad mngon bar rtogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'da' bar byed pa ni rnam pa thams cad mngon bar rtogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the surpassing is the entry into the realization of all aspects.

original: rnam par 'phel ba bcu drug pa ni gal te yang 'di snyam du 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba bcu drug pa ni gal te yang 'di snyam du 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The sixteenth increase is as follows: ‚ÄúEven if he thinks, ‚ÄòThis is the perfection of wisdom,‚Äô etc.,

original: de'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa bkag pa la slob par rjes su gnang ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa bkag pa la slob par rjes su gnang ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: he is permitted to train in the cessation of the discriminations of its object.‚Äù

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because he is close to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rnam par 'phel ba'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the chapter on the increase.

original: // / rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa'i rnam par 'phel ba ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: // / rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa'i rnam par 'phel ba ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the realization of the peak is an increase,

original: bogs dbyung ba bstan nas /
analyzed: bogs dbyung ba bstan nas /
translated: having shown the increase,

original: da ji ltar 'gyur ba'i nges ba brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ji ltar 'gyur ba'i nges ba brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to state the certainty of how it is,

original: sems can don yongs mi gtong ba //üîΩkun mkhyen nyid gsum chos rnams kyis //
analyzed: sems can don yongs mi gtong ba // kun mkhyen nyid gsum chos rnams kyis //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúNot abandoning the welfare of sentient beings,‚Äù etc.üîΩThe unsurpassed perfection

original: yongs su rdzogs pa bla na med //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa bla na med //
translated: of the three omnisciences and of all dharmas,

original: nges pa zhes ni mngon bar brjod //
analyzed: nges pa zhes ni mngon bar brjod //
translated: It is called ‚Äúcertainty‚Äù because it is manifest.

original: ces bstan pa ni gang de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod cing /
analyzed: ces bstan pa ni gang de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod cing /
translated: The teaching is as follows: ‚ÄúThus, a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva, practicing the perfection of generosity, up to practicing the unentangled qualities of a buddha,

original: sems can thams cad zil gyis gnon na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad zil gyis gnon na /
translated: surpasses all sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur nas /
translated: What need is there to speak of attaining manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment?

original: lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i bar dang / thams cad kyi yid du 'ong ba yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba ni rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa la /
analyzed: lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i bar dang / thams cad kyi yid du 'ong ba yin no // zhes bya ba ni rtse mo'i mngon bar rtogs pa la /
translated: All will be dear to him.‚ÄùüîΩThis teaches that the attainment of the stage of certainty in the realization of the peak

original: nges pa'i gnas skabs thob pa ni rnyed par dka' bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i gnas skabs thob pa ni rnyed par dka' bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: is for the sake of knowing that it is difficult to obtain.

original: de ston pa lha'i me tog man dar ba nye bar gtor ba dang / mngon du phyogs nas gtor ba dang / rab tu khyab par gtor nas mchod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par @135b bsngos pa'i tshig gis /
analyzed: de ston pa lha'i me tog man dar ba nye bar gtor ba dang / mngon du phyogs nas gtor ba dang / rab tu khyab par gtor nas mchod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par @135b bsngos pa'i tshig gis /
translated: He taught this by scattering divine flowers, by scattering them in front, and by scattering them pervasively.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos rnams dang / rang 'byung gi chos rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces bya ba /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos rnams dang / rang 'byung gi chos rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces bya ba /
translated: The roots of virtue of the offering were dedicated with the words ‚ÄúMay the qualities of omniscience, the qualities of self-arising, and the uncontaminated qualities be perfected.‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par bsngos pas de bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par bsngos pas de bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The dedication was made for the complete perfection of the three omnisciences.

original: ji ltar na sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he never abandons the welfare of sentient beings?

original: de lta bu'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs su mya ngan las 'das pa spang ba'i phyir dang / thugs rje chen po mngon du bya ba'i dgongs pas sems can ma bsgral ba bsgral ba la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs su mya ngan las 'das pa spang ba'i phyir dang / thugs rje chen po mngon du bya ba'i dgongs pas sems can ma bsgral ba bsgral ba la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: At the time of possessing such realization, one generates the thought of liberating those sentient beings who are not liberated, and so on, with the intention of manifesting great compassion and abandoning nirvana.

original: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa dang / spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams /
analyzed: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa dang / spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams /
translated: Those who have newly entered the vehicle, those who have entered the conduct, those who are irreversible, and those who are impeded by one birth,

original: ci rigs par rtogs pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i phyogs mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par rtogs pa bzhi'i gnyen po'i phyogs mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam rtogs pa'o //
translated: realize the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, which are the antidotes to the four realizations, respectively.

original: rnam pa bzhi bstan pas bzhi po de dag bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi bstan pas bzhi po de dag bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the four are explained by teaching the four.

original: nges pa'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: nges pa'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
translated: The explanation of the definite

original: // / ting nge 'dzin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / ting nge 'dzin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach samƒÅdhi,üîΩthe four continents, a thousand times

original: gling bzhi pa ni stong dag dang // stong gnyis gsum dag dper mdzad nas //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa ni stong dag dang // stong gnyis gsum dag dper mdzad nas //
translated: a thousand times three,

original: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
translated: through the many merits

original: ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrags pa yin //
translated: This is the proclamation of meditative absorption.

original: zhes bstan pa ni gang rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams mang po nas brtsams te /üîΩgling chen po bzhi ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams srang gis gzhal ba'i dpe dang / de bzhin du stong chen po dang / stong gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i phung po ji snyed yod pa de dag skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i cha gcig gis /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni gang rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams mang po nas brtsams te / gling chen po bzhi ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams srang gis gzhal ba'i dpe dang / de bzhin du stong chen po dang / stong gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i phung po ji snyed yod pa de dag skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i cha gcig gis /
translated: The teaching is from the beginning of the merit of rejoicing

original: chu'i thigs pa blangs pa'i tshad gzung ba'i dpes /
analyzed: chu'i thigs pa blangs pa'i tshad gzung ba'i dpes /
translated: up to the example of weighing the world systems of the four great continents on a scale, and similarly, the great trichiliocosm, the second-order thousand universes, and the great trichiliocosm, and the example of the amount of water in the great oceans of the great trichiliocosm being measured with a part of a hair split a hundred times.

original: de dag gi rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i bsod nams mang ba nyid dang ; sems bskyed pa 'di dag dang ldan pa dag ni /
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i bsod nams mang ba nyid dang ; sems bskyed pa 'di dag dang ldan pa dag ni /
translated: The merit of the bodhicitta associated with rejoicing in those is greater than that.üîΩThose who possess these bodhicittas, wherever they are born,

original: gang dang gang du skyes pa de dag tu zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang dang gang du skyes pa de dag tu zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: and so on.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang bar byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //üîΩsems ma yin pa @136a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang bar byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o // sems ma yin pa @136a * //
translated: and rejoice in the roots of virtue, and dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.üîΩAnd there is no other mind than that, so one should dedicate to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang med par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du phan yon rnam pa mang po zhig bstan pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang med par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du phan yon rnam pa mang po zhig bstan pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, many benefits are taught.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa de dag ni dro ba la sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi dang 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid du go rims bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa de dag ni dro ba la sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi dang 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid du go rims bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: These four, permanence, etc., should be understood as the characteristics of the four aspects of heat, etc., respectively.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of concentration.

original: // / da ni mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen por bcas pa rnam pa bzhi po gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen por bcas pa rnam pa bzhi po gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the four aspects of the path of seeing, which are the antidotes to the four types of grasping and fixation,

original: 'jug pa dang ni ldog pa la //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ni ldog pa la //
translated: In engagement and disengagement,

original: gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor te //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor te //
translated: there are discriminations of the apprehended,

original: dgu yi bdag nyid yin zhes bya //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dgu yi bdag nyid yin zhes bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: each of which has nine varieties.

original: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the discrimination of the apprehended is twofold:

original: ma lus pa la 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can dang po ni /
analyzed: ma lus pa la 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can dang po ni /
translated: the first is based on the side of engagement with the totality,

original: gang gnyis dang gnyis su med pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i sems bskyed pa de lta bus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos par nges par sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gnyis dang gnyis su med pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i sems bskyed pa de lta bus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos par nges par sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: because it is taught that one should definitely apply oneself to the dedication to unsurpassed, true, complete enlightenment with a thought that is free of the notion of duality and nonduality.

original: ma lus pa las ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can rnam pa gnyis ni /üîΩgang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: ma lus pa las ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can rnam pa gnyis ni / gang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: The second is based on the side of disengagement from the totality,üîΩas in the passage beginning,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, when one practices the perfection of wisdom, it is nonconceptual.‚Äù

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: The practice of the perfection of wisdom that is nonconceptual

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rnam par byang ba'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rnam par byang ba'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: up to ‚Äúone awakens to full, supreme enlightenment without conceptualization‚Äù is taught in order to refute the conceptualization of the object of purification.

original: yang rgyu gang gis de dag rnam par rtog pa zhes bstan ce na /
analyzed: yang rgyu gang gis de dag rnam par rtog pa zhes bstan ce na /
translated: Moreover, by what cause are they taught to be conceptualization?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because,

original: ji lta ba bzhin yul min bdag / ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin yul min bdag / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúthey do not have a real object.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log tu rtog pas na rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rtog pas na rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are conceptualized in a distorted way, they are called ‚Äúconceptualization.‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the two kinds of conceptualization of grasping, it is said:

analyzed: sems can rdzas dang btags yod par // rnam rtog 'dzin pa dag tu 'dod //
translated: ‚ÄúThe conceptualization of grasping is asserted to be the substantial and imputed existence of sentient beings.‚Äù

analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'phags dbye bas // so sor de dag dgu dag nyid // ces smos te /
