original: de la so so'i skye bo'i rdzas su yod pa'i rten can 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ni gang /
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo'i rdzas su yod pa'i rten can 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ni gang /
translated: The conceptualization of grasping is asserted to be the substantial and imputed existence of sentient beings.

original: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa rab @136b 'byor byang chub sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gang snying po la spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos thams cad dben par bshad pa la mi zhum /
analyzed: kye ma tshe dang ldan pa rab @136b 'byor byang chub sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gang snying po la spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos thams cad dben par bshad pa la mi zhum /
translated: From the beginning,üîΩhe explains that all phenomena, up to and including omniscience, are void, and does not become discouraged.

original: yangs su zhum par me 'gyur ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: yangs su zhum par me 'gyur ba la sogs pas /
translated: He does not become timid.

original: skyes bu rdzas yod pa'i rten can gyi rnam par rtog pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu rdzas yod pa'i rten can gyi rnam par rtog pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is because he has refuted the conception of a person as a substantial existent.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'i shes pa 'di ni so so'i skye bo la yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'i shes pa 'di ni so so'i skye bo la yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Since this knowledge of the selflessness of all phenomena exists for ordinary beings,

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i skabs su bzhag pa dang po 'di ni khyad par ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i skabs su bzhag pa dang po 'di ni khyad par ma yin no zhe na /
translated: this first topic, which is presented as a conception of grasping, is not a distinction.

original: de rnams kyi de kho na nyid yid la byed pa de ni mos pa yid la byed pa yin par 'dir bshad pa'i phyir snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi de kho na nyid yid la byed pa de ni mos pa yid la byed pa yin par 'dir bshad pa'i phyir snying po med pa'o //
translated: Since this mental attention to their suchness is explained here as mental attention to conviction, it is insubstantial.

original: brtags par yod pa 'phags pa'i gang zag gi rten can gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ni gang sems zhum pa de'i rgyu dris pa la /
analyzed: brtags par yod pa 'phags pa'i gang zag gi rten can gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ni gang sems zhum pa de'i rgyu dris pa la /
translated: The second kind of conceptual thought, which is the basis of the noble person and is imputed to exist, is the question about the cause of the mind‚Äôs discouragement.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, it is because all dharmas do not exist‚Äù and so on.

original: gang du skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur bar mi dmigs na su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang du skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur bar mi dmigs na su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur /
translated: ‚ÄúWhere arising, enduring, and changing into something else are not apprehended, who would abide in suchness?

original: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas /
analyzed: su zhig de bzhin nyid la gnas nas /
translated: Who, abiding in suchness,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: would fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?üîΩWho would teach the Dharma?‚Äù

original: chos ston par 'gyur zhes 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad du rnam par rtog pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos ston par 'gyur zhes 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad du rnam par rtog pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the refutation of all conceptual thoughts about the noble person.

original: 'phags pa'ang de lta bu yod de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'ang de lta bu yod de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe noble person is like that.‚Äù

original: dge slong dag mtshan mo 'das nas nang par gyi dus su ngas srog chags ce sbyang sgra 'byin pa'i skad thos so //
analyzed: dge slong dag mtshan mo 'das nas nang par gyi dus su ngas srog chags ce sbyang sgra 'byin pa'i skad thos so //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, after the night had passed, at dawn I heard the cry of a jackal.

original: da bzhin du nga ni de'i tshe de'i dus su ri dags kyi rgyal po seng ge yan lag ma smad pa zhes bya bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: da bzhin du nga ni de'i tshe de'i dus su ri dags kyi rgyal po seng ge yan lag ma smad pa zhes bya bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: At that time, I was the lion, king of beasts, named Ananta-anga.‚Äù

original: tshig de dag ni tha snyad yin gyi /
analyzed: tshig de dag ni tha snyad yin gyi /
translated: These words are conventional,

original: don dam pa ma yin pas snying po med do //
analyzed: don dam pa ma yin pas snying po med do //
translated: not ultimate, and therefore have no essence.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i skabs su bzhag par gyur pa ni khyab pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i skabs su bzhag par gyur pa ni khyab pa can ma yin no //
translated: They are not universal, but are placed in the context of the conception of the grasped.

original: ci'i phyir 'di dag rnam par rtog pa zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di dag rnam par rtog pa zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Why are these called ‚Äúconceptions‚Äù?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: gal te gzung don de bzhin med //
analyzed: gal te gzung don de bzhin med //
translated: If the object of the grasped does not exist,

original: de dag gang gis 'dzin par 'dod //
analyzed: de dag gang gis 'dzin par 'dod //
translated: By what means is the grasper conceived?

original: de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yi //
translated: Thus the nature of the grasper

original: ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Is empty of itself.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa 'di bzhi yang //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa 'di bzhi yang //
translated: Thus these four conceptions

original: @137a * // re re yang rnam pa dgu dgur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: @137a * // re re yang rnam pa dgu dgur shes par bya'o //
translated: Each should be understood as having nine aspects.

original: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po dgu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po dgu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the first nine types of conceptual thought that apprehend?

original: ngo bo nyid rigs de dang ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rigs de dang ni //
translated: Nature, lineage,üîΩComplete accomplishment,üîΩNonerroneous object of observation of knowledge,üîΩAdverse and antidote,

original: kun nas yang dag bsgrub pa dang // shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul dang // mi mthun pa dang gnyen po dang // rang gis rtogs dang byed pa dang // de yi las bya'i 'bras bu la //
analyzed: kun nas yang dag bsgrub pa dang // shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul dang // mi mthun pa dang gnyen po dang // rang gis rtogs dang byed pa dang // de yi las bya'i 'bras bu la //
translated: Realization by oneself, function,üîΩAnd object to be acted upon and effect

original: 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gyi //üîΩrtog pa de ni rnam dgur 'dod //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gyi // rtog pa de ni rnam dgur 'dod //
translated: Of engagement,

original: ces bstan pa la /
analyzed: ces bstan pa la /
translated: That conceptual thought is asserted as ninefold.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni gang /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni gang /
translated: With regard to that, what is the conceptual thought of nature?

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subh≈´ti, what do you think?

original: khyod kyis sgyu ma lta bu'i sems de yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: khyod kyis sgyu ma lta bu'i sems de yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Do you see that mind that is like an illusion?

original: ji ltar dben pas dben pa 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'tshang rgya bar yang mi 'thad pa dang / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //üîΩrab 'byor ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shin tu dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ji ltar dben pas dben pa 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'tshang rgya bar yang mi 'thad pa dang / rab 'byor de de bzhin no // rab 'byor ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shin tu dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is just so.

original: rab 'byor gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben par ma gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben par ma gyur zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, if the perfection of wisdom were not empty,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben par ma gyur na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dben par ma gyur na /
translated: up to if the knowledge of all aspects were not empty,üîΩthen the perfection of wisdom would not be the perfection of wisdom, up to the knowledge of all aspects would not be the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni de'i mtshan nyid can yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni de'i mtshan nyid can yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, it is taught that the perfection of wisdom and so on up to the knowledge of all aspects have the characteristic of perfect complete awakening.

original: de ltar spyod pa ni don zab mo la spyod pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa ni don zab mo la spyod pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that one who practices in that way practices the profound meaning.

original: rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang nam mkha'i dpes rigs su rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang nam mkha'i dpes rigs su rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of a spiritual potential is eliminated by the example of space.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i dpes bsgrub pa'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i dpes bsgrub pa'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of accomplishment is eliminated by the example of a magical creation.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang gzugs brnyan gyi dpes dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang gzugs brnyan gyi dpes dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of an objective referent is eliminated by the example of a reflection.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi dpes gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin @137b no ;
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi dpes gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin @137b no ;
translated: The conception of antidotes and their objects is eliminated by the example of perfect buddhahood.

original: / rang gis rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang de'i dpes rang rang gis rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: / rang gis rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang de'i dpes rang rang gis rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of self-realization is any conception that is stopped by the example of that, respectively.

original: byed pa po'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang de'i sprul pa'i dpes sprul pa'i rigs byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang de'i sprul pa'i dpes sprul pa'i rigs byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: The conception of an agent is any conception that is stopped by the example of the emanation, because the conception of an agent of emanation is stopped.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ring ba dang nye ba bkag pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ring ba dang nye ba bkag pa'i don gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of the distant and near is any conception that is stopped by the example of the emanation, because the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha is stopped.

original: bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i bya ba'i dpes las kyi rnam pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i bya ba'i dpes las kyi rnam pa bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of action is any conception that is stopped by the example of the action of the emanation of the TathƒÅgata, because the nature of action is stopped.

original: bya ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang shing gi 'khrul 'khor gyi dpes bya ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang shing gi 'khrul 'khor gyi dpes bya ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of action and result is eliminated by the example of the machine of wood.

original: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i rnam pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i rnam pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine aspects of the second conception of the apprehended?

original: srid dang zhi bar ltung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: srid dang zhi bar ltung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of falling into existence and peace,

original: rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang ni //
translated: Inferior realization,üîΩNo appropriation,üîΩIncomplete aspects of the path,üîΩGoing by the conditions of others,üîΩWrong purpose,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang // lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang dang // gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang // ched du bya ba log pa dang // nyi tshe ba dang sna tshogs nyid //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang // lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang dang // gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang // ched du bya ba log pa dang // nyi tshe ba dang sna tshogs nyid //
translated: Limited scope, and diversity,üîΩDelusion about the basis and engagement,

original: gnas dang 'jug la rmongs pa dang // rjes la 'gro zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: gnas dang 'jug la rmongs pa dang // rjes la 'gro zhes bya ba la //
translated: And following after,

original: rnam rtog dgu yi bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: rnam rtog dgu yi bdag nyid ni //
translated: These are the nine conceptions.

original: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can te //
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can te //
translated: They are the basis of the opposite,

original: mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin //
translated: Just as it is taught in the sutras.

original: zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa la /
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: de 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung ba zhig tu ltung ba nyid kyis dman pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gling bzhir las byed cing rjes su 'gro'o zhes
analyzed: de 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung ba zhig tu ltung ba nyid kyis dman pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gling bzhir las byed cing rjes su 'gro'o zhes
translated: The conception of inferiority is due to the fear of falling into either cyclic existence or nirvana.

original: bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i shes rab dang snying rje dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa lnga pos 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung bar ltung bar mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i shes rab dang snying rje dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa lnga pos 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung bar ltung bar mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The conception of the sun and moon is due to the fear of falling into either cyclic existence or nirvana due to the five perfections, because the perfection of wisdom and compassion do not let the five perfections fall into either cyclic existence or nirvana.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i dpes rtogs pa ma lus pa la byed pa'i yul shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i dpes rtogs pa ma lus pa la byed pa'i yul shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of the universal emperor is due to the fear of not being able to understand the objects of knowledge, because it is taught that the universal emperor is the lord of all the earth.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang bud med khyim thab med pa'i dpes yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang bud med khyim thab med pa'i dpes yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of possession is due to the fear of not being able to understand the difference between possession and non-possession, because it is taught that the woman without a husband is an example of possession.

original: bsgrub pa ma tshang @138a * //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ma tshang @138a * //
translated: The practice is incomplete.üîΩ

original: ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang g-yul du zhugs pa'i mi dpa' bo'i dpes bsgrub pa'i khyad par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang g-yul du zhugs pa'i mi dpa' bo'i dpes bsgrub pa'i khyad par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of incompleteness is taught by the example of the hero who enters the battle, in order to understand the special achievement.

original: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la /
translated: The conception of going by another's condition is taught by the example of the king who turns the wheel,

original: khams kyi rgyal po rjes su 'brang ba'i dpes rtogs pa'i dbang du gyur pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khams kyi rgyal po rjes su 'brang ba'i dpes rtogs pa'i dbang du gyur pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: who is followed by the kings of the regions, in order to understand the one who is subject to realization.

original: ched du bya ba log pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang chu bo rnams gang g'a'i chu bo dang lhan cig rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i dpes /
analyzed: ched du bya ba log pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang chu bo rnams gang g'a'i chu bo dang lhan cig rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i dpes /
translated: The conception of the wrong object is taught by the example of the rivers which go to the great ocean with the Ganges,üîΩin order to understand the one who is not subject to realization.

original: grogs gtso bo rnams dang lhan cig tu 'gro ba'i tshul gyis phyir mi ldog par 'gro ba dang / theg pa gzhan du 'gro ba med pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ched du bya ba las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: grogs gtso bo rnams dang lhan cig tu 'gro ba'i tshul gyis phyir mi ldog par 'gro ba dang / theg pa gzhan du 'gro ba med pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ched du bya ba las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The non-returner goes in the manner of going together with the principal companions, and because of the absence of going in another vehicle, because of the absence of falling away from the purpose of omniscience.

original: nyi tshe ba byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang skyes bu'i lag pa g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa'i dpes nyi tshe ba ma yin pa'i byed pa shes par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang skyes bu'i lag pa g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa'i dpes nyi tshe ba ma yin pa'i byed pa shes par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conceptualization of limited activity is taught by the example of the right and left hands, in order to show that the activity is not limited.

original: rtogs pa tha dad nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni gang chu klung phra mo dang / chu klung chen po'i chu rnams rgya mtsho chen por phyin na ro gcig par 'gyur ba'i dpes pha rol tu phyin pa lnga de'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa tha dad nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni gang chu klung phra mo dang / chu klung chen po'i chu rnams rgya mtsho chen por phyin na ro gcig par 'gyur ba'i dpes pha rol tu phyin pa lnga de'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conceptualization of different realizations is taught by the example of the waters of small and large rivers becoming of one taste in the great ocean, in order to show that the five perfections become of the same nature as that.

original: gnas pa dang 'jug pa mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang 'khor lo rin po che gnas pa dang / 'gro ba'i dpes gnas pa dang / 'gro ba dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga de'i rjes su 'brang bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa dang 'jug pa mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang 'khor lo rin po che gnas pa dang / 'gro ba'i dpes gnas pa dang / 'gro ba dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga de'i rjes su 'brang bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of non-understanding of abiding and engaging is taught by the example of the precious wheel's abiding and going, in order to understand that abiding and going are the five perfections that follow it.

original: rjes la 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang de nyid dpung gi tshogs kyis mdun du 'gro ba'i dpes de'i rjes su 'brang bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes la 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang de nyid dpung gi tshogs kyis mdun du 'gro ba'i dpes de'i rjes su 'brang bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of following is taught by the example of the army going in front of it, in order to understand that following it is the five perfections.

original: gal te de ltar yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni med do zhes brgal ba la rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni med do zhes brgal ba la rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu
translated: since all phenomena are empty by their very nature, there is no unsurpassed perfect enlightenment through the perfections. In response to this objection, Subh≈´ti says, Here, Subh≈´ti, a great bodhisattva practices the perfection of generosity by not apprehending anything, and so on up to the perfection of wisdom by not apprehending anything.

original: phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe 'di snyam du 'jig rten na gnas pa 'di ni phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste zhes bya ba @138b nas brtsams te /
analyzed: phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe 'di snyam du 'jig rten na gnas pa 'di ni phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste zhes bya ba @138b nas brtsams te /
translated: When practicing the six perfections, one should think, ‚ÄúThis abiding in the world is mistaken,‚Äù and so on.

original: shes rab kyi don gyi dbang ma gtogs par sems can yongs su smin par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi don gyi dbang ma gtogs par sems can yongs su smin par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Except for the power of the meaning of wisdom, it is not possible to ripen beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don gyi lan yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don gyi lan yin no //
translated: Therefore, one practices the perfection of wisdom. This is the answer to the meaning.

original: tha dad du byed pa med pa thams cad las gcig gtso bor gyur pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brgal ba la /
analyzed: tha dad du byed pa med pa thams cad las gcig gtso bor gyur pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brgal ba la /
translated: When it is argued that there is no single principal one among all things that are not differentiated,

original: lus tha dad pa rnams ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi drung du phyin pa'i dpes lnga po de ni khyad par med pa'i thob pa 'dis gtso bor 'thad pa'i lan gyis gsungs la /
analyzed: lus tha dad pa rnams ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi drung du phyin pa'i dpes lnga po de ni khyad par med pa'i thob pa 'dis gtso bor 'thad pa'i lan gyis gsungs la /
translated: the example of the different bodies that reach the king of mountains, Mount Meru, is given. The fifth is the answer that it is tenable that the principal one is obtained by this non-differentiation.

original: yang don rjes su zhugs nas khyad par du shes pa med pas /
analyzed: yang don rjes su zhugs nas khyad par du shes pa med pas /
translated: Moreover, since there is no subsequent engagement with the meaning, there is no knowledge of distinctions.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam pa dang 'brel ba bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa la kun tu spyod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam pa dang 'brel ba bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa la kun tu spyod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning: there is no engagement in the discriminations of the ultimate and the special.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang brdar byas na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang brdar byas na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: But, beginning with ‚ÄúHowever, in terms of worldly convention and conventional expressions,‚Äù

original: bud med rin po che'i dpes dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su bsdus shing mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ga na ba der mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par dgongs pa mchog nyid yin par 'thad pa'i lan gsungs pa yin no
analyzed: bud med rin po che'i dpes dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su bsdus shing mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ga na ba der mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par dgongs pa mchog nyid yin par 'thad pa'i lan gsungs pa yin no
translated: the answer is given, which is reasonable, that the supreme intention is to remain in the presence of the knowledge of all aspects through the method of non-abiding, having gathered all virtuous dharmas, by means of the example of the precious woman.

original: // da ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis po re re zhing dbye ba rnam par dgur 'gyur bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // da ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis po re re zhing dbye ba rnam par dgur 'gyur bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, it should be stated how each of the two discriminations of grasping is divided into nine types.

original: de la re zhig /'dzin pa dang ni 'dong ba dang // yid la byed dang khams gsum ni //
analyzed: de la re zhig /'dzin pa dang ni 'dong ba dang // yid la byed dang khams gsum ni //
translated: Regarding that, first: Grasping, going, mental activity, and the three realms,

original: gsum char nye bar 'brel pa dang // gnas dang mngon bar zhen pa dang // chos kyi dngos po btags pa dang // chags pa dang ni gnyen po dang // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'gro nyams dang // 'dzin pa dang por shes par bya //
analyzed: gsum char nye bar 'brel pa dang // gnas dang mngon bar zhen pa dang // chos kyi dngos po btags pa dang // chags pa dang ni gnyen po dang // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'gro nyams dang // 'dzin pa dang por shes par bya //
translated: And grasping should be understood in order.

original: zhes bya ba la de la 'dzin pa dang thar pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de la 'dzin pa dang thar pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: Among them, the conceptualization of grasping and liberation

original: gang bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang 'dzin pa'am gtong ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang 'dzin pa'am gtong ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: is taught by such passages as, ‚ÄúThe Lord said, ‚ÄòThe perfection of wisdom does not cause any dharma to be grasped or to be given up.‚Äô ‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptualization of mental activity

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la mi byed pas /
translated: is taught by such passages as, ‚ÄúOne should not attend to form, and so on up to one should not attend to the knowledge of all modes.‚Äù

original: yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba nyid kyis yid la byed pa med par dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rnam par 'phel ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid @139a * //üîΩthob par byed pa med pa thal bar 'gyur bas /üîΩgang rab 'byor nam gzugs yid la mi byed ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yongs su ma bzung ma btang ba nyid kyis yid la byed pa med par dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rnam par 'phel ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid @139a * // thob par byed pa med pa thal bar 'gyur bas / gang rab 'byor nam gzugs yid la mi byed ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Translation: The increase of the roots of virtue, the completion of the perfections, and the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects are not tenable if one does not mentally attend to and does not mentally engage with form, etc.

original: de'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: The response to the objection that the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects is not tenable if one does not mentally attend to form, etc., is presented in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, when one does not mentally attend to form‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúone attains the knowledge of all aspects.‚Äù

original: yid la mi byed pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya'o zhes bya ba'i 'thad pa'i lan gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yid la mi byed pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya'o zhes bya ba'i 'thad pa'i lan gyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The response to the objection that the attainment of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is not tenable if one does not mentally attend to form, etc., is presented in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, when one does not mentally attend to form‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúone does not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.‚Äù

original: khams gsum pa dang nye bar 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du de ltar gzugs yid lam bgyis zhes bya ba nas 'dren mar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas khams gang du yang 'dre bar mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi bar du'oüîΩzhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩgnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de ltar spyod pa de /
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang nye bar 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du de ltar gzugs yid lam bgyis zhes bya ba nas 'dren mar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas khams gang du yang 'dre bar mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi bar du'o zhes bstan pa yin no // gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de ltar spyod pa de /
translated: The conception related to the three realms is that which is taught from ‚ÄúBhagavan, why is it that one does not mentally construct form?‚Äù up to ‚Äúone does not become mixed up in any realm due to the mental activity of being mixed up.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yang gnas par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩdngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du mngon bar chags par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yang gnas par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du mngon bar chags par mi 'gyur /
translated: The conception of abiding is that which is taught from ‚ÄúBhagavan, why is it that one does not abide in the perfection of giving?‚Äù up to ‚Äúone does not abide in the knowledge of all aspects.‚Äù

original: mngon bar chags par bya ba'i gnas kyi rgyu nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon bar chags par bya ba'i gnas kyi rgyu nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conception of attachment to things is that which is taught from ‚ÄúBhagavan, why is it that one does not become attached?‚Äù up to ‚Äúbecause there is no basis for attachment.‚Äù

original: dngos por brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems shing zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dngos por brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems shing zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The conceptual thought that investigates entities is from ‚ÄúIf a bodhisattva thinks‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe is not a bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang yang ma gzigs pas 'dogs par ma mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang yang ma gzigs pas 'dogs par ma mdzad do //
translated: Because the TathƒÅgata, not seeing any dharma at all, does not designate anything.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud ba ni rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba brtags par rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud ba ni rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba brtags par rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that what is understood by the TathƒÅgata is distinguished as the expression and the expressed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa med do zhes bya ba dngos po nyid du'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa med do zhes bya ba dngos po nyid du'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the TathƒÅgata has not fully awakened to any dharma at all. The meaning is that it is not an entity.

original: de ltar mngon bar zhen pa la spyod pa las nyams pa'i tshig gis na mngon par zhen pa med pa gtsor bya bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mngon bar zhen pa la spyod pa las nyams pa'i tshig gis na mngon par zhen pa med pa gtsor bya bar shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in order to show that one should understand that the absence of attachment is primary, the phrase ‚Äúdeterioration from practice due to such manifest clinging‚Äù is taught.

original: chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa na gang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na ji ltar sbyin @139b pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i skyon 'di dag ma mchis par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa na gang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na ji ltar sbyin @139b pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i skyon 'di dag ma mchis par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: When there is the conceptualization of attachment, it is said, ‚ÄúBlessed One, when bodhisattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, how do they avoid these faults of generosity and so on?‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gang gi tshe 'di ltar chos thams cad la chags pa med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi tshe 'di ltar chos thams cad la chags pa med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med par shes pa yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, when one knows in this way that all phenomena are without attachment and without grasping.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi chos rnams de la dmigs pa dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi chos rnams de la dmigs pa dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The conceptualization of the antidote is that which takes as its object the phenomena that are the side of the antidote and, in terms of sameness,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar de dang ma bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar de dang ma bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because they are not separated from the perfection of wisdom up to the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe conceptualization that is an obstacle to going as one wishes is when the object of observation and the observer are not distinguished.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba la thogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa dag dbyer med pas mngon par rtogs pa bsgrub pa med na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba la thogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa dag dbyer med pas mngon par rtogs pa bsgrub pa med na /
translated: If there is no accomplishment of clear realization,üîΩthen it follows that there is no clear realization and no accomplishment.

original: mngon bar rtogs pa dang / mngon bar sgrub pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs zhe'am /üîΩ'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: mngon bar rtogs pa dang / mngon bar sgrub pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs zhe'am / 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: Therefore, Subh≈´ti, if bodhisattva great beings think, ‚ÄúThis is form,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThis is form,‚Äù

original: 'di'i gzugs so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di'i gzugs so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is the form of that,‚Äù

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ji ltar 'dod par 'gro ba'i dpes pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam du ji ltar 'dod par 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i bar gyis rjes su 'brang ba gzhan dbang yin pa'i phyir ro zhes
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ji ltar 'dod par 'gro ba'i dpes pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam du ji ltar 'dod par 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i bar gyis rjes su 'brang ba gzhan dbang yin pa'i phyir ro zhes
translated: The example of the universal monarch going wherever he wishes illustrates the five perfections, because they are the cause for going wherever one wishes on the path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: da ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgu pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgu pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the second of the nine conceptions of apprehender,üîΩit is said:üîΩNot going as intended,üîΩdetermining the path to be not the path,üîΩbirth with cessation,üîΩpossessing entities and not possessing,

original: ched bzhin nges par mi 'byung dang // lam la lam min nges 'dzin dang // 'gog dang bcas pa'i skye ba dang // dngos po ldan dang mi ldan dang ; / gnas dang rigs ni 'jig pa dang // don du gnyer dang rgyu med dang //üîΩphyir rgol ba ni dmigs pa la //
analyzed: ched bzhin nges par mi 'byung dang // lam la lam min nges 'dzin dang // 'gog dang bcas pa'i skye ba dang // dngos po ldan dang mi ldan dang ; / gnas dang rigs ni 'jig pa dang // don du gnyer dang rgyu med dang // phyir rgol ba ni dmigs pa la //
translated: destruction of abodes and lineages,üîΩpursuing objects and no cause,üîΩand the object of refutation

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gzhan yin no //
translated: are the other conceptions of apprehender.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: ched du bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang kha lo bsgyur ba'i dpes /
analyzed: ched du bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang kha lo bsgyur ba'i dpes /
translated: The conception of the path as the path is that which is illustrated by the example of the charioteer,

original: de dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam mchog gis rab tu khrid pa des rang dbang du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam mchog gis rab tu khrid pa des rang dbang du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: because he leads them by the supreme path to omniscience, and because he makes them independent.

original: lam la lam ma yin par nges par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam dang / rnam pa thams @140a * //üîΩcad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ni /
analyzed: lam la lam ma yin par nges par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam dang / rnam pa thams @140a * // cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ni /
translated: The conception of the path as not the path is that which is illustrated by the example of the thieves,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam ma yin pa dang lam yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam ma yin pa dang lam yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: because the path to omniscience is not the path of the bodhisattvas.

original: skye ba dang / 'gog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'gog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: The conception of origination and cessation is that which is illustrated by the example of the boat,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning from ‚ÄúThis perfection of wisdom, ≈öƒÅriputra, has been set forth for the great purpose of the bodhisattva great beings.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni skye ba ma yin 'gog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos nyid tshad mar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni skye ba ma yin 'gog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos nyid tshad mar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is neither produced nor stopped.

original: de lta na ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yod par mi 'dod par mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yod par mi 'dod par mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If one does not accept the existence of the six perfections in that way, one does not accept the existence of the perfections at all.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs par byas nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs par byas nas /
translated: Having taken the knowledge of all aspects as the object,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
translated: having made common cause with all those roots of virtue,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo zhing /
translated: one dedicates them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa'i rnam par bsgoms pas /
analyzed: 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa'i rnam par bsgoms pas /
translated: By meditating on the three spheres as non-apprehensible,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la mngon par brtson par yang dag par brtson pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la mngon par brtson par yang dag par brtson pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: one is truly striving to apply oneself to the six perfections.

original: dngos po dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de'i rgyu yongs su zhus nas /
analyzed: dngos po dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de'i rgyu yongs su zhus nas /
translated: The conception of being endowed with things and not being endowed with things is the question about the cause of that.

original: lan bka' stsal pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: lan bka' stsal pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Starting from the answer,

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ldan pa bkag pas mngon par brtson par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ldan pa bkag pas mngon par brtson par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The negation of the connection between form and the knowledge of all aspects shows that one should be diligent.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya ste /
translated: The conceptualization of abiding in form, etc. is the thought that one should be diligent in abiding in form, etc. up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar te /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar te /
translated: Form, etc. up to the knowledge of all aspects

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum char ni gang na yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum char ni gang na yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: all three knowledges do not abide anywhere. This is the demonstration of the logical possibility.

original: rigs rnam par 'jig pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang aa mra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i dpes /
analyzed: rigs rnam par 'jig pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang aa mra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i dpes /
translated: The conceptualization of the destruction of the family is the thought that the family of the three vehicles is destroyed, due to the example of the fruit of the mango, etc.

original: chos rnam par mi 'jig par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnam par mi 'jig par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that one should know that phenomena are not destroyed.

original: don du mi gnyer ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang chos thams cad kyi bar la dbang du gyur pa thob par 'dod pas /
analyzed: don du mi gnyer ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang chos thams cad kyi bar la dbang du gyur pa thob par 'dod pas /
translated: The conception of non-pursuit is that which, by the desire to attain mastery over all phenomena,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par @140b bya ba nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par @140b bya ba nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: teaches that one should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rgyu med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrgya mtsho chen po ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi rin po che thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i dpes /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang de ci'i phyir zhe na / rgya mtsho chen po ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi rin po che thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i dpes /
translated: The conception of causelessness is that which, when it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'phags pa'i gang zag gis rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i 'thad pas so zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩphyir rgol ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang 'phong gi slob dpon gyi dpes /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'phags pa'i gang zag gis rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i 'thad pas so zhes bstan pa yin no // phyir rgol ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang yang 'phong gi slob dpon gyi dpes /
translated: teaches that the perfection of wisdom is the cause for the realization of the noble persons, by the example of the great ocean being the cause of all the jewels of Jambudvipa.

original: phyir rgol ba'i chos thub par dka' bar ston cing /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'i chos thub par dka' bar ston cing /
translated: The conception of the opponent‚Äôs doctrine is that which, by the example of the master of archery, teaches that the opponent‚Äôs doctrine is difficult to overcome.

original: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi dmigs pa'i rnam par dgongs pa mdzad pa dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis po'i gnyen po'i phyogs shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi dmigs pa'i rnam par dgongs pa mdzad pa dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis po'i gnyen po'i phyogs shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the bodhisattva who practices non-apprehension is considered by all the Buddhas in terms of non-apprehension, and in order to know the antidote to the two kinds of apprehension, i.e.

original: mu bzhi las dang po ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: mu bzhi las dang po ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: The first alternative is the conceptualization of the apprehended,

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dag go //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dag go //
translated: but not the conceptualization of the apprehender, i.e. the objects such as form, etc.

original: gnyis pa ni rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gcig go //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gcig go //
translated: The second is a single moment of consciousness.

original: gsum pa ni rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan no //
translated: The third is another moment of consciousness.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the perfection of wisdom free from those aspects.

original: rigs gnyis yin la /
analyzed: rigs gnyis yin la /
translated: It is twofold,

original: rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshig phyi ma can no //
analyzed: rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshig phyi ma can no //
translated: but not the conceptualization of the family, i.e. the subsequent phrase.

original: gang de las re zhig rigs kyi rnam pa de nyid rigs yin no //
analyzed: gang de las re zhig rigs kyi rnam pa de nyid rigs yin no //
translated: That is the type of family that is a family.

original: 'di ltar 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gnyen po'i phyogs yang dag par rtogs pa'i dus ni rigs te /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs yang dag par rtogs pa'i dus ni rigs te /
translated: The time of the realization of the antidote is the family.

original: de rigs nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de rigs nyid yin gyi /
translated: That is the family itself.

original: rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the conceptualization of the family.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:üîΩThe time that is not the realization is the mere family.üîΩIt is the conceptualization of the realization,

original: yang dag par rtogs pa'i dus ma yin pa ni rigs tsam nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa'i dus ma yin pa ni rigs tsam nyid do //
translated: but not the conceptualization of the object.üîΩIt is like this:

original: yang dag par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: The time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:

original: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa ni tshig snga ma can no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa ni tshig snga ma can no //
translated: The time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:

original: gang de las re zhig yang dag par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: gang de las re zhig yang dag par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: The time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:üîΩThe time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'ang yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'ang yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:üîΩThe time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:üîΩThe time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:üîΩThe time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:üîΩThe time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:üîΩThe time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:üîΩThe time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:üîΩThe time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:üîΩThe time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:üîΩThe time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:

original: yang dag par rtogs par byed pa ni dmigs pa la yang sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs par byed pa ni dmigs pa la yang sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.üîΩIt is like this:

original: yang dag par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: The time that is the realization and the conceptualization of the object is the conceptualization of the realization.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa ni 'di @141a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa ni 'di @141a * //
translated: It is like this

original: ltar dmigs pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: ltar dmigs pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the object is not fully realized.

original: phyogs 'dis lhag ma rnams kyang rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis lhag ma rnams kyang rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: By this method, the rest should be inferred.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa mthong pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa mthong pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: The summit is the explanation of the path of insight, which is the antidote to the obscurations.

original: // / yang ci'i phyir de la mthong ba'i lam du 'dod ce na /
analyzed: // / yang ci'i phyir de la mthong ba'i lam du 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it called the path of insight?

original: byang chub chen po thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub chen po thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the attainment of great enlightenment.

original: de thob pa yang rgyu gsum gyis yin te /
analyzed: de thob pa yang rgyu gsum gyis yin te /
translated: And that attainment is due to three causes.üîΩThe three causes are: teaching enlightenment to others,

original: yang rgyu gsum ni byang chub gzhan la ston pa dang zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: yang rgyu gsum ni byang chub gzhan la ston pa dang zhes smos pa ni /
translated: as it is said:

original: gang bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab la /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab la /
translated: The Lord said: ‚ÄúSubhuti, the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po de dag ni dka' ba bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po de dag ni dka' ba bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The great beings are difficult to find, who course in this deep perfection of wisdom, who experience it, who take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, and master it.

original: mthong ba'i lam thob pa dge slong brgya drug cu lung bstan pa nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam thob pa dge slong brgya drug cu lung bstan pa nyid kyis so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The prediction of the attainment of the path of insight by the six hundred monks is taught.

original: de'i rgyu ni yongs su gtod dang zhes bya ba ni gang 'phags pa kun dga' bo la de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mang du gtad pas gsungs so zhes zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni yongs su gtod dang zhes bya ba ni gang 'phags pa kun dga' bo la de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mang du gtad pas gsungs so zhes zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The cause of that is ‚Äútotal entrusting,‚Äù which is taught by the statement ‚ÄúI entrust this perfection of wisdom to you, ƒÄnanda.‚Äù

original: de'i mdo ni kun dga' bo ngas khyod la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su gtad do //
analyzed: de'i mdo ni kun dga' bo ngas khyod la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su gtad do //
translated: The s≈´tra says, ‚ÄúƒÄnanda, I entrust this perfection of wisdom to you.

original: ci nas phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma'i dus su rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci nas phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma'i dus su rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In this way it will spread in the future during the period of the final five hundred years.‚Äù

original: de thob par chad med pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: de thob par chad med pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of its attainment is

original: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of much merit.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur cing /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúWhatever sentient beings there are in the worlds of the great trichiliocosm who have attained the fruit of an arhat‚Äù

original: de dag la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dper bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de dag la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dper bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: is an example of the merit that comes from giving and so on.

original: rgya cher skad cig dang yud tsam dang / thang cig tsam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos ston par byed pa bsod nams mang du 'phel lo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgya cher skad cig dang yud tsam dang / thang cig tsam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos ston par byed pa bsod nams mang du 'phel lo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that one who teaches the perfection of wisdom for just a moment, a short time, or an instant, would have much more merit.

original: skad cig la sogs pa smos pas ni go rims bzhin du gang zag dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang / tha ma shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skad cig la sogs pa smos pas ni go rims bzhin du gang zag dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang / tha ma shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: By mentioning a moment and so on, one should understand the sharp, medium, and low faculties of the person, respectively.

original: bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa 'dir skad cig mar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa 'dir skad cig mar shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, a moment should be understood as the completion of an action,

original: tha snyad gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a single convention.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa mthong bar 'gyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul mngon du mdzad pa'i dpes ni rnam par rtog pa rnams ni mthong ba'i lam gyi ye shes kyi yul ma yin pa nyid du shes @141b par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa mthong bar 'gyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul mngon du mdzad pa'i dpes ni rnam par rtog pa rnams ni mthong ba'i lam gyi ye shes kyi yul ma yin pa nyid du shes @141b par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By the example of the manifestation of the miraculous power of seeing Akshobhya Tathagata, one should understand that conceptual thoughts are not the object of the wisdom of the path of seeing.

original: de ltar na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rgyu ni gsum po de dag yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rgyu ni gsum po de dag yin no //
translated: Thus, these three are the causes for attaining perfect enlightenment.

original: yang byang chub chen po zhes bya ba 'di gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang byang chub chen po zhes bya ba 'di gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is this so-called great enlightenment?

original: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'i //
analyzed: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'i //
translated: The knowledge of extinction and non-arisingüîΩis called enlightenment.

original: zhes bstan pa la /

The knowledge of non-arising is the non-arising of suffering.üîΩThe knowledge of extinction is the extinction of defilements. The knowledge of non-arising is the non-arising of suffering.

original: bden par mtshon pa'i ljags rgya chen po bstan nas /
analyzed: bden par mtshon pa'i ljags rgya chen po bstan nas /
translated: He displays a broad tongue indicating the truth,

original: 'phags pa kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa la sogs par nges par sbyor ba dang / de gzung pas gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad gzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa la sogs par nges par sbyor ba dang / de gzung pas gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad gzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and he definitely connects the noble Ananda with the teaching of the perfection of wisdom, etc., and by his retention of that, with the retention of all the doors of concentration.

original: yang ji ltar na mi zad pa'i rnam pa zag pa shes pa yin zhing dngos po 'jig pa'i rnam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na mi zad pa'i rnam pa zag pa shes pa yin zhing dngos po 'jig pa'i rnam pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the aspect of non-exhaustion the knowledge of defilement, and the aspect of the destruction of things?

original: gang gi phyir sbyor ba'i dus kyang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyor ba'i dus kyang /
translated: Because at the time of application,

original: rab 'byor gzugs mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs mi zad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subhuti, you should accomplish the perfection of wisdom by the inexhaustibility of form, etc.

original: snying po byang chub la 'dug pa'i ma 'dres pa'i chos te /
analyzed: snying po byang chub la 'dug pa'i ma 'dres pa'i chos te /
translated: up to the unique qualities of sitting at the site of enlightenment,

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas mngon par bsgrub par rnam par blta ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa nam mkha' ltar zad mi shes pas mngon par bsgrub par rnam par blta ba ni /
translated: seeing the accomplishment as like space, inexhaustible through dependent origination,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thugs su chud pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thugs su chud pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he has realized the gnosis of omniscience.

original: de ltar lta ba ni bdag dang / chos thams cad du 'dzin pa spangs pas mthong ba'i lam gsal bar bsten pa'i don dang / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i la ni pha dang ma shi ba'i skyes bu'i dpes bdud rnams kyi rang gi spyod yul las 'da' bar sems pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba ni bdag dang / chos thams cad du 'dzin pa spangs pas mthong ba'i lam gsal bar bsten pa'i don dang / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i la ni pha dang ma shi ba'i skyes bu'i dpes bdud rnams kyi rang gi spyod yul las 'da' bar sems pa dang /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the verse is that the view is the path of seeing, which is the basis for the clear illumination of the abandonment of the grasping of self and all phenomena, and that the demons think that the bodhisattva who practices in that way has gone beyond their own sphere of activity, using the example of a person whose parents have died,

original: mya ngan gyi zug rdu zug pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na zad pa dang / mi @142a * //üîΩskye ba shes pas ni gang yang zad pa'am /
analyzed: mya ngan gyi zug rdu zug pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na zad pa dang / mi @142a * // skye ba shes pas ni gang yang zad pa'am /
translated: because he is pierced by the dart of sorrow.üîΩSince that is the case, the knowledge of elimination and nonarising do not eliminate anything or

original: mi skye ba med pas /
analyzed: mi skye ba med pas /

original: 'gag pa med pa'i rang bzhin la //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa'i rang bzhin la //

original: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //üîΩrnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni // rnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
translated: is there in the path called ‚Äúseeing‚Äù?üîΩWhat kind of nonarising

original: skye med rnam pa ci zhig 'thob //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: skye med rnam pa ci zhig 'thob //üîΩces bya ba la /

original: dngos po gang 'jig pa la dgongs nas zad pa la ni zad pa shes pa yin ba zad pa shes zhes brjod la /üîΩma 'ongs pa'i dngos po mi skye ba la dgongs nas mi skye ba shes pa zhes bstan pa de la ci zhig ni zad pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po gang 'jig pa la dgongs nas zad pa la ni zad pa shes pa yin ba zad pa shes zhes brjod la / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po mi skye ba la dgongs nas mi skye ba shes pa zhes bstan pa de la ci zhig ni zad pa'am /
translated: The knowledge of elimination is stated to be the knowledge of elimination, intending the elimination of any entity.üîΩThe knowledge of nonarising is stated intending the nonarising of future entities.üîΩüîΩWhat is elimination?

original: mi skye ba med pa ni ci zhig 'thob ces dris pa yin no //
analyzed: mi skye ba med pa ni ci zhig 'thob ces dris pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of elimination is the knowledge of elimination that is intended with regard to the elimination of any entity. The knowledge of nonarising is taught as the knowledge of nonarising that is intended with regard to the nonarising of future entities.  What is eliminated?  What is obtained?  What is the nonarising of what?

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩchos rnams kyang yod ces bya ba dang / shes bya la yang sgrib zad par //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / chos rnams kyang yod ces bya ba dang / shes bya la yang sgrib zad par //
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩThe existence of phenomena and the elimination of obscurations

original: ston pa gzhan gyi brjod pa gang //
analyzed: ston pa gzhan gyi brjod pa gang //
translated: with regard to objects of knowledge are taught by the Buddha.

original: 'di la kho bos mtshar du rtsis //üîΩzhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: 'di la kho bos mtshar du rtsis // zhes bstan pa la /
translated: I find this to be amazing in this system.

original: des na 'di nyid kho na legs pa yin te /üîΩ'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
analyzed: des na 'di nyid kho na legs pa yin te / 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
translated: Therefore this alone is correct:üîΩThere is nothing to be eliminated in this.

original: gzhag par bya ba cung zad med //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba cung zad med //
translated: There is nothing to be established.

original: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta /
analyzed: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta /
translated: See reality as it is.

original: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you see reality, you are liberated.

original: skad cig ma gcig po 'di ni mthong ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig po 'di ni mthong ba'i lam yin te /
translated: This single moment is the path of seeing.

original: de'i phyir / sbyin la sogs pa re re la //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sbyin la sogs pa re re la //
translated: In each of generosity and so on,

original: de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang //
translated: whatever is included in each other,

original: skad cig gcig gi bzod pa yis //
analyzed: skad cig gcig gi bzod pa yis //
